WordPress is an online, open source website creation tool written in PHP. According to many non-geeks, it's probably the easiest and most powerful blogging and website content management system (or CMS) in existence today.

For over 12 years WordPress has revolutionized the way websites are built and currently powers over 75 million websites.

During this workshop you will learn how to create and publish posts and pages; customize your site with themes, widgets, and custom menus; and extend WordPress even further with plugins. You will learn how to the get most out of your self-hosted version of WordPress and create feature-rich blogs and websites.

results.description:
Maximize your potential with Russian Martial Arts!

CONQUER THE FEAR of a violent encounter.

INCREASE YOUR STRIKING POWER and learn practical self defense methods that will work ANYTIME, ANYWHERE


Develop a STRONG, FLEXIBLE, MOBILE PHYSIQUE and MENTAL FOCUS that will carry over into every aspect of your life.


Learn all this and much, much more at NJ RMA Self Defense Group, the official Meetup Group of System of Combat NJ.  Start your SPRING with with Russian Martial Arts, your first class is FREE.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1tm6NW32NdI


Enjoy your first class for free and after that, it is only $10 per class with discounts available for pre-payment. No contract required! Classes are held at 7:00pm on Tuesday and Thursday evenings at the YMHA OF UNION on 501 Green Lane, Union, NJ 07083.

About Us

If you are interested in Systema, Reality Based Self Defense,  Martial Arts, Grappling, Street Defense, or Mobility and Body Awareness, this is the Meetup Group for you.  Men and women, seasoned martial artists and raw beginners alike will benefit from our dynamic classes which are tailored to the level and needs of the students. We focus on providing comprehensive instruction, plenty of personal attention and a relaxed atmosphere where you can train at your own pace and intensity. Individual classes are fast-paced and varied, ranging in subject from striking mechanics, grappling and ground fighting, evasive movement, weapon defense, sparring, and dealing with multiple attackers to women's self defense and street safety.
Copyright © 2013 System of Combat NJ                                   

About Systema

Systema is a combat style based on ancient Slavic fighting methods which were collected and codified by the Russian Soviet special forces.  It is a devastatingly effective and versatile combative program that can easily stand alone, or augment your existing practice.  The overarching focus is on responding to a threat spontaneously with natural, instinctive movement which strengthens and restores the body, clarifies the mind, and provides a framework for healthy, safe, life-long activity 

About the instructor 

Jim has over 25 years of martial arts experience in various styles including Brazilian Jiu-jitsu (BJJ), Silat, Boxing, Mixed Martial Arts (MMA) and Karate.  He is certified to teach Systema by Alex Wilkie (Alex Wilkie's Martial Arts Academy).

Directions

When you arrive, let the front desk know you are there for the martial arts class and they will direct you. (You do not have to be a Y-member to attend this class).  For general inquiries or more information, message organizers Jimi D or Drew here on the Meetup page.  If you need to reach the instructor, Jim, for any reason, call

results.description:
Sleep now my child

The moon’s rising high

The mother is watching

Her babes where they lie

She’s guarding them closely

In their warm bed

From the wolf and the whisper

And the call of the dead


The liar’s house is fallen, its walls crumbled into ruin and the cellars lost beneath the Magrevian forest. Tase Popov and Grunger must deliver the body of their fallen Paladin to the temple at Grotse Delchev, and tell of the hero who gave his life to protect a family's souls. Meanwhile, beneath the earth Anorrah Eolorahn and Damian are lost in the dark cellars, their vampiric guide departed without them. But they too seek the most northern town of Magrevia, and the secrets it holds for them. As for Stel, who knows what dreams she has, caught in the Seelie dreaming?


In the foothills of the Buchen mountains Grotse Delchev sits, the snows settling on its roofs. Centurion Marcellus Divarus paces the walls and thinks of events three years hence, when he and his men were trapped in that ancient hall. For a moment he pauses to consider the fate of his strange companions, but he has more pressing concerns. A scouting party have just returned, and with them news that chills his blood. 

The province of Magrevia is a land of dark shadows and deep forests. A century before, the Empire of Thyatis sent its troops, intent on adding the region to its dominion. Today, the Thyatians stay within their outposts, still unable to penetrate the wild lands that surround them. The Magrevian people continue to dwell in the communities that have sheltered them for generations, their doors and windows closed tight each night against the darkness. 

A child’s lullaby is a storyline for 5th edition Dungeons and Dragons, for characters of 3-5th level. The focus is on solving mysteries, and the challenge of surviving the horror surrounding you.
results.name: D&D 5E - A Child's Lullaby by Tom Gilbert

Futsal Pick up games (intermediate to advanced level)

Fee: $10 dollars per player per game; pay through paypal.

Only 10 players per game, no subs. One game is 55-60 minutes. Be early. Every player rotates as a Goalie for 6 minutes, timed with an electronic scoreboard. We play without a break. Regulation size goals with nets. Futsal ball. Please make sure to bring a white and a red t-shirt, indoor shoes. Games are competitive, but friendly. Please keep in mind that these games are definitely not for the beginners. 

No fouls, zero tolerance to this. “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game”. Minimum physical contact means fewer injuries and no violence. No charging, no displacing with your arms or body to gain the position on the ball. No running into the opponent. Play the ball, not the player. Time it, don’t foul it. 

Refunds/credit: Cancel your RSVP 24 hours or more before the game and we will make the refund, please provide the Paypal Transaction ID: 18D76937M[masked]R No refund for late cancelations; no exceptions. 

Name of the school William J. O’Shea (100W 77th street): The school entrance is located on West 77th street between Columbus and Amsterdam avenues (pretty much in the middle of the block) on the south side of the street. You'll see a row of 5-6 metal doors, check for pictures. the door is closed but unlocked, report to our security and go to the second floor. 

For questions: Use the MEETUP message and notifications tools.

results.description:
RSVP (FREE) and more information: risingoceans.eventbrite.com

With all the doom and gloom surrounding the topic of sea level rise, it seems that most of the US will be under water by tomorrow. But what does scientific data show in regards to this increasing trend? At this Pint of Science event we will dive into the scientific evidence behind sea level projections and consider the implications of rising oceans for coastal communities, like NYC. Dr. Philip Orton will explain how scientists gauge sea levels and predict at-risk flood zones. Dr. Sergio Jarillo de la Torre will give insight into how rising sea levels are already creating environmental refugees globally. So before you start looking into real estate in Kansas, join us for a pint and learn the facts about sea level rise!

**Pint of Science is a global science initiative that aims to bring scientists out of the lab and into the informal atmosphere of a bar. So, come drink a beer (or two!), make a friend, and feed your science curiosity!**

https://pintofscience.us/
results.name: Pint of Science presents: Oceans Rising

results.description:
We write unit tests, feature tests and even behavior tests for the websites and apps that we work on. But how do we ensure that changes to our Sass/CSS don't introduce unintended visual bugs into our app?

This talk explains Visual Regression Testing, why it is important, and how we've used it at PolicyGenius to ensure that we can confidently change our stylesheets without stressing about unintended style changes leaking into our app.

Speaker Ian Yamey will cover automated tests, visual diffs, headless browsers, and more! For full details check out his talk submission here.

About the Speaker:


Ian Yamey is the CTO of PolicyGenius, finding consumer-first ways to simplify shopping for insurance online.

Find him here:


Twitter: @ianyamey 

GitHub: ianyamey

Website: policygenius.com

Huge shout out to our meetup host ThoughtWorks for providing their amazing space!

results.name: Spot the difference: Visual Regression Testing for your Sass

results.description:
Our Tuesday night Central Park training workouts are typically tempo runs or hill repeats.  These workouts are usually very well attended with a wide variety of paces.

The meeting spot is at the 72nd street transverse by Bethesda Fountain. There we'll give the full workout details, including distance, pacing groups, expected run time, and where we plan on meeting at the end. You can expect a typical workout to be between 5 and 8 miles (or less during hill workouts).

A note on warm ups: We do not do a full warm up as a group in Central Park, so we encourage you to show up at 7 p.m. having jogged an easy mile or two ahead of time.

If it's your first time meeting us, feel free to come a few minutes early with any questions.  There are many other groups who meet on 72nd St so look for the one with folks in Whippet singlets.

Please note that there is no place to store bags inside Central Park. Pack light, or store your bags at a nearby gym if you are a member. Another option is the New York Running Company at the Time Warner Center, which stays open until 9pm: http://www.therunningcompany.net/new-yorks-homepage

results.description:
Pictorial Photographers of America (PPA) is open to photographers - professional, amateur, and beginner - of all levels. Founded by Clarence H. White in 1916, it is one of NYC's oldest photography clubs. One meeting per month is usually a presentation by a photo professional, and one is a members' competition (digital and print categories) critiqued and judged by a professional.

We meet at 7:00OPM on the 2nd and 4th Tuesdays of the month at 346 West 20th Street (between 8th& 9th), St. Peter’s Church Rectory in Chelsea.

The next meeting will be a presentation by Doug Scwab on the Tuesday, April 26th at 7:00PM.

Doug Schwab, born in 1946, in Orange, New Jersey, is a quintessential self- taught photographer who began his journey into the photographic life as early as age ten when he started to experiment with film processing and printing. By age 13, he was already a constant presence in his own darkroom, developing and sharpening his printing skills on the enlarger he’d bought with money saved from a paper route. His early passion then led him to study graphic arts in high school and to work in the printing industry, which he followed upon graduation with a six-year position in a commercial studio in Newark, NJ, and then as staff photographer with the ITT Corporation in Nutley, NJ, a position he held for eight years.

In the later 1970’s, Schwab began his formal education in photography at New York City’s School of Visual Arts and The New School for Social Research. At The New School, Schwab studied with renowned photographers George Tice and Lisette Modell, whom he befriended and continued to study privately with her up until her death in 1982.

Professionally during this time, Schwab taught photography at New York City’s famed Germain  School of Photography, and later became a well known black and white printer for Photographics Unlimited in the heart of New York’s Photo District. 

The 1990’s brought a time of artistic reevaluation for Schwab. In an attempt to more deeply explore photography as an art form, Schwab studied figure drawing at the Art Students League, and painting, sculpture, and printmaking at Brooklyn College where he earned both his Bachelor’s and Master of Fine Art degrees. It was here, at Brooklyn College, that he developed his current interest in historical photographic processes. Doug Schwab taught photography as an adjunct professor at Kingsborough Community College for many years, as well as at Adelphi University, and Pratt Institute. Currently, Schwab is a Tenured Assistant Professor of Photography at Brooklyn College. He has also had the recent good fortune to collaborate with Robert Gurbo, Curator for the Estate of Andre Kertesz, as a prepress digital editor for two books by Robert Gurbo of Kertesz’s work, Andre Kertesz: The Polaroids, and Andre Kertesz. On Reading, by Robert Gurbo. Both books published by W. W. Norton.

You can contact us at: [masked].

Please email us if you are attending.

Please ring the bell when you arrive.

Visitors are very welcome.

SPECIAL ANNOUNCEMENT!:
WE ARE CELEBRATING OUR 100th ANNIVERSARY THIS YEAR. WE WILL BE HAVING AN EXHIBITION IN WILLIAMBERG BROOKLYN IN SEPTEMBER.

If you join the club now you will be able to participate in the exhibition. Dues are $75.00. Student Membership is $40.00. Your dues will be paid through June 2017. We also have offer a life time membership for $750.00.

We look forward to seeing you at the meeting

results.description:
Dorothy Cummings will call a lovely program of English country dance with live musical accompaniment by Liza Wu, Paul Friedman, and Helen White!

Come dance to a live caller and band with Country Dance New York.  We are an intergenerational, multiethnic, smoke and alcohol free, inclusive community with one thing in common:  we love to contra and English country dance!

English country dance is choreographed community dancing, with repertoire ranging from court dances of the 1650s through dances composed this year. If you’ve seen any of the Jane Austen movies, you’ve glimpsed some kinds of ECD.

Please bring a pair of clean, soft soled shoes {no spike heels} to dance in, and a water bottle.  We ask that you not use strongly scented grooming products as the smell can become overwhelming on the dance floor when things start to heat up.

Country Dance New York has been hosting contra dances most Saturdays, and English country dancing most Tuesdays, at Church of the Village for almost 70 years.   COV is located at 201 W. 13 St., on the northwest corner of 7th Avenue.

Beginners' session on Saturdays {for contra} is from 7:30 to 8:00.  Dancing for all from 8:00 until 10:45.  Hang out with us at a local diner after the dance.

Beginner's session on Tuesdays {for ECD} is from 7:00 to 7:30.  Dancing for all from 7:30 to 10:30.

Cost:  $15 for general public; $12 members and for full time students with ID.  Be sure to tell the people at the door if this is your first time dancing with us.  They will give you a free pass to return as our guest!

To see what contra dancing looks like, click here:

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mM5vNzFxxBs

To see what English country dancing looks like, click here:

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rB40AvJnMUY

Join us on Facebook:  https://www.facebook.com/groups/2449906414/

For a complete schedule of our upcoming season, and for more information, visit our website.

See you on the dance floor!
results.how_to_find_us: Take the ACE, 1,2,3, L or F train to 14th St. We are on the northwest corner of 13th Street and 7th Avenue. Street address is 201 W. 13th.
results.name: English Country Dance with Dorothy Cummings

results.description:
Thanks to all who could make last night's talk - Responsibility. During our talk and reading, we reflected upon what it means to be The Light of the World.  

Please RSVP before Tuesday, 4/26 to attend our next meeting.


From Lesson 61


Who is the light of the world except God's Son? This, then, is merely a statement of the truth about yourself. It is the opposite of a statement of pride, of arrogance, or of self-deception. It does not describe the self-concept you have made. It does not refer to any of the characteristics with which you have endowed your idols. It refers to you as you were created by God. It simply states the truth.


We hope you'll join us this coming Tuesday at 7pm to remember this eternal light.
results.name: ACIM - You Are The Light of the World

Your chance to learn how to Dance Tango is FINALLY here! (And to have Fun & make friends!) 

Bring your partner or just come by yourself.

This is an introductory Tango course to learn the basics so you get a good taste of it. Come with good energy to Have Fun & Make Friends!

When: TUESDAYS

Time: 7:00 to 8:00 pm (60 minutes class). Then, we go out for drinks!

Location: Adelante Studios: 25 W 31st street, New York, NY  (Lots of trains, even the Path)

Price for the course: 

Drop-in: $22 online OR $25 at the door (per hour, per person).

Month: $80 for 4 consecutive weeks ($20/class). <--- Best option.

Write me if you have questions.

Best,

Laura :-D

-------------------------------------

Where Are The Classes Taught?

Adelante Studios: 

25 W 31st street
New York, NY 10001
(Lots of trains, even the Path). 2nd Floor, studio 1.


How Do I Get There?

Lots of trains and buses near by. Even the PATH if you live in NJ. 

What Should I Wear?

Wear comfortable clothing (except pajamas :-D). Women can bring something sexy if they wish and shoes that slide easily with a closed heel like strap or full heel (no sandals neither flip-flops type)

Men need also shoes that slide easily. You should not wear any shoes with rubber soles. Almost anything but sneakers.


HOPE YOU CAN JOIN US! 
Cheers,

Laura

We'll be taking over the space at 7:00 sharp, and the evening should be in full swing by 7:10!  (Latecomers are still welcome, of course.)

Writers, if you're bringing something to present, don't forget to bring ample COMPLETE and IDENTICAL copies of the scene(s) --- one copy for each actor you'll need, plus one copy for a reader of any stage directions.  (And if you're able to provide character descriptions in the form of a breakdown appended as page 1 --- that's never a bad idea. :))

Actors, come ready to read!

results.description:
Agenda 


7:00pm - 7:30pm:  Networking | Food | Drink  

7:30pm - 8:30pm:  Speakers 
  •  Talk 1: How Go is used at Uber
  •  Talk 2: Go and Uber's time series database, M3.

8:30pm - 9:00pm: More Networking | More Food | More Drink


Talk 1: How Go is used at Uber

Prashant Varanasi will talk about how Go is used at Uber, covering their infrastructure, open source libraries such as TChannel and Ringpop, and how these have been used in their Go marketplace services.

About the speaker:

Prashant is a Senior Software Engineer at Uber and works on the RPC team, building Go client libraries for Uber's open source network transport, TChannel, and the new Uber fleetwide routing and load balancing sidecar. On the side, he helps maintain internal Go libraries and build infrastructure.


Prior to joining Uber, he worked at Google where he launched Helpouts using Go and App Engine. 

Talk 2: Go and Uber's time series database, M3.

Rob Skillington will provide a deep Dive on M3 - Uber's time series database, ingestion pipeline and query service built almost exclusively in Go. A small team of engineers in NYC began early work on it in 2015 and today it powers all of Uber's realtime monitoring, alerting and unsupervised infrastructure.

About the speaker:

Rob is a Senior Software Engineer at Uber where has worked on the core dispatch team, the network edge team and currently on the Observability team scaling M3, Uber's in house TSDB, that drives monitoring, alerting and unsupervised infrastructure.  Also in his spare time he tinkers with Jetstream, a skunkworks open source MVVM synchronization framework from Uber.
results.name: Go: An Uber Use Case

results.description:
Let's get together one more time -- My movers will have taken all furniture and cooking tools so I must go out for dinner!  Let's meet at Ku Asian Bistro in Bronxille at 7:00 for some great sushi and other Asian delicacies... I'll make a reservation for 10 and increase it if needed.. THIS WILL BE THE LAST/FINAL MEETUP FOR THIS GROUP! 

The cuisine at Ku Asian Bistro is as flavorful as it is colorful. Between its rainbow-striped maki rolls, swirls of inky sauce, and tropical-flower garnishes, each and every dish arrives at tables in a vibrant glow. Chefs pull influences from all over the eponymous continent, offering smoked duck alongside innovative, overstuffed sushi rolls and authentic shrimp bowls brimming with beans and chunks of coconut.


Ku Asian Bistro is a cornerstone in the Bronxville community and has been recognized for its outstanding Asian cuisine, excellent service and friendly staff.

Our Asian restaurant is known for its modern interpretation of classic dishes and its insistence on only using high quality fresh ingredients.

Comments by other diners include: 'Just ordered delivery for the first time from Ku. Literally ordered Chinese, Japanese - sushi, and Thai - tom yum soup. I know... 3 entirely different styles but I was hungry and undecided. 


The delivery wasn't great because the woman on the phone didn't spell my address correctly but otherwise not a big deal once I started eating. 


The sushi - delicious! Seafood tasted fresh, flavors on point. 


Tom yum soup - extra spicy as it should be with massive shrimp.


Sesame chicken - for my boyfriend but I still had a bite... Crispy not soggy. Great taste and with really huge portions for a 12.00 order. Honestly this is my new go to for everything Asian in the area.'

Delicious! I've been here a handful of times now and every time has been great. The sushi is fantastic and tastes very fresh. I also love their special rolls. I would say Tiger roll and Halloween are my favorite....soooo good. Everyone that works here is very pleasant and the restaurant is clean and inviting. We came for my mom's birthday and they put together a wonderful sushi boat that was delicious and beautiful. They also do a fried ice cream tempura dessert with banana tempura for birthdays and it's very good. Definitely a place I'll keep going back to.

Very good fresh sushi， Tuna love roll  is amazing and house special tuna tartar is unbeatable.
results.name: Last minute dinner meetup! Asian/Sushi = Bronxville

results.description:
PAST LIFE REGRESSION with ROSEMARIE CAPPIELLO

**Prepay is required to secure your reservation. Limited to 10 registrants.

Please pay via Paypal or mail your payment of $50.00 to:

Julie Connor 64 Theo. Roosevelt Dr., Blauvelt, NY 10913

Ever wonder who you were in a past life?  Or if experiences from another lifetime are affecting you now?  Do you have unexplained fears or phobias? Chronic illnesses or pains that can’t be treated or diagnosed?  Do you have an unexplainable affinity to a culture or time in history?  Do you have repetitive dreams of other time frames where you are not the same person you are now? Or have you been to places that are very familiar even if it is the first time you were there?  These are past life memories resurfacing in current time.

Recalling information and energy from other life experiences can instantly change the reality and experiences of your current life.  Illnesses, phobias, anxieties and pain miraculously vanish, relationships heal and transform and financial troubles sometimes disappear.  These revealing sessions, done in groups or privately, can help you access the information and insight that will set you free.  

Join us this day for this transformational and life changing workshop/ meditation and access parts of your SELF that you did not know existed.

Bring a blanket and pillow to allow for a relaxing and healing experience.


Bergen County Author---RoseMarie Rubinetti Cappiello

Intuitive/Medium/Healer, Hospice Trained Grief volunteer, Ordained Spiritual Minister, Certified Hypnotherapist, Yoga Instructor, Reiki Attuned, BS Physical Education MSU

Author of Speaking From Spirit

Trained by the best teachers from Arthur Findlay College in England, RoseMarie is a gifted Medium/Intuitive/Healer who has worked professionally in this capacity since 2000.  She has connected many people to their loved ones in Spirit through thousands of private medium readings and platform medium demonstrations throughout NJ, NY and Conn.  She feels completely privileged and blessed to do this work.  Many people claim their lives change dramatically after having a reading with her and that the weight of grief and sadness significantly decreases.

RoseMarie lives in Lyndhurst  NJ with her husband John, children and two dogs, Marco and Ruby. She is an adjunct at a Montclair State Univeristy in the Physical Education Dept
results.name: Past Life Regression with RoseMarie Rubinetti Cappiello

******PLEASE NOTE: TGI FRIDAYS CLOSES AT MIDNIGHT, SO LET'S ALL MAKE SURE TO BE OUT BEFORE THEN & NOT OVERSTAY OUR WELCOME.******


Come join us for our weekly Boardgaming Meetup.

We're a friendly group of gamers that play everything from Carcassonne & Ticket to Ride to Zombicide & heavier Eurogames! Everyone is welcome - all ages (must be over 21) but must be young at heart!

If you don't recognize the games, don't worry, everyone is happy to teach new players the rules.

We usually go for about 3-4 hours but people drop in any time and leave when they need to. If you're looking for a chill, fun way to spend a Tuesday night - come!

To support our gracious hosts, you MUST purchase a bite to eat or a few drinks (soda is fine!).

If anyone has a specific game they wish to play, feel free to ask. I am sure between us all, we should have it.

We also have a Facebook group. Everyone in the Meetup is welcome. Just click the link and ask to join. Someone will add you once they can.

Forest Hills Board Gamers Facebook Group
results.name: Tuesday Night Weekly Game Night at TGIF

results.description:
A Course in Miracles Healing Clinic at CRS
 Mon. & Tue. 7 – 7:40 pm
Sun 1 – 2 pm (12 – 1 pm on 2nd Sun of the month)
Suggested donation $20. No one is turned away.

Bring any issue you are facing right now — physically, emotionally, mentally, and/or spiritually. With eyes closed (you will be seated and a healer will stand nearby; no touching is involved), a CRS healer, trained in A Course in Miracles and spiritual reading/healing, will observe you with his inner sight, free of any judgments, as your truly are, a perfect shining spirit. Together, will ask the Holy Spirit (or Inner Guide if you prefer) to bring us directly to whatever seed thought is causing your current issues and ask for guidance about how your spirit really wants to make use of your present situation for its growth and sharing of love. After about 10 minutes of meditation, we will share the inspirational guidance that we receive. 

Aside from sharing the message that we receive from the Holy Spirit, we don't talk during this meetup event. We share healing quietly and provide you with an opportunity to come to rest, reflect, and remember who you truly are, in a supportive, non-judgmental, meditative environment.

We'd like to offer you an opportunity to experience stillness of mind and peace so that you can return to harmony with your true nature and purpose. Then you will find that rather than needing "solutions" to "problems" you will realize that you have no problems except those that you project.

We call this spiritual healing but it is not religious nor connected with any church or group. It is simply a practice of meditating together on our true nature and connecting with universal spirit/energy or what you will.

A Note About the Role of Words in Healing: "Strictly speaking, words play no part at all in healing. The motivating factor is prayer, or asking. What you ask for you receive. But this refers to the prayer of the heart, not to the words you use in praying. Sometimes the words and the prayer are contradictory; sometimes they agree. It does not matter. God does not understand words, for they were made by separated minds to keep them in the illusion of separation. Words can be helpful, particularly for the beginner, in helping concentration and facilitating the exclusion, or at least the control, of extraneous thoughts. Let us not forget, however, that words are but symbols of symbols. They are thus twice removed from reality...." — A Course in Miracles Manual for Teachers, Section 21

"Since only the mind can be sick, only the mind can be healed. Only the mind is in need of healing." —"PSYCHOTHERAPY: Purpose, Process and Practice,"Supplements to A Course in Miracles

results.description:
Open Office Hours

Meeting every Tuesday evening, 7:00PM - 10:00PM

This month's host: Hayes Law Firm & Big Apple Py

Office hours is open to developers of any background and skill level. Newcomers to programming, Python, or NYC are all welcome, as well as experienced programmers and locals. The purpose of this event is to promote learning and community involvement within the NYC Python community.

Activities vary and may include (but are not limited to):

Informal tech talks: Topics can be anything related to Python or programming. Have a topic you'd like to see presented? Leave a comment starting with "Talk topic suggestion". Want to present? Message the organizers.

Technical discussions: Bring your code and / or questions about any relevant topic, and there will most likely be someone present who can help. For questions about a specific topic, please leave a comment in the form of "Need help with Django / Nginx / SQL". If you're able to help with a particular topic, please leave a comment in the form of "Can help with Flask / Apache / NoSQL".

Note: Recruiting and other solicitation are not allowed at these events. These are run for developers by developers. Behavior that makes others uncomfortable will not be tolerated, and offenders will be asked to leave.

Profuse thanks go to our sponsors for loaning us this space and providing refreshments.

Thank you, and see you Tuesday night!
results.name: Tuesday Office Hours

results.description:
In this group, you'll learn new ways of communicating in order to share more vulnerably and openly, bring attention more fully to the present in order to discover the nuance and richness of connection, and begin to see and co-explore aspects of yourself you may have been unaware of before in service of greater self-understanding, expression and awareness. You'll have the opportunity to learn and use new tools to participate in circles by sharing yourself, understanding others, and growing in both enjoyment of and capacity for presence and deep connection.

The more Ive seen people Circle the more genuine, authentic relationships Ive seen become possible for them.

The more Ive seen people Circle the more I've seen them become comfortable in their own skin, get clear on what their feeling, wanting or needing in any moment, and grow in their natural presence and love for others.

If connecting profoundly with others, developing present moment awareness, and learning new communication skills inspires you, come try Circling out! The cost is $25 for one session or a bundle of 4 sessions for $80 that includes a one on one Circling conversation with the facilitator.

results.description:
“Anything you want to ask a teacher, ask yourself, and wait for the answer in silence.” ~ Byron Katie 

Our stress is caused by our stressful thoughts about life, not by life itself.  That is wonderful news!

The Work can support you in any difficulty or transition. If you would like to  do The Work or learn about this radical self-inquiry  and how to apply it in your life, please join me.  You will find peace and freedom on the other side.

All topics are welcome.

The Work consists of  four questions and turnarounds:

The four questions are:

1) Is it true?

2) Can you absolutely know that it’s true?

3) How do you react, what happens, when you believe that thought? 

4) Who would you be without the thought?

Turnarounds: Could the opposite be as true? Turn the statement around to the opposite, to the self, and to the other. This is a way of experiencing the opposite of what you believe.

www.thework.com

Byron Katie videos:

https://www.youtube.com/user/TheWorkofBK

Look forward to seeing you!


Olga Berg

Certified Facilitator of The Work

www.olgaberg.me
results.how_to_find_us: 1,2, 3 to West 72nd St.
results.name: The way to find clarity  though inquiry

group.name: The Work of Byron Katie Manhattan UWS

results.description:
Relationships are central to living “the good life.” Most of us want to find ways to improve our relationships – including with partners, children, parents, other family, friends, people at work or in our communities. We can connect more empathically and authentically with the people in our lives through learning new skills and approaches in communication. 


The old joke about how to get to Carnegie Hall – “practice, practice, practice” – is also true of improving our ability to connect with other people in our lives. Most of us don’t unlearn old habits and learn new ones by going to a short class or reading a book! A communications practice group combines learning new skills with – yes – practicing them. 


We’ll learn more about how to both express our own needs in ways we’re more likely to be heard, and listen for the needs others are expressing — even when they’re speaking in ways we find it difficult to hear them. We’ll practice how to handle conflicts in our lives with comfort, courage and confidence, instead of avoiding conflicts or approaching them with force. Taking in feedback on our own attempts and giving feedback to others is part of the practice process.

 
Using ideas and methods based on the Nonviolent Communication™ (NVC) process developed by Marshall Rosenberg, we will learn to connect more authentically with those in our lives. Our group will be facilitated by Marty Epstein, facilitator of workshops and small groups with Nonviolent Communication™. 


All levels of learning and experience welcome. Books on Nonviolent Communication™ (NVC) will be available for purchase at the sessions for those who find that kind of study helpful. 


Suggested donation: $10-$25 per session. (If that’s a stretch for your budget, come anyway, and pay what you would enjoy contributing to help make these sessions possible.) 


When, where and how often: We’ll meet twice a month on Thursday evenings from 7 to 9 pm. We’ll meet at the Riverdale-Yonkers Society for Ethical Culture, which is sponsoring this program as part of our mission to inspire people to live more humanely, respecting the worth of every person. 


More information: email [masked] if you have questions or concerns you’d like answered. 


“All that has been integrated into NVC has been known for centuries about consciousness, language, communication skills, and use of power that enable us to maintain a perspective of empathy for ourselves and others, even under trying conditions.” — Marshall B. Rosenberg, Ph.D.

results.description:
Technical Overview of Functional Programming

An ACGNJ Java Users Group Presentation by Barry Burd

This talk is an overview of the concepts typically used in functional programming. These concepts include pure functions, immutability, referential transparency, pattern matching, lambdas, currying, sections, map, filter, fold, list comprehension, lazy evaluation, higher-order functions, polymorphism, and monads. Some of these concepts are the basis for features in Java 8, but many aren't.

results.description:
This event is proudly brought to you by Soccer Beyond!

Learn more on SoccerBeyond.com or Facebook.com/SoccerBeyond.

Details - Fun, interactive, effective.

60min. This is a Coed Soccer Lesson covering soccer techniques for passing, receiving, dribbling, turning, and much more. 

Please bring your own ball. Sneakers, running and turf shoes are fine. Bring some water or sports drink and maybe sun blocker. Please note our Waiver of Liability and 24hr Cancellation Policy below. More details follow.


Rain or Shine - If you don't hear from us, the session is on!

Our sessions will be held as scheduled if weather allows. Thunder or snow and ice are among the reasons for sessions to be canceled/ moved. BUT: Don't make assumptions - you will always get notified if a class is canceled/ moved. As the weather changes quickly in NYC, occasionally we may make the final decision about 90min prior to session start. If you don't hear from us, the session is on!

Cancelled/ Moved Sessions - You will always get notified!

Every time we have to cancel a session, if possible, we move it to the same day and time of the following week. In this case, all players keep their spots. Please email us prior to the rescheduled event, if you can't make and wish a refund or credit. The 24 hours cancellation policy applies. You will always get notified if a class is canceled/ moved.

Requesting a Refund

To request a refund 1) change your status to "not going" and 2) send us a note with the Paypal transaction number related to the payment for the respective session. Refunds are processed once a week - please be patient.


24 Hours Cancellation Policy

results.description:
Come join the NJ Young Sierans' Club, Nice in New Jersey, NJ/NY Writers & Artists, Let's Hang Out New Jersey, and Montclair Friends for a night of good friends, fun games, great conversation, and creative fun.  In addition to comfy couches and awesome tea, Trend invites us to bring our own board games, has an open mic performance stage, has FREE WIFI in their store that works very well, so please come with laptops if you'd like.

We hope to see you there!

7:00 - Socialize and meet each other
7:20 - Introductions
7:30 - Join us in gaming, socializing some more, writing, drawing, working, or just continue to chat


WHERE: Trend Cafe, Bloomfield Avenue, Montclair, NJ.  

Writers & Artists Session (for those interested)


Meets every week - if interested in joining up with our weekly writers and artists group, they meet here tonight too, and will be joining in for the fun!  You'll feel better showing up because you'll make friends and get something done. No one will see what you've done , or give you unsolicited advice.  Shut Up and Write! (or illustrate) is a place to create in the company of others on a regular basis. Writing (and art), whether as a profession or as a hobby, is an isolating activity.  We provide these meetings as a way of developing a community of creative people. We welcome people who are serious about their craft, or just having trouble staying focused or looking to get started, and are looking for the companionship of other writers.

It's always an empowering and rewarding experience. You will see progress in your writing or creative project with friends and while having fun.  After everyone's socialized and had a nice time getting to know each other for about half an hour, the facilitator will lead introductions and possibly discuss personal creative successes such as getting published or overcoming resistance in some small way.  No critiquing, exercises, lectures, ego, competition or feeling guilty.


Suggested Donation:   $1 to help cover meetup costs.

results.description:
Everyone said they had a good time, so let's do it again.

If you're  looking to get out and try something different, may I suggest coming out and playing Trivia Quiz.

We have had a very nice group of regulars that have been participating and are always looking for more people to join us.

It is free to play and there is no Meetup fee for this event. So give it a try. And if you're coming right from work The Garth Road Inn does serve food...very Reasonable and Good.

The Garth Road Inn has been serving the Scarsdale community for many years.  It's comfortable, affordable & centrally located.



**There will be a prize for the winning team!**

 
And there will also be bonus questions where a team can win stuff!!

Bring your friends or you can join other Meetup members to form a team.

It's a great opportunity to use all that information you have acquired over the years.  *_*


There will be an entertaining mix of questions!

Let's get those brain cells working & have some FUN!!!

There are 5 rounds
Questions are read off and each team writes down the answers....it's a team effort!

****All are welcome to attend!****

 
And there are always people from the Pub itself playing, we will be joining in on the FUN!

I look forward to seeing you there! *_*

The Place: Mediterranean-Italian plates presented in farmhouse quarters with an atmospheric wine cellar. Spots will be assigned within 24 hours.

http://www.ilbuco.com/


RSVPs: Please do not RSVP No. You only need to RSVP if you want to come to the event.

Please don't RSVP unless you are sure you can go. I notice the people who RSVP and then cancel, which is not fair to everyone else. I reserve the right to give priority to people who don't do this in the future. I'm not trying to be mean but it makes it much harder for me when people take spots and then cancel either quickly or last minute. Obviously more notice is better, but please try to only sign up (for waitlist as well) if you know you can come. 

Even if the meetup is full, please put your name on the waitlist. I will let you know if a spot becomes available. Also, if there are a lot of people on the waitlist, it lets me know which kind of restaurants are popular so that I may schedule more of those in the future.

Please note that meetup events are strictly for members. No +1s are allowed as reservations are made in advance and spots are assigned. First time members must confirm in writing that they will attend. Individuals that are no shows are immediately banned from the group. Thanks.

results.description:
As SPOLIN-IST Players we are starting our training sessions that are open to players of all levels. Players who continue training will have the chance to be a part of the company. If you're interested in joining please contact ASAP, do not wait till the last minute.

In these workshops we will explore Viola Spolin's improvisation technique following her book; Improvisation for The Theater. Known as the "grandmother of improvisation", Spolin's games are fun, inclusive and open to both actors and non-actors. Spolin's approach is about releasing one’s creativity through spontaneity and sense of game playing. The work is used by actors, writers, directors, teachers, and many others seeking creativity and the sense of “play” in their lives. 

SPOLIN-IST PLAYERS will start performing Spolin based Improvisation Shows in Fall 2016.

Viola Spolin along with her son Paul Sills and his actor friends like Mike Nichols, Elaine May founded the first improvisation company (Compass Players) in mid 1950s in Chicago. Later in 1959 Second City started with Sills and Spolin, and Spolin started to gather her life's work into her seminal book "Improvisation for the Theater". In 1988 Paul Sills and Mike Nichols founded The New Actors Workshop, a two year acting conservatory in New York City that our founder/coach Ege Maltepe has graduated from. Alongside her work as an actor/writer/director Maltepe is translating Spolin's Improvisation For The Theater into Turkish. 

SPOLIN-IST PLAYERS WORKSHOPS

WHEN : ​Tuesdays; ​April ​26, May ​3​, 10, 1​7​ ; 7pm - 10pm

WHERE : Alchemical Studios - STUDIO B

Director/Sidecoach: Ege Maltepe

FEE : $27 per class


SIGN UP via PayPal; [masked]

CONTACT: [masked]


More info:

www.spolinist.com/newyork

https://spolinist.com/whos-who

www.egemaltepe.com

www.violaspolin.org
results.name: SPOLIN-IST PLAYERS TRAINING SESSIONS

results.description:
TNYA is a water polo team for LGBT and LGBT friendly players. To play in these practices you must be a member of New York Recreation (same pass as BK Wets practices Metropolitan): 

http://www.nycgovparks.org/programs/recreation-centers/membership 

You must bring a lock and a swim cap. We swim, then drill, then scrimmage. Coaching rotates over time, but Jeff and Bob are currently active coaches. 

In the winter, the first hour is working out on land and getting technical instruction in the second floor studio. The second hour is in the pool. 

TNYA Water Polo also has practices at John Jay Sunday from 6:00 – 7:30 pm. For full information on the team, please go to 

www.tnya.org

It's difficult to start playing water polo with no prior experience. We recommend everyone be able to swim a hundred yards in under two minutes and be familiar with the rules and basic strategy outlined here: 

http://www.tnya.org/wp-content/uploads/2014/07/Polo_Beginners.pdf

We strive to create a positive and welcoming environment and do not tolerate any unsportsmanlike conduct.

results.name: TNYA Intermediate Water Polo

results.description:
Futsal Pick up games (intermediate to advanced level)

Fee: $10 dollars per player per game; pay through paypal.

Only 10 players per game, no subs. One game is 55-60 minutes. Be early. Every player rotates as a Goalie for 6 minutes, time it with an electronic scoreboard. We play without a break. Regulation size goals with nets. Futsal ball. Please make sure to bring a white and a red t-shirt, indoor shoes. Games are competitive, but friendly. Please keep in mind that these games are definitely not for the beginners. 

No fouls, zero tolerance to this. “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game”. Minimum physical contact means fewer injuries and no violence. No charging, no displacing with your arms or body to gain the position on the ball. No running into the opponent. Play the ball, not the player. Time it, don’t foul it. 

Refunds: Cancel your RSVP 24 hours or more before the game and we will make the refund. No refund for late cancelations; no exceptions. 

Name of the school William J. O’Shea (100W): The school entrance is located on West 77th street between Columbus and Amsterdam avenues (pretty much in the middle of the block) on the south side of the street. You'll see a row of 5-6 metal doors. Open the door or ring the buzzer (on your right), Please wait and someone will open the door for you.  the court is on the second floor. 

For questions: Use the MEETUP message and notifications tools. 

Post pictures and videos at:

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/Futsalacrossamerica?ref=hl

Twitter: https://twitter.com/FutsalAcrossA

Thank you for being part of Futsal Across America.

Enjoy the game!

results.description: We all use electricity. How much do we need? Where does it come from? Where SHOULD it come from? Who controls where it comes from? There are many answers depending on which state agency or utility answers those questions and they don't always have our best interests in mind. On the next episode of Eco-Logic, we'll try to make some sense of it all. Joining me will be Annie Wilson of the National Lawyers Guild Environmental Law and Justice Project, Jim Learning of Grande Riverkeeper in Labrador and Roger Witherspoon of the Society of Environmental Journalists.

results.description:
Come and join us for an evening of fun and TurnOn. How often do we get an opportunity to be real with each other in NYC?

We play 3 communication game (you can play at whatever level feels comfortable to you). Imagine meeting new people in an environment where people felt comfortable to be themselves. That's what we have created.

It's a refreshing change from the typical networking or bar conversation.

You get the opportunity to examine yourself. Through other people putting quality attention on you, asking questions with genuine curiosity, and then listening - really listening – to your responses.

What comes up might surprise you!

At the end of the evening we will tell you all about how you can learn the practice of Orgasmic Meditation. What class you can take and what we have to offer so you can have the life that you want.

It's amazing how connected we can end up feeling - even in a room full of strangers - when we are willing to say what's real. In an hour and some you may even forget for a moment you are in New York City.

OneTaste NYC is an organization teaches Orgasmic Meditation, otherwise known as OM. The games we play at TurnON are designed to create the visceral sensation of Orgasm/OM in your body, without having to actually do the practice (or remove any clothing!).

It's a friendly invitation to play and push your edges in a way that feels good. This allows you to stretch yourself and inspires self-discovery!

Come early, doors close at 8:40p. COST TO ATTEND IS $10.

For questions contact [masked] |[masked]


Can't make this one? Visit us at www.turnonny.us

results.description:
Futsal Pick up games (intermediate to advanced level)

Fee: $10 dollars per player per game; pay through paypal.

Only 10 players per game, no subs. One game is 55-60 minutes. Be early. Every player rotates as a Goalie for 6 minutes, time it with an electronic scoreboard. We play without a break. Regulation size goals with nets. Futsal ball. Please make sure to bring a white and a red t-shirt, indoor shoes. Games are competitive, but friendly. Please keep in mind that these games are definitely not for the beginners. 

No fouls, zero tolerance to this. “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game”. Minimum physical contact means fewer injuries and no violence. No charging, no displacing with your arms or body to gain the position on the ball. No running into the opponent. Play the ball, not the player. Time it, don’t foul it. 

Refunds: Cancel your RSVP 24 hours or more before the game and we will make the refund. No refund for late cancelations; no exceptions. 

Name of the school William J. O’Shea (100W): The school entrance is located on West 77th street between Columbus and Amsterdam avenues (pretty much in the middle of the block) on the south side of the street. You'll see a row of 5-6 metal doors. Open the door or ring the buzzer (on your right), Please wait and someone will open the door for you.  the court is on the second floor. 

For questions: Use the MEETUP message and notifications tools. 

Post pictures and videos at:

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/Futsalacrossamerica?ref=hl

Twitter: https://twitter.com/FutsalAcrossA

Thank you for being part of Futsal Across America.

Enjoy the game!

results.description:
First BNI chapter in Hoboken, New Jersey - Come and network! We are currently seeking new members and can only have one person per profession/category. Lock out your competition before it’s too late!

Now, more than ever, business people need to network to stay in business. BNI provides a positive, supportive, and structured environment to exchange quality business referrals. BNI is the largest business networking organization in the world. We offer members the opportunity to share ideas, contacts and most importantly, business referrals.

Last year Members of BNI passed thousands of referrals, which generated over $4 billion dollars of business for members! BNI is a business and professional referral organization that allows only one person from each profession to join a chapter.

Belonging to BNI is like having dozens of sales people working for you because all the other members carry several copies of your business cards around with them. When they meet someone who could use your products or services they hand your card out and recommend your services. It's as simple as that! It's simple because it's based on the proven concept of "what goes around, comes around." If I help you, you'll help me and we will both benefit as a result. Would you like to increase your business by 20%, 30%, 50% or as much as 100%? You can see results like this! Many have. Some participants have added as many as 50 new clients in the first 2 years!!!

Are you our next success story? RSVP to our next meeting!

Current Location: 
Malibu Diner 
257 14th St, 
Hoboken, NJ 07030 
Cost: $12/visitor (breakfast included)

The meeting starts at 7:00am and is officially over at 8:30am.

Join us as Arnie Salkin, Director Consultant of BNI explains the importance of social media and your business.  BNI takes word of mouth referrals to an entirely new level. If you're committed to growing your business by helping support other business owners in our local community, BNI is for you. Only one person can represent each industry so they get the exclusive referrals for their business. Everyone is welcome to visit our new chapter that is launching here in Dana Point. Hope to see you soon!
BNI's (Business Network International) Mission is to help members increase their business through a structured, positive and professional word-of-mouth program that enables them to develop long-term, meaningful relationships with quality business professionals. We are looking to support and build local businesses in our communities through helping each other.


Business owners, managers, and salespeople learn about each other's business and we share referrals.  First time attending? Enjoy breakfast on us!


Now, more than ever, business people need to network to stay in business. BNI Crossroads provides a positive, supportive, and structured environment to share ideas, contacts, and business referrals.

To avoid conflict, BNI chapters are allowed to have only one professional per profession - which mean that each of our members represents a specific category of business, effectively locking out the competition. With over 180,000 members worldwide, BNI is the largest business networking organization in the world. Last year alone, BNI generated 6.6 million referrals resulting in $8.6 billion dollars' worth of business for its members. We offer members the opportunity to share ideas, contacts and most importantly, business referrals.  Check out to see if your profession is currently taken at the following link: http://www.bninewjersey.com/chapterdetails.php?chapterId=1636&t=db3907f9cf60c71add464fcce0eddcfde87cc619cfe76e34c4aa5cb439f60347&name=BNI%20BNI%20Crossroads

results.description:
Professionals Exchanging Ideas and Referrals (PEIR), is an independent networking group of business professionals dedicated to the business growth and success of each of our members.  We meet in Berkeley Heights, NJ; our members represent businesses from the surrounding 15 mile radius. 

We are currently seeking new affiliates in business categories not represented by our present membership.  Note - we are not about handing out business cards, but rather we are about building trusted business relationships and sharing business acumen.  Think networking PLUS a mastermind  group.  Please "opt-out" if not serious about a long-term professional relationship.

• We generally meet on the 2nd and 4th Wednesday mornings of the month (8:30am to 10:00am) with periodic evening networking and social events.

• We expect regular attendance at meetings, but understand that business (and life) will occasionally “trump” your attendance. 

• We seek legitimate business referrals and opportunities, and recognize these do not arise weekly.  Members should be “givers” as well as “takers”. 

• Our semi-annual dues are utilized for networking and member-only presentations and development. 

The following business areas are currently represented:

• Insurance – Property, Casualty & Life

• Mortgage Broker - Residential & Commercial

• Financial Advisor – Planning, Investments, Life, LTD, & LTC, Employee Benefits

• Residential Realtor

• Attorney – Business /  Real Estate / Estate Planning

• Web Design / e-Marketing / Graphic Design

• Title Insurance – Residential/Commercial

• Property Restoration -  Fire, Water, Smoke

• Interior Design -  residential & commercial

Examples of businesses we are seeking to join us (not all-inclusive):

Architect - Banking -  Business Consultant – Commercial Lender - Commercial Realtor - Contractor - CPA/Tax Practitioner - Florist – Handyman – Health & Fitness Professionals - Photographer – Printer - Recruiter

results.description:
Please join Starta Accelerator on Wednesday, April 27, to meet six innovative startups, building the businesses of tomorrow. All six companies are part of the Starta Accelerator that kicked off in January.


Follow the link to register https://www.eventbrite.com/e/starta-accelerator-demo-day-tickets-22171956920 We look forward to seeing you there!

Agenda: 

8:30 am - Doors Open
8:30-9:30 am Registration and Breakfast
9:30-10:00 am Welcome Speech
10:00-11:30 am Presentations + Q&A
11:30 am-1:00 pm Networking

Meet Starta's first cohort companies:

GeoCV is a mobile app for 3D capturing the world. The company has raised $700K from five investors. GeoCV has graduated from Rothenberg Ventures River – the first acceleration program for the fastest growing startups in virtual reality and frontier technologies. The company has started building partnerships with Google, Intel and other strategic partners, which drive the 3D ecosystem.

JetHunter is an online platform that provides the most convenient way to book a private jet for both B2C and B2B clients. More than 300 airlines have already joined JetHunter with total fleet of more than 1,200 aircrafts. This is why JetHunter can provide the best auction results quickly. To date, the company has raised $400K. Navigine is an enterprise platform for IT solution providers who need simple tools to create precise indoor navigation and tracking solutions. Navigine has raised seed funding in total of $350K with over 70 locations where the platform is rolled out and over $100K in sales in 2015.

Online Patent provides the full scope of service in supporting the intellectual property protection, including submission of applications to register intellectual property items, patent searches and trademark check, maintenance of the existing titles of protection and their prolongation and support all over the world.

Healbe is a health wearables company that is dedicated to making people’s lives happier, healthier, and easier by providing the most comprehensive information from your body, delivered to your smartphone.

«Vote!» is a crowdsourced social forecasting platform that allows users to predict the news outcomes. These predictions ("the wisdom of crowds" indicator) provide insights on the global and corporate events for people who can benefit from such data and insights in the financial markets, politics or sports. This platform outruns the news. Special thanks to Microsoft for hosting the event.

results.description:
Hey, Brick Oven Bakers!

Please volunteer to help build the core of the new Old Stone House community oven, fireplace, and hearth from start to finish, and learn the secrets of brick oven construction from professional oven mason Pat Manley.

This Meetup is now FREE. Space is limited because only 8 people can work on the oven efficiently at once. So if you RSVP "yes" and then can't make it, please change your RSVP to "no" so someone else can get a spot.


No prior masonry experience needed.

We're building the core of the oven from Wednesday, April 27, through Monday, May 2.

Please volunteer for as many (or as few) days as you can make it, on any combination of days. The more you help, the more you'll learn!

Every day you'll get to:


- Participate in building the core of the oven and hearth 
- Learn about materials, masonry techniques, and oven engineering
- Ask lots of questions and take photos of the process 
- Learn from Pat's over twenty years of oven-building experience 
- Hang out with Pat over beer in the evenings

Different stages of the process will occur on different days, including: groundwork, the base slab, framing the door and arch, laying the door and arch, oven insulation, and facing. We'll also be laying the fireplace and hearth. You'll get to work on different parts of the process depending on which days you attend.

You should plan to wear closed-toe shoes -- wear boots if possible -- and bring work gloves and a bottle of water. We'll provide snacks! This is an all-day event, so you should plan to bring lunch, or you can get lunch from one of the great local shops and restaurants around the park.

About the Mason

Pat has over twenty years of experience building brick ovens for restaurants, bakeries, vineyards, and backyards all over the country, and has taught dozens of oven-building workshops to beginners and professionals. And every year Pat leads Masons on a Mission to build masonry stoves in Guatemala.


Whether you want to build your own backyard oven, or work in a bakery, or just want to learn a new skill, this is a great learning opportunity!

results.description:
Success breeds success. There is nothing like achieving a goal to make you feel good and want to achieve more.  Small action steps completed regularly will take you closer to where you want to be.  Will Rogers said it best: "You may be on the right track but you will get run over if you just sit there!" 

Toastmasters has helped over 4 million members in 116 countries improve their speaking and leadership skills. 

Toastmasters has helped us and it can help you too. Why not attend a meeting and see for yourself?

What's the biggest benefit you may receive from Toastmasters?

The ability to speak with confidence before a large audience

The ability to overcome nervous butterflies and focus on the goal of my presentation

I've learned how to conduct an effective business meeting

More confidence to speak in public, even in impromptu situations

More comfortable speaking in front of a group

Being able to more effectively share the things I've learned with others

Greater self-confidence because of Toastmasters' encouraging feedback

The opportunity to meet new people in a fun and friendly atmosphere

More confidence and a greater ability to think on my feet

A feeling of accomplishment by helping others

I have gained self-confidence and improved my performance at work

I'm a much better listener -- more attentive, patient and less judgmental

The ability (and confidence) to combine words with appropriate gestures for a better speech

A greater belief in yourself and your capabilities. 

The ability to speak in front of a group of people with confidence, conviction and certainty

Knowing that there are people out there that started out just like you and now they are good speakers. You can do this!

Realising that it is not all that scary to stand in front of a group of people and talk

Gain experience in an area of my life I always thought to be non-existent -- public speaking. If I can do it, anyone can

A noticeable improvement, week by week, in my writing and speaking abilities

Courage to put yourself in challenging situations.

Meet new people from many backgrounds and walks of life and hearing their stories. Everyone has something to teach.

build your self-confidence, meet new people and expand your social circle

results.description:
Do you often find yourself having little control over your emotions?

Do you experience anxiety and want to overcome it?

Do you act impulsively and later regret your actions?

If you answered "yes" to any of the questions above, this meditation is for YOU!

"Thoughts," according Buddhist monk Matthieu Ricard, "can be our best friends and our worst enemies."

Osho Says, "the mind can be a beautiful servant, or a dangerous master." 

In this guided meditation call, we will learn how to observe our own thoughts and cultivate the space between our thoughts. This space is often referred to as nirvana, ecstasy, and enlightenment.  When we enter this space we have total control over our emotions and actions. 


Until what is on the inside - that is, your mind - is corrected, the external world, that is, how you perceive and experience the world around you will be a mere reflection of it.

We will learn an ancient 5,000 year old Vedic technique taught by Indian enlightened master Paramahamsa Nithyananda, called "unclutching." In this technique we learn how to master our thoughts, and as a result control our emotions. 

Join me on this enlightening 45 minute experience! 

In love and abundance, 

Ayelet Shimron 

http://ayeletshimron.com/

www.Facebook.com/Ayelet.Shimron


[masked]-GOAL 

Testimonials from previous Life Transformers:

"Ayelet gave me a major breakthrough! I will be using the techniques we were taught to bring forth all this new power I have. I now feel as though this power is already here and now fully available to me, and I will use it to melt away my hesitation, doubts and fears. It's as though I am warping time to manifest the best version of who I will become. Thank you Ayelet!" -Ricardo, New Jersey 

"I listened to your webinar today from the UK and I must say that I love the way you broke it down! I've done all this reading / learning and no one does it your way. I haven't come across anyone who breaks it up into mini pieces that make sense. Normally I'm left confused, everyone [else] guides you with what to do, they just don't explain how to do it. Again thank you so much." - Natasha, U.K.

"I met Ayelet at a Meditation that she was leading. It was a very transformative experience. I didn't know what to expect. Well, less than ten minutes in I started crying and I didn't know how to stop. The tears just kept flowing. By the end of it, I felt like I let go of my anxiety and my fears of never being good enough.

The meditation helped me get through my break up immensely, and not only that, I fixed my constantly dysfunctional relationship with my parents as well. I feel like I've become more confident and let go of many of my fears.

Ayelet is definitely an authentic and go-to person when it comes to improving relationships. The meditation she led was life changing for me."- Annie Yang, NYC

I am going to put in a few new  ground rules, so by RSVP-ing "yes" you hereby state you have read the following stipulations and will abide by them. We are setting the RSVP limit to 24 but do not be disheartened to join the "wait-list".  Those who RSVP"yes" are given a definite spot in the game if they arrive before or EXACTLY at 5:30. If you have been "wait-listed" and arrive before or at 5:30 and slots are open, you are given a spot. For those who do not RSVP and just show up must wait until 5:30pm and depending upon the order you showed up in and if the conditions mentioned above are not met, you will be allowed to play to make it so the teams are 13 each. If you have RSVP-ed and do not show up by the time we kick off and teams are full, you will be put aside.  for those who show up late, I will set some cones aside so you can play a smaller game against anyone else who shows up late. If you don't show up at all and RSVP-ed "yes", you will be warned 3 times and after that every time I see your name on RSVP you will be put as a "no". I know this is an issue for some of you but please understand in all fairness we don't want a game of 14 v 14, the field does not have enough space.

results.description:
Join us for an evening of writing chalk messages and leafleting throughout Hoboken! We will start at the PATH station and make our way to several parks and busy streets. 

Chalking


The #veganchalkchallenge presents a great opportunity to speak out. It's simple, can be done almost anywhere, and it's fun. I like thinking of creative, positive, and sometimes witty things to say with chalk.

That said, creativity and artistic skills are not a requirement! We'll have a list of messages prepared to give you some ideas, and if you aren't quite sure what you want to write/draw, you can assist someone else with their message or opt to just hand out leaflets.


While you can write or draw whatever you'd like, the general formula I like to use is:


• Short and sweet

• Keep it positive! 

• Include a clear vegan message ("go vegan" or "choose vegan") and a url that people can reference to learn more

• Animal rights, environmental, or health focus

Leafleting


Leafleting is another super simple, effective way to spread the vegan message. Some activists from Farm Sanctuary and The Humane League completed a survey at two college campuses where Vegan Outreach leaflets had been distributed over the years, and the results revealed that of the 403 students that had received a leaflet during their academic careers, 7 became vegetarian, 50% changed their diet in some way, and about 20% gave their leaflet to a friend who then also changed his/her diet!

While leafleting may seem daunting at first, it is actually very fun and rewarding. The following are some tips to keep in mind:

• Go to an area with heavy foot traffic


• You can say things such as, "Information on helping animals/the environment", "Help animals", "Learn about where your food comes from", "Would you like/did you get one of these?", etc.


• Smile! Sometimes just smiling and saying hello is enough for people to want to take a leaflet


• Extend your arm all the way out to the person

• Hand leaflet so that it’s easy to reach

• Make eye contact

• If you are nervous, feign confidence. Nervousness passes very quickly. 


• If nobody is taking, try a brief pause. People mimic the actions they see others taking.

While you will encounter people who are dismissive, you will also encounter people who are interested and will have the opportunity to engage in positive conversations. Focus on the good that is going to come out of the experience and don't let folks who seem uninterested deter you.


We'll supply the chalk and leaflets, so you don't need to bring anything.

Because we want a good couple of hours before dusk, our official start time is 5:30pm. I realize that might be early for many folks, so it's OK to come whenever you can. I'll post a phone number to the meetup on the day of the event, so you can text me to find us wherever we are.

We'll chalk until it gets dark, which is around 7:30. Then we can optionally grab a vegan bite at a nearby establishment and discuss how awesome our chalk messages were.

If you are not sure you are ready to leaflet and/or chalk, please feel free to still join us and just hang out and learn. Maybe you'll be ready the next time! 

Note: While we welcome all veg types, this event is about promoting veganism, so please remember to advocate for veganism when chalking and/or speaking to others, even if you are not vegan. 

Let's get out there and be voices for animals!
results.how_to_find_us: We will be meeting outside of the PATH station entrance across from Texas Arizona near the bench. Look out for our meetup sign. :)
results.name: Vegan Chalk Challenge and Leafleting

results.description:
Hybrid Solution Analysis of Streaming Sensor Data with Spark & Kafka on Bluemix

Today's analytics applications must not only be capable of handling ever increasing types of data (Variety), they need to do it in near real time (Velocity). Exponentially increasing amounts of data (Volume) need to be processed to yield correct actions (Veracity). These new analytics applications must also be flexible in terms of deployment - employing a combination of cloud and on-premise resources as required to meet the needs of the business. This type of hybrid cloud, near real time analytic application requires streaming analytics capabilities, messaging systems and secure gateways to integrate cloud and on-premise systems. 

In this meetup, we'll walk through how to create such an application. Simulated sensor data will be pre-processed in a node.js cloud application, transported via TCP to an on-premise Apache Kafka messaging system over a secure gateway, and monitored and analyzed with a Spark Streaming application running on Hadoop. We will explore the various technology components used in this application as well as demonstrate how they integrate in an end-to-end application flow. We will also do a deep dive into the Spark Streaming application itself.


Agenda:
- Networking, pizza, soda, snacks
- Overview presentation covering the underlying technology components
- Demo showing the various components of the application
- Discussion with Q&A

Note: Visit https://ibm.biz/NYC_Meetup to sign up for a free Bluemix account if you don't have one!
results.how_to_find_us: 12th floor - Room 1219
results.name: Analysis of streaming sensor data with Spark & Kafka on Bluemix

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Ow7JjaVa3bU

This is a Blues Rock Jam Ensemble.

We will have charts and specific guitar parts as well as lots of room to jam and develop solo technique.

We'll play Cream, Zeppelin, B.B.King, Hendrix and more classics of rock and blues.

Acoustic, electric guitars and bass welcome. If electric bring a portable amp:)


Vocals welcome!

This ensemble welcomes ALL LEVELS, so pick your part and let's play! 

To join:

• RSVP before you attend the session.

• Choose your guitar part from TAB>MORE>FILES download/print and bring it to practice to follow. (check by 12/30)

• Bring acoustic guitar or electric with a portable amp. 

• Have an amazing time!

Practice days are:

Every Sunday 3-5pm starting January 10th til April 17th, a week before the performance, 15 practice sessions.

Season Pass

You can purchase the Season Pass (15 sessions at discount + $30 show fee) for $365  (you save $40 on practice sessions)

https://www.paypal.com/cgi-bin/webscr?cmd=_s-xclick&hosted_button_id=2VLVLRLATSNKU


Show Day is Sunday, May 1st at 3pm

The show will be at Arlene's Grocery in the East Village April 24th at 1pm(soundcheck) and doors at 2pm. Arlene's is an awesome show venue with professional stage, sound and lights, everyone will be miked or amplified. If you are coming to rehearsal with a portable amp you should also bring it to the venue.

We will have a drummer and a singer TBA.

There will be tickets for this show, they can be purchase before hand at $5 or at the door for $10.

There is a show fee of $30 for each ensemble member that will go toward venue, sound engineer and hired musicians costs.

Arlene's Grocery is strictly 21+ and no children will be allowed at the show even if they are accompanied by the parent, I'm sorry:( 

There are two bars on site and lots of food spots and great restaurants in the area for before or after the show.

Let's jam those tunes!

Check out our website at http://edelage.wix.com/edge
results.name: Blues Rock Jam Ensemble

results.description:
First Timers, READ details before you RSVP.  

Where: The Cliffs at LIC, [masked]th Drive, Long Island City, NY


When: We usually climb between 6:00pm and 9:00 pm. There is no strict start time and the organizers tries their best to be there around 6:00pm. We will pair off around 6:15ish and start climbing. 

Transportation: Subway: E, M trains to 23rd St-Ely Ave (1/2 block from gym) 7, G train to Court Square (2 blocks from gym)* N, Q train to Queens Borough Plaza (10min walk) *Walk to the E & M track for those bad weather days 

Metro North & LIRR: From Grand Central take 7 train 3 stops From Penn Station take Uptown E train to Court Square

Cost/Discount: $24 Day­pass during the meetup. For monthly/yearly membership, the Initiation Fee (currently $99) is waived (no discount on monthly dues, for yearly membership please inquire with the Cliffs for discount). Just mention "Rock & Ice" at the front desk in order to receive your discount. Gear rental is free for first-timers ONLY (first time visit to the facility). Regular gear  pricing info can be found here: http://thecliffsclimbing.com/lic/climbing/pricing/ 
For Beginners, Climbing 101/Top-rope basic class is offered 50% Off. Must sign­up and pay in advance by calling the Cliffs at 718­729­76125.</a><a href="http://thecliffsclimbing.com/lic/climbing/pricing/">

How to meet us:  After you checked-in, to the right of the front desk there's a sitting area.If you see a group of people in there that's probably us come and say hi. If you are running late leave a comment on the website. If you can't find the group just ask at the front desk.  Food/drinks apres-climb if the group decides.

Notice to Beginners: If you have never climbed before, we encourage you to take the Climbing 101 class there before attending the meetup. We get a discounted price of $25 for the class (that's 50% Off original price if you do it the same day as the meet up and has to be scheduled in advance with them).This will also cover your day pass + gear for the day.Unfortunately we can't teach you how to belay or let you try to belay at the gym if you are not belay certified yet. We leave the teaching to the experts.  Check out Cliff's website for more details.  What to wear - comfortable clothes (think yoga).

Notice to newcomers: You need to pass a belay certification. If you had belayed before, the test takes couple of minutes. If you need a refresher, a test partner or belay partner, feel free to see me. Here is the link to The Cliffs LIC http://thecliffsclimbing.com/lic/

If you decide to stick with the sport, please peruse our message boards for good deals on climbing shoes and other gear.  Also if you find this group invaluable, please donate and pay your voluntary membership due ;) the Organizers will love you more ;).
results.name: Midweek Climbing at the Cliffs LIC
