results.description:
NB. RSVP's through Meetup are now closed but there will be cash tickets on the door

-----------------------------------


Hi Everyone,

Welcome to our FinTech Open Mic Night series in New York. Please join us for our monthly mixture of presentations, skype-ins, fireside chats and shout-outs plus plenty of networking.

This monthly session is designed to provide an opportunity to catch up with your peers, to see what's going on in the New York and International FinTech scenes and to tell us all about yourself and your own work.

This month's topic is Bond Pioneers, trading technologies that are changing the bond trading landscape as regulatory changes and record low interest rates impact the market. Please join us to see a range of companies pitch their platforms followed by a panel session discussion with the audience.


                                                  Agenda

Please be aware that the agenda is updated on a regular basis

6:00pm - Doors open

Refreshments and networking opportunities

7:00pm - Session starts

-> Welcome address 

Ashish Singal, NewFinance New York Chapter Organiser


-> Sponsor messages

Vu Nguyen, Project Manager at Envestnet Yodlee

Melyssa Brown, Marketing + Community Events Manager at Rise New York

-> Presentations

Leo Efstathiou, Founder and CEO of Finsight, a portfolio of services that streamline the structuring, marketing and execution of fixed income securities

Adam Murphy, Founder and CEO of Empirasign Strategies, the only structured product market trade database for the US/UK/EU sectors, and Marketing Manager, Chiara Guerciolini


Ruby Saleh, US Sales for Algomi, a bond information network connecting banks and buy-side clients to facilitate more liquidity in the Fixed Income markets

-> Panel Session

An open discussion with both speakers and delegates exploring the presentations so far and the future of Fixed Income trading

8:00pm - Closing

Shout-outs, communications, feedback and thanks

Further networking opportunities

9:00pm - Session ends

For those of you who would like to continue networking we'll retire to a local bar.

Cheers

Eddie


-------------------------------------------------------------

Thank you to our Partners:


Rise New York is a global community of startups and corporates creating the future of commerce and fintech by helping startups and entrepreneurs connect, co-create, and scale innovation. In partnership with Barclays, we listen, nurture and oxygenate through our international network of Rise hubs. Rise New York also houses a world-class event space and is home to the U.S. cohort of the Barclays Accelerator, powered by Techstars

Built on the foundation of Yodlee’s 15 years of aggregated consumer financial data, Envestnet Yodlee empowers visionary entrepreneurs, partners, and developers to build the next generation of disruptive and innovative FinTech solutions using the award-winning platform. Envestnet Yodlee is the platform for financial innovation. More than 850 organizations globally, including 11 of the top 20 U.S. financial institutions, rely on Envestnet Yodlee to power industry-leading financial applications and services for millions of consumers. When you access the Envestnet Yodlee API, you leverage the most robust financial account and transactional data available today. Through our APIs, we help you bring innovative FinApps to market more quickly using the richest consumer transactional data in the world. It's no surprise that every “hot" FinTech solution in the market is powered by a Envestnet Yodlee API. 

Register for 30 days of free access. For more information on using our APIs for your FinTech startup click here.

 @YIDeveloper
results.name: NewFinance April FinTech Open Mic Night - Bond Pioneers

results.description:
If you're interested in being critiqued, please send your first 20 pages, double spaced, to [masked] by 4/18. This could be any combination of the following: prose, outline (to critique the plot), or synopsis/query letter (to critique in advance of querying agents). The first three submissions sent will be discussed.

If you would like to, please also mention in the body of the document what you would like readers to focus on, whether it's the positives to encourage you to keep writing, the plot, the world-building, etc.

Those who have RSVP'd will get links for download by 4/19. Looking forward to seeing you all there! Let me know if you have any questions or concerns.
results.name: YA Critique Session

results.description:
Hi all, 

We'll continue with practice case interviews. We take turns working through and giving cases, usually getting through 1 or 2 per person. Please come prepared to work through some cases (i.e., bring paper, pens, and some practice cases). All experience levels are welcome.

Location: Tasty Cafe, 128 Madison Ave New York, NY 10016 b/t 30th St & 31st St in Midtown East

Nearest Train Stations: 
33rdSt. (6) 
34th St. Herald Sq. (B, D, F, M, N, Q, R) 
33rd St. (PATH) 

Hope to see you there!

ABOUT US:  We focus on practicing management consulting case interview preparation.   Whether you are a seasoned professional or just looking to land your first dream job at a high-flying consulting firm, you've come to the right place! Aside from solving business cases, the group is also great place to meet and network with others interested in management consulting.

All experience levels are welcome, from absolute beginners to seasoned consultants looking for extra practice.

Our group is open to students and professionals across the globe.  

Case Interview Practice Partner - Case Interview Practice Questions - Case Interview Practice Cases - Case Interview Practice Preparation
results.name: Case Interview Practice

results.description:
Join fellow HR professionals, recruiters, technologists, thinkers, innovators and investors for the 1st HR Technology Showcase on Wednesday 4/27/16 from 6:00pm-8:30pm!


The HR Tech Showcase will be a monthly event series that will feature a series of speakers talking about HR innovation and how technology is helping them bring HR forward, both as a department and as a profession. Come meet innovative HR Tech companies talk about their latest developments and HR professionals talk about how they apply technology in their day to day work.

For the April event, our speaker topic is "Innovations in finding talent".
Keep an eye out for the invitation to our 2nd event in May (date TBD, but probably end of May), where the topic will be "Fostering professional growth and employee engagement through technology"

Agenda: 

-6:00pm                   Doors open
-6:00pm-6:30pm   Networking 
-6:30pm-6:40pm   Opening Remarks        
-6:40pm-7:30pm   Innovation talks 


1. "Leveraging neuroscience + data science in talent assessment" by Matthew Malter Cohen, Head of Data Product at Pymetrics

2. "Recruiting & Machine Intelligence" by Ed Donner, CEO at Untapt

3. "How tech can democratize the hiring space" by Liz Wessel, Co-Founder & CEO at WayUp

-7:30pm-8:30pm    Closing Remarks (2 minutes) & Open Networking

Thanks to our sponsor Talent Tech Labs for hosting us and for providing food and drinks (beer & wine). If you'd also like to sponsor us, please reach out directly to Ilya.

So sign up today, and if you have any questions, please don't hesitate contact Ilya at [masked]. 

Looking forward to seeing you all soon.
results.name: HR Technology Showcase #1 - Innovations in finding talent

Join us for our very first Meetup ever! We'll be hosting special guest Seth Melnick, Lyft NYC's 1st employee, and a leader in the On-Demand space here in the city.  We've heard him speak at a prior event and he gave amazing insight into the company and how they think about changing transportation.

Following a brief talk and Q+A, we'll open the event up for networking and geeking out over our favorite On-Demand startups.  

Schedule:

6:00-6:30: Networking

6:30-7:00: Q+A with Seth, and 10 minutes of questions from the audience

7:00-8:30: Networking

Venue:

Workville is a brand new, luxury co-working space, centrally located steps from Times Square, Bryant Park. 


If you'd like to sponsor, make an announcement, or for ANY suggestions at all, please don't hesitate to contact me. 


We'll see you there!

Red - Marketing

Green - Finance: Banking, VC's/Angel Investors, CPA's, Financial Planners, Stock Investors, etc.

Blue: Entrepreneurs

Cheers,


The Super Team

Hi Singles and Daters, 


Join us for an Awesome Happy Hour Mingling Time every Wednesday* at 100 Montaditos (On Bleecker Street).

Wednesdays is the perfect day to unwind, spend quality time with other like-minded singles and enjoy superb happy hour deals. It's no quite the weekend yet, but it's already time for a Happy Hour Get-Together!

Each wednesday we'll have:
- Icebreakers to Spark Conversations
- Extremely Nice Happy Hour Specials
- Delicious Quality Spanish Specialities
- Fun and Chance to Mingle With The One

Come out, brave the cold and meet us, you never know what good will come out of it.

(Picture at 100MontaditosNY.com)

Check Out the Place:  100 Montaditos Website

Happy Hour Specials from 5 to 8pm:
- $2 Wine and Sangria
- $2 Budweiser and Bud Light
- $3 Any Other Alcoholic Drinks

Join us and mingle. We'll be there from 5pm!

What is a Montadito?

"A Montadito is a staple of the culinary arts from Spain. It is a unique tapa-sized rolls of bread similar to a baguette but wider and with a twist."

results.description:
Please read carefully: This event is being sponsored by Dave Cervini's newyorksocialnetwork.com and several of their partner Meet Up groups.  The number of people registered on this Meet Up represent only a portion of those actually attending. If you have any questions or want to know how many are attending please contact the event host at [masked].

This may be the friendliest and most social After Work Happy Hour you will every experience! Forget about crowded rooftops, long lines to get in and people with attitudes.  New York Social Network founder Dave Cervini personally welcomes members of NYSN and several Social Networking Meet Up Groups to The Lexington Lounge at The Cort Hotel in the heart of midtown this Wednesday to socialize, network and connect in a fun and friendly atmosphere.  The Lexington Lounge is an upscale lounge in the lobby of the Stylish Cort Hotel on 39th and Lex that features a 25 foot bar, a FREE pool table, plus plush ottomans and cozy banquette areas for you to sit back and socialize with all your new friends!

Stop in for a drink or stay a bit longer, you'll be sure to meet other fun and interesting people.  Come alone or bring a friend, either way you will be glad you did. This is a great event for new members to come out and find out what our group is all about plus mix and mingle with long time members and their friends.

The night will feature...

-Drink specials until 8pm

-Fun ice breakers games with prizes

-NYSN staff on hand to welcome you and introduce you to others at the event. 

-Music played at conversational levels

-FREE admission

-A delicious menu is available with discounts till 8pm

</a> Can I come alone? Yes, 95% of those attending come on their own. Our staff will be on hand to welcome you and introduce you to others in the group.

What to expect:[masked] people ages 20's - 40's

What to wear: Business casual/stylish

How do I get there? Grand Central and Penn Station are just a blocks away.

Why should I come?  To make new friends, meet people from other groups, learn about NYSN programs and events, find out about other things going on with similar groups, network for business, make a personal connection, check out a new place or just get out of the apartment

Do I need to RSVP? No, but it does help us to see how many to expect and send any special messages that may need to go out.

If you have any questions before you register please e-mail [masked] or call[masked]-2256.  We want to make sure that this party is exactly what you are looking for so that you'll come out again and again!

There does not seem to be a lot of people registered on this Meet Up, are there more people going?  Yes as explained, this event is being promoted by several Meet Up groups and <a href="http://www.newyorksocialnetwork.com">www.newyorksocialnetwork.com.  There will be tons of people attending.  If you have any questions you can contact the event organizer directly at [masked] or call[masked]
results.name: The Friendliest NYC After Work Happy Hour & Social Networking Party ~ Free Event

results.description:
Note:  This event is closed to new RSVPs.  General walkins are not allowed due to Microsoft security needing a list of attendees in advance.

  https://www.eventbrite.com/e/cyber-security-for-iot-careers-and-pitch-tickets-24337396809

Learn about developing IoT applications and how to address security issues from the start. This event is organized by futurites.com and IoT Central. We would like to thank our host Microsoft and MIDA for their support of this event.

The program will first start with presentations on developing IoT applications followed by a Speed Pitch in which people can describe & demo their IoT applications.


The first presentation entitled "An Intro to IoT Application Development" is by Tom Gilley of Scriptr.io. 

Scriptr.io is an enterprise grade IoT interoperability and micro-services platform.  Scriptr.io can additionally be used to implement the custom back-ends required to power Internet of Things (IoT), mobile and web applications. Scriptr.io will demonstrate their platform which includes a Javascript based scripting engine in which you can write and manage business rules.

results.description:
Building relationships has always been about connecting with core desires of people you have an interest in.  But how do you make connections without seeming superficial, “weird”? Or worse:  a viral marketer mining personal contacts?  Simple..be yourself.

Being authentic in the realm of shallow digital relationships today is not just refreshing, its rewarding on many levels to yourself and those around you.  According to author Dale Carnegie it's the only way to truly win friends and influence people.

Please join us as we explore these topic's in his book of the same title “How To Win Friends And Influence People”.  We will engage in real social networking, while using digital interfaces for learning how meditation/mindfulness plays a role in the over all process.
results.name: Connecting With Core Desires

results.description:
Excited about creating your first website but you don’t know where to start? WordPress powers more than 25% of all websites today and we’ll walk you through, step by step, how to set up your own free website on WordPress.com.

This workshop is geared towards complete beginners - people who have no previous experience in web building. Learn how to easily create your account, choose a domain, choose a theme, the difference between posts and pages, and more!

PRESENTED BY: Scott Becker / HOSTED BY: Winstina Hughes


This is a WordPress.com focused event, that will be led by enthusiasts independent of Automattic.

All experience levels welcome. There will be a short presentation then time to break off and learn from each other.

WHAT TO BRING:   

Bring a laptop. We have wifi. Bring a friend, too.

If you need help with your site, bring your laptop and WordPress.com login info to access your website.

Did you miss WPNYC WordPress.com Night: Building a Blog Around a Single Topic? No worries. Get one-on-one training on what you missed.

IMPORTANT:
Be sure to bring government-issued photo ID for security. We need to collect everyone's First / Last name to submit in advance of the event. If your profile name is different than your government-issued ID, provide us correct info when registering to minimize security problems when you arrive.

SEEKING:
More Happiness! Want to contribute by helping someone else? We can always use help and encourage everyone to join us.
results.how_to_find_us: The building entrance is on 37th Street, off the corner of Fifth Avenue. Ring the bell for WeWork.
results.name: WPNYC WordPress.com Night: How to Create Your 1st Website

results.description:
Intro to IoT Application Development with Security & IoT Demos

NOTE: YOU MUST REGISTER AND PAY A NOMINAL FEE OF $5 (THROUGH THIS MEETUP REGISTRATION) TO ATTEND. THE FEE WILL RISE TO $10 on APRIL 25.

Learn about developing IoT applications and how to address security issues from the start. This event is being done in conjunction with Futurites.com. We would like to thank our host Microsoft and MIDA for their support of this event.

The program will first start with presentations on developing IoT applications followed by a Speed Pitch in which people can describe & demo their IoT applications.

If you would like to Speed Pitch and show a demo of your IoT related product in 3 minutes or less, please apply here.<a href="http://goo.gl/forms/WkFptX6d9J"></a>


The first presentation entitled "An Intro to IoT Application Development" is by Tom Gilley of Scriptr.io. 

Scriptr.io is an enterprise grade IoT interoperability and micro-services platform.  Scriptr.io can additionally be used to implement the custom back-ends required to power Internet of Things (IoT), mobile and web applications. Scriptr.io will demonstrate their platform which includes a Javascript based scripting engine in which you can write and manage business rules.

Our second speaker will be visiting from SAM Labs, which is based in London. SAM Labs is a fast-growing technology startup, empowering anyone from beginners to pros to invent, prototype and make the Internet of Things their thing.

Equipped with the ultimate toolkit for inventing, thousands of young people are already creating their own technology and becoming the innovators of tomorrow.

Imagine a world where the digital becomes tangible. Where, at the push of a button you create a world of smart devices. Need to feed your cat from when you’re away? No problem. Create your own smart mailbox? Easy. With SAM, you're able to turn your ideas into reality in only 30 seconds.

SAM Labs offers a range of easy-to-use Bluetooth-connected sensors known as “wireless blocks”, together with a super-simple app. SAM Labs’ kits make integrating hardware, software and the internet accessible, affordable and, most importantly, fun.


YOU MUST REGISTER AND PAY A NOMINAL FEE OF $5 (THROUGH THIS MEETUP REGISTRATION) TO ATTEND. THE FEE WILL RISE TO $10 on APRIL 25.

Agenda

6:00pm   Networking

6:30pm   Introduction to Futurities, IoT Central               

                   Paul Rothbein, Futurities               

                   Mitchell Golner, IoT Central

6:40pm   "Intro to IoT Application Development"

                  Tom Gilley, Scriptr.io

7:10pm     "Invent you own IoT prototypes in seconds!"

                   David Weiss, SAM Labs

7:40pm    Speed Pitches & Demos   

                   * 3 minute pitches/demos per company 

8:10pm    Member Announcements

8:15pm    Networking

9:00pm   End of Event

Copyright 2016 IoT Central. All Rights Reserved.

results.description:
Soaring housing costs, declining real incomes, and increasing income inequality suggest that our economy is not working for the majority. How do we repair an economy of exclusion?

One strategy advocated by a diverse group, including G.K. Chesterton, Hilaire Belloc and Dorothy Day, is to recognize that profits and property are good things, and should be widely shared. This strategy is often termed “Distributism”, and favors local initiatives and decentralized decision-making. In this seminar, Eugene Callahan considers the role of distributism in a modern, technology-based, economy. Dr. Eugene Callahan is a lecturer in economics at Saint Joseph’s College in New York City.
results.name: An Economy for All: Strategies between Capitalism and Socialism

results.description:
Who: Joel and Moshe will be the hosts of the meetup. Please find them if you need belay partners.


Where: Brooklyn Boulders 575 Degraw St, Brooklyn, NY 11217

When: We usually climb between 6pm and 9pm. There is no strict start time and the organizers try their best to be there around 5pm. If you are new, please feel free to warm up on an easy bouldering wall and find us later if you need a belay partner.

Transportation: By subway: Take the 2, 3, 4, 5, N, Q, R, B, or D to Atlantic-Pacific, transfer to the R for one stop to Union St. Walk 2 blocks north, turn left on Degraw, we are the last door on the right side of the street.

Cost/Discount: get a meetup discount if you sign up with our group which gives you $19 entrance + FREE gear rentals. You can bring your friends and they will get the same discount from us. Just mention "Rock & Ice" at the front desk in order to receive your discount and free rentals.

How to meet us: If you need a belay partner, come find the organizer(s). Come say hi even if you don't need a partner. Sometimes we grab drinks/food apres-climb.

Notice to beginners: if you have never ever climbed or belayed before you will need to take a class - it takes place every night at 7pm. There is a nominal fee for this. What to wear - comfortable clothes (think yoga).

Notice to newcomers: You need to pass a belay certification. If you had belayed before, the test takes couple of minutes. If you need a refresher, a test partner or belay partner, please see feel free to see me. I usually get to the gym around 6pm, and either boulder at the entrance wall or top-rope in the main room. I post a comment what I'm wearing that day the afternoon of.

Here is the link to BKB: </a><a target="_blank"><a target="_blank"></a><a target="_blank">http://www.brooklynboulders.com</a>;;

If you decide to stick with the sport, please peruse our message boards for good deals on climbing shoes and other gear.
results.how_to_find_us: hi, just ask at the front desk for location of rock & ice meetup group when checking in :)
results.name: Midweek Climbing at Brooklyn Boulders (Group Discount)

results.description:
Players of all skill levels are welcome. Westchester FC is about playing the beautiful game in a fun environment where everyone can get a good workout and improve their skills. It doesn't matter if you are the Messi of White Plains or you have never kicked a ball before, all you need are shoes.

While we will spend most of the time playing pick-up games, we will start with some warm-up to get the blood flowing. SPREAD THE WORD and get your friends to sign up!

I can't stress enough that fun is the top priority, because of this, no rough play (slide tackling is prohibited) or rude language. Violators will be warned, sent off, suspended or banned from Westchester FC games. We want everyone to feel comfortable so that we can really grow this club.
results.how_to_find_us: We are playing on the upper field, the small grass one on the corner of Hartsdale and Davis.
results.name: Friendly Soccer in White Plains

results.description:
WEBSITE : TWITTER : FACEBOOK

Every Wednesday we bring some serious board game madness to Berg'n from 6:00 PM to 11:00 PM. They like board games; we like board games... it's a match made in heaven!

Just a quick reminder not bring in outside food and to patronize any bar that hosts us. Check out bergn.com if you want to check out their food and drink menu; they have a great selection.

We usually have many more people who attend than who RSVP. We try to adjust the numbers on the Meetup to reflect that, but we err on the side of lowballing. As of Nov. 2015 we are averaging out around 25 people throughout the night though for special events we've had up to 80.

HOW MUCH IS THIS EVENT?

There's no admission fee, but there is a two drink minimum* which you will be expected to honor.

* (or monetary equivalent in non-alcoholic purchases if you don't touch the stuff.)

WHAT TYPE OF GAMES ARE PLAYED?

All types. Real short bluffing games decorated with skulls and flowers. Cooperative games fighting horrible diseases. Classic euro games where you haggle over sheep and wheat. Whether you want to fight unspeakable horrors in Arkham or build railroads across America or rebuild your farm after the black plague (more fun than it sounds) you can probably find a game you would like.

Some games you might see are 7 Wonders, Settlers of Catan, Pandemic, Dominion, Dixit, Puerto Rico, Eldritch Horror, Ticket to Ride, Carcasonne among many others. You're also welcome to bring any game you want to play!

I DON'T KNOW THESE GAMES? IS IT COOL IF I COME?

We're very friendly and if you have no idea what the hell we're talking about just trust us when we say it's ton of fun. We'll have tons of games and we're very happy to show you the rules. Hang out, haves some drinks, and learn a new game.

Questions? Comments? Contact us at [masked]
results.how_to_find_us: We'll be either in the private room or the main room. Either way look for the people playing games!
results.name: Victory Pints at Berg'n Beer Hall

group.name: Victory Pints: Board Games and Beer

results.description:
Last year we briefly took a look at TypeScript. This time let's take a deeper dive into the language, it's main features and how it extends the JavaScript programming language. We'll also look at how to use it to build a simple application and will discuss some lessons learned while building with it in production.


We'll also be taking a look at Ionic 2.0, the newest version of the Ionic hybrid mobile development framework. Ionic 2.0 uses both TypeScript and Angular 2.0 so this talk will also serve as a continuation of the first talk as well a light introduction to ng2. Be there or be square!

Speakers:

Felicia O'Garro - Software Engineer

Jamal O'Garro - Software Engineer

Agenda

6:00 - doors open

6:30 - lightening talks and announcements

7:00 PM - talks start

7:45 - 9:00 PM - networking

results.description:
ASTRO-NUMEROLOGY 101 WITH LAAURA  RAEL


Astro-numerology is the combination of astrology and numerology. It’s both an art and a science that allow you to understand your psychology, your vocation, your potential, relationships etc. It’s the combination of the numbers (1-9), the celestial bodies and the zodiacs that will help you unravel your inner nature and conscious behaviors. This course is designed to help you understand your personality, your talents, your career path, and your attraction to certain people, circumstances and situations. 


This course will also help you to comprehend the personalities and life paths of others such as your children, your spouse, clients, employers, employees, etc. Everything you’ll learn in this course will help you to recognize your own unique cycles to transform your life and to make better conscious decisions. 

This course includes learning the meaning behind the numbers and their association with the planets and zodiacs signs as well as learning how to calculate


Your personal year and personal months

Your life path number and it’s esoteric meaning 

Your harmonic numbers (to determine your best year cycles, stress year cycles, and romance cycles) to better plan, strategize and build upon important life events. 


Date:  Wednesday, April  27, 2016 


Place:   TRS 40 Exchange Place New York, New York


Time: 6pm



Requirements: Your natal chart (which can be downloaded from astro.com or psychicscience.org), pen and notepad


Fee: $ 25.00


This course is the pre-requisite to “Astro-Numerology Forecasting and Calendar Design”,   

“The Meaning behind Your Name” and “Tarot 102”.
results.name: Numerology with Laara Rael

results.description:
Please read carefully: This event is being sponsored by Dave Cervini's newyorksocialnetwork.com and several of their partner Meet Up groups.  The number of people registered on this Meet Up represent only a portion of those actually attending. If you have any questions or want to know how many are attending please contact the event host at [masked].

This may be the friendliest and most social After Work Happy Hour you will every experience! Forget about crowded rooftops, long lines to get in and people with attitudes.  New York Social Network founder Dave Cervini personally welcomes members of NYSN and several Social Networking Meet Up Groups to The Lexington Lounge at The Cort Hotel in the heart of midtown this Wednesday to socialize, network and connect in a fun and friendly atmosphere.  The Lexington Lounge is an upscale lounge in the lobby of the Stylish Cort Hotel on 39th and Lex that features a 25 foot bar, a FREE pool table, plus plush ottomans and cozy banquette areas for you to sit back and socialize with all your new friends!

Stop in for a drink or stay a bit longer, you'll be sure to meet other fun and interesting people.  Come alone or bring a friend, either way you will be glad you did. This is a great event for new members to come out and find out what our group is all about plus mix and mingle with long time members and their friends.

The night will feature...

-Drink specials until 8pm

-Fun ice breakers games with prizes

-NYSN staff on hand to welcome you and introduce you to others at the event. 

-Music played at conversational levels

-FREE admission

-A delicious menu is available with discounts till 8pm

Can I come alone? Yes, 95% of those attending come on their own. Our staff will be on hand to welcome you and introduce you to others in the group.

What to expect:[masked] people ages 20's - 40's

What to wear: Business casual/stylish

How do I get there? Grand Central and Penn Station are just a blocks away.

Why should I come?  To make new friends, meet people from other groups, learn about NYSN programs and events, find out about other things going on with similar groups, network for business, make a personal connection, check out a new place or just get out of the apartment

Do I need to RSVP? No, but it does help us to see how many to expect and send any special messages that may need to go out.

If you have any questions before you register please e-mail [masked] or call[masked]-2256.  We want to make sure that this party is exactly what you are looking for so that you'll come out again and again!

There does not seem to be a lot of people registered on this Meet Up, are there more people going?  Yes as explained, this event is being promoted by several Meet Up groups and www.newyorksocialnetwork.com.  There will be tons of people attending.  If you have any questions you can contact the event organizer directly at [masked] or call[masked]
results.name: The Friendliest NYC After Work Happy Hour & Social Networking Party ~ Free Event

results.description:
Hey Everyone,

Felicia and I are giving talks on TypeScript and Ionic 2. Just wanted to extend the invite to the Swabbies. Hope to see you there -- details are below!

--

Last year we briefly took a look at TypeScript. This time let's take a deeper dive into the language, it's main features and how it extends the JavaScript programming language. We'll also look at how to use it to build a simple application and will discuss some lessons learned while building with it in production. We'll also be taking a look at Ionic 2.0, the newest version of the Ionic hybrid mobile development framework. Ionic 2.0 uses both TypeScript and Angular 2.0 so this talk will also serve as a continuation of the first talk as well a light introduction to ng2. Be there or be square!


Agenda

6:00 - doors open

6:30 - lightening talks and announcements

7:00 PM - talks start

7:45 - 9:00 PM - networking

results.description:
Donald Harrison is a highly regarded veteran saxophonist, while bassist Ron Carter and drummer Billy Cobham are a classic rhythm section team, as well as living legends. You can learn more about this trio and the event here: http://www.bluenote.net/newyork/schedule/moreinfo.cgi?id=13936.

The Blue Note tends to fill up quickly after they open the doors at 6:00, so this is when we'll meet there for dinner. I'll make sure I snag us optimum seating. The first set begins at 8:00. The cost is $35, with a $5 food or drink minimum, plus tax and tip. I'll try to arrange for separate checks, but just in case, please make things easy for everyone by bringing cash, including small bills.

The informal deadline to cancel will be 4/25, the following day after which I'll make reservations for the group. Please, only serious RSVPs. It's important for me to keep a good reputation at these clubs, so frivolous late cancellations will lead to expulsion from the group.
results.how_to_find_us: Look for me at one of the center tables
results.name: Donald Harrison, Ron Carter, Billy Cobham Trio At The Blue Note

results.description:
Roadtripping with MetaMovements to NY or already in NYC (or tri-state area)?

Well join us from 6-8PM on Wed, Apr 27th @Salsa Salsa Studio in Brooklyn, NY!

Salsa Salsa steps into to Havana for 2 hours... experience a taste of the island!


MetaMovements is in the House (Salsa Salsa's House that is)! Aching for Timba? Don't know (or remember) the difference between Son & Salsa On2? Interested or want to freshen up your Casino?

Join Anara Frank for an intensive workshop at the Salsa Salsa studio...get that refresher that you've been waiting for. This workshop, designed to connect you to the primary social dances of Havana, will give you intensive instruction in Son & Casino with an opportunity to connect to the rhythms of Havana by practicing your musicality.


 6:00 - 7:00 pm - Cuban Son vs. Salsa On2 -- 

Understand the similarities and differences between traditional Cuban Son and NY Salsa on 2. Improve your timing, musicality, and learn how you can bring it to the dance floor

7:00 - 8:00 pm - Casino & Rueda de Casino - Catch the Cuban Fever! 

Enjoy this island's Salsa... and take it to the next level by playing its game! Rueda de Casino... a group version of Cuban Salsa that some people call "Salsa Meets Square Dancing"

SPACE IS LIMITED- so RSVP so we can be sure to hold a spot!

PRICE:

1 Class = $15 

2 Classes = $25 (Bring a friend and get $5 off)
results.how_to_find_us: https://www.facebook.com/events/1582931598683812/
results.name: Roadtrip w/MM to NY & Cuban Style Workshops with Salsa Salsa Dance Studio

group.name: Cuban Dance, Culture & Travel w/MetaMovements Meetup

results.description:
Hi Everyone...Let's take a Wednesday evening walk at 6:00PM SHARP (try to arrive 15 mins beforehand) in the gorgeous Grover Cleveland Park (HINT: I use 118 Brookside Avenue Caldwell, NJ in my GPS) for a 2.5 mile walk.

We will meet near the fishing pond entrance of the park, close to Brookside Avenue. There is only on-the-street parking surrounding the park.

Thank you all for coming at least 10 minutes early... This has been a big success...  Everyone loves it and thanks you for it.

Then (it's OPTIONAL) we will go for dinner afterwards to the Cloverleaf Tavern located at 395 Bloomfield Avenue, Caldwell, NJ. Check out their menu at: http://www.cloverleaftavern.com/

NEW POLICY: If you are a 'no show' for any of our meetups (someone who RSVP's yes but doesn't let me know that you are not able to make and/or change their RSVP to no) then you are automatically placed on the waiting list for the next meetup.  As a reminder, please know that RSVPing 'yes' to joining us for dinner and then cancelling last minute is 'unkind'.  

This is a great walk for all you " New Sole Mates " to meet everyone and see what a fun group we are.  There are always plenty of people to chat with and make friends along the way and you will definitely be made to feel welcomed :)

I hope to see lots of familiar and new faces! Please feel free to bring a friend!!

Also, there's no need to post that you can't come or why. We'll catch you next time.
results.name: Wednesday 6PM Walk @ Grover Cleveland Pk & Dinner @ Cloverleaf Tavern Afterwards

group.name: Northern NJ Sole Mates Walking & Adventure Group

results.description:
Steampunk Boonton is THIS weekend. To get ready, a group of us are meeting at my house to create costuming, props, and other art to wear or display in Steampunk style. Bring raw materials: fabrics, articles of clothing, brass-toned metallic findings, accessories, plenty of spray paints, and anything else that can be re-fashioned or re-purposed, etc. Thrift shops are a good place to find things last minute. Bring sewing machines and threads, etc. My girlfriend will also be bringing her sewing machine to share. I have lots of tools to use. We can swap/trade materials or just work on our own projects. We can each chip in $5 for pizza or something like that for dinner. I have some wine and other booze to share around. You can also bring anything else you'd like to contribute. It's a great chance to be creative, fun, and get good ideas from other creative types.

RSVP by April 27 (it is a spontaneous event).
results.name: "Steampunk Yourself" Art Night

results.description:
Come join us for a night of board gaming fun. We play all sorts of board games and card games. We tend to play more euro games so please keep that in mind. Bringing a game is not necessary, but if you have one you want to play bring it along.

We will  be located in the restaurant by the windows.


Valley Stream train station is very close about three blocks.

For those who drive:

• Street parking meters are until 6pm. If you come early, W. Jamaica Ave has a free parking lot, behind the pizzeria.


We have permission from the owner to play in the restaurant on the condition that everyone consume something.


• Be aware this group has an age limit, those who come to game must be adults under 40**

**Due to popular demand we will now be having a 3 no show rule. If you RSVP but can't make it please take the time to take yourself off. Our group is small and we do plan our games on how many members will be showing up. Even if you unrsvp right before we start, one of us is always checking and we appreciate the info. I'll send you a warning after the 2nd no show, but after the third I'll have to take you out of our group.
results.how_to_find_us: We will be located in the restaurant by the windows

results.description:
In a special event to get ramped up for our MedTech program, guest speaker Ohad BarSiman Tov, Ph.D. Founder of InfraSonic Monitoring, will speak to Byte students and a limited number of community members.  Over the past three years Ohad has been committed to developing wearable cardiac output monitoring technology.  

 Ohad will present an Introduction to Wearables and discuss  applications in MedTech, including his platform CoreTrac  which provides users cardiac performance while doing activities outside of clinical setting.

Background: Throughout history cardiac information was desired and observed since it is considered the most important measure of the whole body function. Even today we define a person to be clinical dead when the heart stops beating. It took many years and technological innovations to develop methods to measure cardiac information correctly. How cardiac devices looked and used at their initial stages? How innovation changed healthcare standards for the good and bad? A discussion on innovation in healthcare focused on cardiac monitoring will provide different views and methods to answer those questions. 


Work and learn Python software engineering and/or FinTech at the same time  by signing up for our part-time classes.  Next cohort begins May 9.
results.name: Startup Talk: MedTech Innovations & Wearables

group.name: Byte Academy: FinTech, Data Science, Python Coding Bootcamp

results.description:
We will have two console stations, our primary one will be a GameCube with Zelda Four Swords. For those of you who don't know, that's one of the few GC games where you could use the GBA as a controller.  So yes, we will have 4 GBAs that will be used as controllers :)


The second station will be a Dreamcast with multiple 4 player games.


All controllers will be supplied so no need to bring anything.

Should you have any questions, feel free to text or call me at:[masked]

Note: if you came to our March Meetup, it's at the same exact place.

Please respect the RSVP due to limited space.

Look forward to seeing old members and  meeting new ones!
results.how_to_find_us: Enter through the parking lot entrance, go up to floor PH on the elevator and as soon as you get off, look for the red door at the end of the hallway. That's our meeting room.
results.name: Retro Multiplayer Gaming - Dreamcast & GameCube

results.description:
Let's have a sunset dinner at the beautiful Cuban. I have been here several times and love it! The food and drinks are delicious.

SUNSET MENU – $32 per person

http://thecubannj.com/

Please remember to bring enough cash to cover your meal, tax, tip and fee.

Looking forward to a mid-week dinner with some laughs and good food!
results.name: Sunset Dinner at The Cuban

venue.address_2: Coney Island Ave between Caton & Parkside Avenues

results.description:
Join us at our new location for an evening of RE networking, food and drink!

Wednesday, April 27, 2016
6:30 PM to 9:30 PM
Grillstone Resturant and Bar
2377 U.S. 22, Scotch Plains, NJ

ASSET BASED LENDING will sponsor this event will be our first in Union County. We will be co-hosting this event with John Bancey. It will be held at Grillestone in Scotch plains, off of highway 22. We will have food served thoughout the evening, an hour of open bar and a small informational session on hard money lending. $10 cover We look forward to seeing you there!
results.name: Pure Networking learn how to fund your real estate flips!

results.description:
This event is being co-organized by several other groups. The # of RSVP's here are not reflective of actual attendance. Based on presales, at least 30 singles will be attending!

Mix & mingle before bowling with ice breakers while we create teams. Women & Men will be paired into teams of two or three. Each team will stay together throughout the event.

Next the fun begins. A person from the female team will bowl a frame. Then a member of the male team will bowl a frame. The process continues until all 10 frames are bowled. The group that has the highest score of each game wins a prize!

At end of game, ladies will stay at the same lane. Male team will rotate to next lane and the process begins again. We will continue for either two hours or until you have met everyone.

You will have the option to complete a scorecard at the end of the night. You can write down the names of anyone you were interested in. We will send them an email letting them know that you were interested and provide your email address. 

MEN get tickets here - https://goo.gl/ZYz8AC

WOMEN get tickets here - https://goo.gl/DNBpVl

What's included:

• Free Bowling Games & Shoe Rental  

• Ice Breakers & Scorecard Matching

• Singles in their 20s, 30s, 40s

• Drink Specials 

• Prizes for winning team

*Tickets are $30-$35 depending upon how early you purchase:

MEN get tickets here - https://goo.gl/ZYz8AC

WOMEN get tickets here - https://goo.gl/DNBpVl


*Prepay Only Event - No tickets sold at door

Can I still attend even If I don't want to bowl? Yes, you can still be a member of the team and mingle. Food & Drink will also be available for purchase.

Can I come alone? Yes, about 80% attend on their own.

Is this age/ethnic specific? This is a multi-Meetup, non-ethnic specific event. About 40 singles will be attending ages, mostly 20s-40s. But all are welcome 21+.

How do I attend? RSVP w/ group and purchase tickets below -

MEN Prepay Here - https://goo.gl/ZYz8AC

WOMEN Prepay Here - https://goo.gl/DNBpVl
results.how_to_find_us: Private for members and their guests - optional name tags will be provided
results.name: Bowling Singles Night (Prepay Only Event) Sold Out For Women!

results.description:
Topic

Angular 2 is a complete rewrite of Angular 1.  It embraces a component-based approach to building client-side web and native applications.  This talk will give a high-level overview of the main architectural components of Angular 2 including components, directives, services, DI, routing, and a new data-binding syntax.  These concepts will be introduced in the context of a sample application that was built from the ground-up with Angular 2.

About the Speaker

Howard Pinsley has been developing software professionally for over 30 years as both an in-house developer and as a consultant on technology ranging from VAX/VMS in the 80's to today's modern client-side JavaScript frameworks.  He currently works as a consultant at  Lab49 developing mission-critical applications, primarily on the Microsoft stack,  for clients in the financial services sector.


This meeting will be held at the Microsoft offices as usual. Check the Meetup site for details!
results.how_to_find_us: Central Park East Conference Room (6th Floor, Room 6501a)
results.name: An Introduction to Angular2 with Howard Pinsley

group.name: New York ALT.NET Software Development Group

results.description:
Hi Nodesters! We've got great talks this month!

* NOTE THE LOCATION at Shutterstock!!!*

Richard Rodger - Solving Service Discovery: How Node microservices can find each other without a registry. 

NearForm's Richard Rodger will be joining us from afar this month to talk to us about Node, microservices, and service discovery. Richard will introduce the problems that microservices pose with using a traditional registry approach, and how you can leapfrog those problems to something greater via dynamic discovery protocols. 

Keith Horwood - Building Scalable API Backends for your React and Mobile Apps in an Instant

All the way from The Bay, Keith Horwood will introduce us to Nodal (http://github.com/keithwhor/nodal), a brand new open source framework built on design patterns we know and trust from Rails and Django. It's declarative, opinionated, and most importantly it solves all of your problems related to creating a standalone API server that integrates with a database quickly and painlessly. He'll be walking through how to create a simple Twitter-like application in minutes.

Additional spots available. Reach out with topics to presentt!


***Note on security***: As always, please ensure your full name is listed on your Meetup profile, if you RSVP yes to join. Building security will need it to grant you access to the event.

We'll be at Shutterstock this month. Thanks to Shutterstock for hosting! It's going to be a great event!

See you there!

- Matt
results.how_to_find_us: Go to the north security check in on 34th Street, check in with your id, and proceed up to Shutterstock for the show.
results.name: Solving Microservice Discovery! & Instant, Scalable API Backends!

results.description:
Both our April and May events are dedicated to the topic of digital art collection within architectural projects. 


The Part One DACC INTERVIEW and DACC YOUR ATTENTION MOMENT will bring together four professionals from digital art and architecture to share their concepts and practices with the audience. 

We will also discuss the following issues in the collaboration between digital artists and architects: the role of the digital art in real-estate projects; when and how artists start working with architects and interior designers; how can digital art be collected by real-estate developers. 

In order to celebrate DACC inauguration, our previous two events were free admission for the public. Our April event admission will be based on individual donation, ideally, $10USD if you can (cash at the door).* 

Detailed Schedule

• 6:30pm - Reception

• 7:00pm - 7:10pm - Live Performance, by Yuxi James Cao

• 7:10pm - 8:30pm - DACC INTERVIEW + Q&A, with:

1. Kevin Cunningham, Founder of 3 Legged Dog Art and Technology Center, New York

Projects in presentation

- Metropolitan Museum of Art's 2016 Gala working with OMA (ongoing)

- Lake Nona Orlando (FL) Public Art Project 

- Schomburg Center for Research in Black Culture with Marble Fairbanks

https://vimeo.com/153937509

(Lake Nona 3D Reel | Video courtesy of 3LD)

2. Cleveland Adams, Principal Architect, HAL


An architect and problem solver having worked with museums and institutions, Cleveland invites challenges designers to rethink the environments in which art of the past and future can coexist without simply creating spaces that emulate the Internet, devoid of light and nature.

(Edward M.Kennedy Institute, interior view | Photo credit: Rafael Vinoly Architects)

3. Yuxi James Cao, Artist and Coder, Founder of AXIStudio, New York | Beijing


Projects in presentation

- Lake Nona Orlando (FL) Public Art Project

- Overview of projects relating to architecture and design

https://vimeo.com/148328190

(MACROCOSM Prelude Show, NYC TOUR Teaser | Video courtesy of the Artist)


• 8:30pm - 9:00pm - DACC YOUR ATTENTION MOMENT, with

Carter Hodgkin, Artist and Interactive Designer, Part-time Assistant Professor at Parsons The New School. She transforms atomic particle collisions into line and color to create animations, paintings, and large-scale mosaic installations.

Projects in presentation

- Neiman Marcus, LA

(Mosaic art at Neiman Marcus, LA | Image courtesy of the Artist, 2016)

- Queens College, NY

(Remsen Hall, Queens College, Exterior. Glass tile mosaic, 3 walls, 9 columns, 2010 | Image courtesy of the Artist)

- Overview of projects relating to architecture and interior design

After 9:00pm - Networking


* Your donation helps the event's organizer, venue host to cover the basic expense for preparation, supports the invited speakers to provide quality presentations. Thank you for your contribution to the development of DACC!
results.name: Digital Art in Architecture [Part One]

results.description:
Prepayment is required HERE 

------------------------------------------------ 
WHAT: BOWLING for Singles with a TWIST 

WHERE: Bowlmor Times Square 
WHO: Single men and women ages 20's, 30's, & 40's

How it works 
Women will be paired up into teams of two or three and Men will be paired up into teams of three. Don't worry if you are coming alone or do not have three people to sign up. People will arrive early so you will have time to mingle with ice breakers and we will help create the teams. Each team will stay together throughout the event.

Next the fun begins. We will have one male team and one female team stationed at each bowling lane. This male and female team (known as a group) will combine to bowl one 10 frame game. Remember, you are not bowling an entire game yourself. This is a group effort. A person from the female team will bowl a frame. Next, a member of the male team will bowl a frame. Then female number two bowls a frame followed by male number two. The process continues until all ten frames are bowled. During this time all of the members of the group will be getting to know each other. Which ever group has the highest score at the end of each game will win a prize.

At the end of the game, the ladies will stay at the same lane. The male team will rotate to the next lane and the process begins again. We will continue for either two hours or until you have met everyone.

Note: You can still attend and be a member of a team even if you do not want to bowl.


Includes: Bowling, Shoes and scorecard matching.


**************Food and Drinks are available for purchase********


Question: I was interested in someone but am still uncomfortable asking them for contact information.


You will have the option to complete a scorecard at the end of the night and take notes during the event. You can write down the names of anyone you were interested in from the event. We will send them an email letting them know that you were interested and provide your email address..

-------------------------------------------------------------------------

Prepayment is required HERE 

30-$35 depending on how early you register.

Prepayment is required HERE

results.description:
Finding your co-founder is only the first ingredient towards a successful partnership recipe. How you manage that relationship with your start-up half is even more important and it makes the difference between a company vision being executed well, or worse, not at all.


On April 27th, mobile entrepreneur Tony Peccatiello will share his personal experience and the most important ingredients to a successful partnership. Learn from his insightful experiences so you can kick-start your co-founder relationship in the right way. Who should come? This session is for anyone who already has a co-founder, or is thinking about finding one. Schedule: 


6:30 - 7:00 –  Beer & Networking
7:00 - 8:00 – “Startup lessons” from Tony Peccatiello
8:00 - 8:30 – Q&A

ABOUT TONY:
Tony is a mobile entrepreneur with over 6 years of experience in the start-up world. Currently, he’s a principal at Social Starts, a venture fund that supports entrepreneurs who serve the Social Construct. Prior to Socal Starts, he founded Pyne, the most engaging way to crowd source your everyday questions in curiosities. Check it out at getpyne.com.

Socialstarts is Trusted By Entrepreneurs and Startups:
Over 30 apps including: Pinterest, Bliss, EliteDaily, Everywear, GlassBreakers, Mashable, SocialRank.

Sponsors:
GRAND CENTRAL TECH and BUILD: GCT is a community of startups and strategic partners that breaks from the traditional accelerator model by providing an unparalleled value proposition. Accepted companies receive free office space for a year with zero equity fee to participate. GCT companies get the best possible resources in a program tailor-made to each. Learn more here:  .http://www.grandcentraltech.com/

 <a>Grand Central Tech Accelerator's applications for its next class are now open</a>!
results.name: Startup lessons from a Mobile Entrepreneur turned VC

Looking to hire full-stack web developers in the Tri-State/Philly area?

Rutgers Coding Bootcamp is holding a Demo Expo on Wed, April 27th (6:30pm) in Jersey City, NJ... where 50 of their full stack web developers looking for full-time hire, will be sharing their projects, resumes and career goals.

If you are looking to hire interns, junior developers and even a few rockstars, please come to see the developers in action as they showcase their individual and group projects.

It's a terrific opportunity to meet web developer candidates in-person -- and hear them talk about their work, approach to coding, technology preferences and ideal future jobs.  

Think science fair for awesome tech talent!  

Registration is free, but space will be limited, so RSVP now!

Please attend if you are a recruiter, hiring manager, or other professional looking to hire talent.
results.name: Jr Fullstack Web Developer Demo Day Expo - For Tech Recruiters and Hiring Mgrs

results.description:
In the late XIX Century, the US saw rapid industrialization, collapse of the traditional farm economy, mass immigration, urbanization and financial panics. Yet the political system was remarkably stable.  Reform movements were largely impotent.

However starting in the 1890's, several waves of political reform swept new men with new ideas into power culminating in the New Deal.  Next time we'll look at the political underpinnings of some of these movements.  We won't spend much time talking about whether child labor laws and the FDA were good ideas but rather did they make for good politics.  

We are upstairs in the Mezzanine of 875 3rd Avenue.  It's a great space for our group.
results.name: Populists, Progressives and Liberals. 1892-1933

results.description:
Join us for a microservices triple header!

Jake Moshenko, Product Manager at CoreOS, and Quentin Machu, Software Engineer at CoreOS, will join us to discuss Clair, an open-source project for the static analysis of vulnerabilities in appc and docker containers.

Brian Brazil, Founder at Robust Perception, will join us all the way from Ireland to discuss Prometheus, an open-source service monitoring system and time series database.

Brian Kelly, VP Engineering at Datawire, will join us to discuss questions to be answered before creating a new microservice.

Thanks to Jake, Quentin and Brian x 2 for sharing their time and expertise and thanks to ThoughtWorks for hosting!

Container Vulnerability Analysis with Clair:

Vulnerability data is continuously imported from a known set of sources and correlated with the indexed contents of container images in order to produce lists of vulnerabilities that threaten a container. When vulnerability data changes upstream, the previous state and new state of the vulnerability along with the images they affect can be sent via webhook to a configured endpoint. All major components can be customized programmatically at compile-time without forking the project.

Our goal is to enable a more transparent view of the security of container-based infrastructure. Thus, the project was named Clair after the French term which translates to clear, bright, transparent.

Microservice Monitoring with Prometheus:


Prometheus is a next-generation monitoring system designed for microservices. This talk will look at what's the best way to monitor your microservices, which metrics you should care about, how to have useful alerts and how Prometheus empowers you to do things the right way.

10 Questions to Answer Before Creating a  New Microservice:


Microservices might appear simple on the surface, but there’s more to creating them than just launching some code running in a container and serving HTTP requests from it. This talk will cover 10 important questions that you should answer about any new microservice before development begins on it – and certainly before it gets deployed into production.

Speaker Bios:


Jake Moshenko is the product manager for the Quay container registry at CoreOS, a Linux distribution with containers as a first-class citizen and software distribution channel. Formerly of Google, Amazon, and Boeing, he has been building robust distributed systems for over 10 years.

Quentin Machu is an engineer on the Quay team at CoreOS. In addition to working on the Quay team at CoreOS, he is a maintainer of the Clair open source project, which scans containers for vulnerabilities. He is passionate about software engineering and distributed systems. Quentin completed an award-winning OpenStack project as part of his master’s in computer engineering.

Brian Brazil is a Irish core developer of Prometheus. He has over 10 years experience managing and monitoring large-scale systems at companies such as Google. He now uses his skills to help organisations get the most out their systems and staff.

Brian Kelly is VP Engineering at Datawire, a company creating open source tools for building resilient microservices. Brian has spent over 20 years building software for technology companies. Prior to joining DataWire, he was VP of Engineering at TimeTrade, where he led their transformation from a monolithic to microservice-based architecture. He began his career with IONA Technologies, and managed the development of the Orbix middleware product, the world's most successful CORBA implementation. Later at Progress Software, he managed the development of the Sonic C++/.NET high-performance messaging and integration products, and was involved in the development of the AMQP messaging standard.

results.description:
Club Dance Class

guys & girls are welcome!

Would you like to feel confident on the dance floor?

These classes will prepare you for dancing in public!

How it works:

I, unlike other teachers, don't spend entire class on teaching you choreography - you don't need it unless you want to be a professional dancer. My focus is on teaching you how to move comfortably in a club, at a party, wedding, etc. (Unless of course you request choreography).

I teach basics: finding and keeping rhythm, easy steps you can use anytime making sure you know how to transition smoothly between them.

During the first class I assess what it is we need to work on; whether it's musicality, rhythm, coordination, attenuation, groove etc. From that point on, I adjust the class to students' needs.

results.description:
LOOKING GLASS: VOLUMETRIC DISPLAY PROTOTYPE

Come join the team from Looking Glass for a first look at their prototype lightfolding volumetric display.  This system takes depth video and 3D digital content from Unity3D and displays it in volumetric 3D space without the need for headgear or glasses. It allows potential experimentation with true volumetric games, depth videos of people, and imaging of 3D medical data. 


The system is fully integrated with Unity3D, and Looking Glass will describe how they created this new type of volumetric display. 

--------------------------------

WHAT WE DO

Open space for artists & technologists to get hands-on with new technology. We supply a bunch of hardware and a chill environment so you can hack away.

Tweet: @hardwarehacklab at #ThoughtWorksNYC

Visit: hardwarehacklab.io

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=0kxNCYpxcXM

We use creative coding environments like openFrameworks or Max/MSP to play with everything from webcams to Oculus Rift. People of all experience levels, from beginners to veterans are welcome here.

WARNING


This meetup has no particular structure. We don't have 'hack lab' projects. We work on whatever we, and you, bring in each week - which could be anything.

The schedule is loose, the feeling is social and non-judgemental. We are just curious and want to see your projects. So bring what you have and share!

ROSTER

Oculus, Kinect 1/2, Arduino, Leap, Glass, Depth video, Brain-Computer Interface, openFrameworks, SuperCollider, Max/MSP, vvvv, Processing.

DO YOU HAVE SPECIFIC NEEDS?

Some of these items are only available on request or particular occasions. Use the comments below and direct messages to find out if particular hardware or people with particular skills will be around that week.

If you can't confirm, still drop by and meet us. The lab is a great place to come and learn and meet people.

Goal: Get more familiar with JavaScript.


Whether you want to write your own programs in JavaScript or just want to communicate better with engineers, this class will get you started! This is part 2 of our 2 part free JavaScript workshop series, JS101 and JS201. Taking our JS101 workshop before attending JS201 is recommended, but you're more than welcome to come if you have very basic experience with JavaScript.

Prerequisites:

• JavaScript: Fundamentals: Syntax, Types, Variables, Keywords and Functions I

You'll leave knowing:

• JavaScript Fundamentals: Conditional Statements, Arrays, Loops and Functions II

Meet your instructor: 

Tyler Lambe was a professional developer across all platforms for over 6 years, before he made the transition into teaching full-stack web development. Having crafted full-fledged software engineers who previously had no experience, his passion lies in helping people accelerate their lives through education.

results.description:
Are you intimidated by the prospect of writing open source code? 

Have you struggled to find a project or figure out the ins and outs of the GitHub workflow? 

Maybe you want to refine the organization of your own open source project. 

Or perhaps you're not quite sure why you should even bother?


Come join Courteney Ervin, Lead Maintainer at CodeMontage and Developer for NYPL's Library Simplified, to discuss the extensive benefits of open source to your career and work step-by-step through the joys and tribulations of the contribution process. 

She'll explain how to push through your intimidation, amplify your learning, and strengthen your developer portfolio with open source!


PSSST: Bring your laptop and create a GitHub account before the session to be able to fully participate.

6:30-7 Food & community member lightning talks
7-7:30 Setting Your Open Source Priorities
7:30-8:30 Everything's a Pull Request When You Really Think About It
8:30-8:45 Intense Intents

Please note: this is an event intended for software developers who identify as women. 

We define "software developer" as anyone who has written a line of code (HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Ruby, Python, Java, whatever) and can explain what it does. Write/Speak/Code is for women, cis and trans, and is emphatically trans and queer friendly.
results.name: Breaking into Open Source Software

HALLELUYAH!! We made it through another winter but..the question is...are you ready to move on from the winter blues and move forward with a spring in your step? (no pun intend;-)

Are you thinking the same old thoughts that nothing is going to change for you? Are you feeling clueless and anxious as to how to fill your life with more love...fun and excitement? 

STOP WORRYING!! NOW is the time to come out of hibernation and de-fog your brain! Know this...NOTHING has to stay the same if you don't want it to! Let's meetup and discuss why you're stuck  in those negative thoughts and how to change your old beliefs and patterns while discussing all the New fresh ideas and beginnings that are yours for the taking!  

You have choices..the world is your oyster!! Only You can make it happen!!

Looking forward to seeing you!

results.description:
Are you a driven, innovative, and ambitious woman? Would you like to work in the cutting edge software development industry, but haven’t seized the opportunity to do so? We’ve been looking for you!

Grace Hopper Academy is the first immersive coding school in New York City for women. As a school that encourages diversity in tech, we want to eliminate any financial access barriers. Grace Hopper Academy will use a deferred tuition model, where students pay for their education only after after starting a rewarding career as a software developer. We succeed when you do!

As such, you’re invited to our in-person information session! Ask questions and learn about Grace Hopper Academy, our upcoming  June 6th and July 25th cohorts, and how to best prepare for the application process. We’ll meet at the Grace Hopper Academy campus after class, from 6:30-7:30 PM on Wednesday, April 27th.

Topics covered will include: 

• The JavaScript-driven curriculum 

• How to get started on application preparation resources

• What to expect from the Grace Hopper Academy experience

An informal Q&A session will follow the talk. 

We look forward to seeing you there!

results.description:
Prepayment is required HERE

------------------------------------------------ 
WHAT: BOWLING for Singles with a TWIST

WHERE: Bowlmor Times Square 
WHO: Single men and women ages 20's, 30's, & 40's

How it works 
Women will be paired up into teams of two or three and Men will be paired up into teams of three. Don't worry if you are coming alone or do not have three people to sign up. People will arrive early so you will have time to mingle with ice breakers and we will help create the teams. Each team will stay together throughout the event.

Next the fun begins. We will have one male team and one female team stationed at each bowling lane. This male and female team (known as a group) will combine to bowl one 10 frame game. Remember, you are not bowling an entire game yourself. This is a group effort. A person from the female team will bowl a frame. Next, a member of the male team will bowl a frame. Then female number two bowls a frame followed by male number two. The process continues until all ten frames are bowled. During this time all of the members of the group will be getting to know each other. Which ever group has the highest score at the end of each game will win a prize.

At the end of the game, the ladies will stay at the same lane. The male team will rotate to the next lane and the process begins again. We will continue for either two hours or until you have met everyone.

Note: You can still attend and be a member of a team even if you do not want to bowl.


Includes: Bowling, Shoes and scorecard matching.


**************Food and Drinks are available for purchase********


Question: I was interested in someone but am still uncomfortable asking them for contact information.


You will have the option to complete a scorecard at the end of the night and take notes during the event. You can write down the names of anyone you were interested in from the event. We will send them an email letting them know that you were interested and provide your email address..

-------------------------------------------------------------------------

Prepayment is required HERE

30-$35 depending on how early you register.

Prepayment is required HERE

We have been invited to see what it's like to work inside Meetup HQ!

The fantastic tech team at Meetup HQ has kindly invited our CUNY Tech Meetup members to visit their NYC office on the evening of Wednesday April 27th at 6:30pm. We will have the opportunity to see Meetup’s cool NYC office space and hear from their Chief Technology Officer, Yvette Pasqua, about what it's like to lead Meetup’s engineering team and run the technology that helps people build meaningful communities that connect people to each other. We’ll also hear from some of her engineers and from the head of Meetup’s Talent & Culture team as well. RSVP here to reserve your spot. 

Meetup is generously providing light snacks and beverages.

Note: If you RSVP yes to attend this meetup please include your last name on your profile page so that Meetup security receives an accurate attendee list. We cannot guarantee that you will be allowed admittance if your full name is not on the list or does not match your ID.

8:00 - networking

8:30pm - end

results.description:
Kafka Was the Rage: A Greenwich Village Memoir by Anatole Broyard

ANATOLE BROYARD became familiar to the readers of The New York Times in the 1970's as a book reviewer and personal essayist, but his literary reputation went back to the hip Village scene after World War II, when he gained some renown for a handful of diamond-hard stories and articles in little magazines. "I've read two stories by Anatole Broyard," wrote Norman Mailer, sizing up the competition in "Advertisements for Myself" (1959). "They are each first-rate, and I would buy a novel by him the day it appeared."

From NYT Article entitled 'Bohemian Rhapsody'

 ~Please be courteous by ordering food and/or drinks at the venue.

~RSVPs will be open until midnight the day before the event. I will also send out my cell number to those attending.

Looking forward to seeing you there!

~Hazel

DON'T HIRE A SALES TEAM, JOIN ONE! 

Welcome to TEAM Referral Network, where we are passionate about networking and connecting you with the right professionals to grow your business. TEAM Referral Network includes weekly meetings with your chapter, training programs, business development, and most importantly, quality business relationships.

HOW IT WORKS:

Membership is exclusive. Only one business for each category is allowed to join a TEAM Referral chapter. Weekly meetings give TEAM members the opportunity to market their business and get to know their fellow professionals and the business they represent. 

Members work together for a common goal: to increase their sales income and bottom line. 

WHY IT WORKS:

Everyone appreciates referrals! When people are looking for a product or service, a personal referral beats the Yellow Pages every time. Your business gains the competitive edge when a TEAM member refers someone to you and speaks well of your integrity, quality products and excellent service. If you do the same for your fellow TEAM members, everybody WINS!

There is so much more to TEAM Referral Network that happens outside of our chapter meetings. Members are encouraged to meet one-on-one with other members to get to know each other on a deeper level. The entire TEAM Referral Network has access to all members with the exclusive TEAM-sponsored member’s website. These “mini” websites give added value to your brand’s online presence and search engine rankings (SEO), as well as make it even easier for prospects to find your company online. TEAM Referral Network also provides regular business development trainings. TEAM Referral Network helps you exponentially expand your sphere of influence and grow your business referrals.

Come learn how to start or join a chapter!

results.description:
We have two great talks this month, covering a whole range of Reactive and Micro Service concepts. 


Please make sure you enter your first and last name as per your ID when you sign up, it will be required for entry.


Rethinking REST in a Microservices World with Lagom by Henrik Engstrom (Lightbend AKA Typesafe)


Don’t block on it! Migrate your codebase before its too late! by Sujan Kapadia (Chariot Solutions) 


---------------------------------


Don’t block on it! Migrate your codebase before its too late!  

Let’s face it - many of us regularly encounter (or may still be producing) code that performs blocking operations and doesn’t play nicely with new “reactive” libraries or fit well in the world of micro services. Most shops are either starting with existing code, integrating with legacy components, or even migrating Java code to Scala for example. In this talk, we’ll go over various “mundane” techniques to introduce incremental changes that can make your software “non-blocking” and “event driven”. While Scala Futures and Akka actors will take center stage, we’ll also cover topics such as functional error handling, monad transformers, thread pools, the circuit breaker pattern, non-blocking HTTP request handling, and briefly touch upon Akka Streams. These building blocks eventually lead to more advanced topics such as location transparency, micro services, and fully reactive APIs, but in my experience its necessary for teams to master the basics first.


About Sujan

Sujan Kapadia's 6th grade social studies teacher got him interested in programming and he’s never looked back. He’s spent the majority of his career developing enterprise and distributed software in Java for various industries. Sujan currently works for Chariot Solutions, where he’s part of a team of Jedi knights that get to wield light sabers and travel the universe. Two years ago he decided to power up and add Scala to his arsenal. Scala is spreading fast, and he’s used it for clients in telecom, e-commerce, and pharma. His current interests include machine learning, productivity hacks, and spending as much time as possible with his soon to be 4 year old daughter.

-----------------

Rethinking REST in a Microservices World with Lagom  

Many of us are doing microservices wrong. We’re splitting our systems up into smaller and smaller services, paying all the costs that that entails, but only getting a taste of the benefits, and the problem is REST. Microservices are supposed to promise isolation, isolation from faults, isolation from load failures, but synchronous communication means failure and unresponsiveness bubbles back up through our services along our communication pathways, undermining the promises that microservices offer. To realize the full potential of microservices, we need to stop using REST as our go to, and start rethinking our architectures to use asynchronous communication. This presentation looks at how this can be achieved in a practical manner by using Lagom; a microservices framework from Lightbend. 


About Henrik

After graduating with a M.Sc degree in Computer Science in 1998 at the Royal Institute of Technology, Stockholm/Sweden, Henrik has been working as a consultant up until his Lightbend (Typesafe) employment in 2011. Henrik has not only vast experience from various types of programming but also great domain knowledge within the finance, retail and e-gaming industries. Apart from his major interest, programming languages, he is also an avid Arsenal supporter, martial artist and a hobby wine connoisseur.
results.how_to_find_us: GILT office, 2 Park Ave, 5th Floor
results.name: (Not) Blocking, Akka, Microservices and Lagom!

results.description:
NY Women in VR welcomes Kiira Benzig of Double Eye Productions to present her VR project Cardboard City and Sarah Stevenson of REVRIE to present about what it's like to run an independent cinematic VR production company at our next meetup this Wednesday at East Coast Digital.

BIOGRAPHIES

Kiira Benzing (Director / Producer)
Kiira Benzing is a director and producer. Her work in theater includes translating Sotise Played by Eight Characters, a 500-year-old play from Middle French into English. In 2009 she founded Double Eye Productions where she has directed and produced multiple short films and interactive stories. “Cardboard City” her first venture in Virtual Reality recently won the Samsung Gear Indie Milk VR contest (2016).

Kiira graduated Summa Cum Laude with a double major in Performance Studies and French from Lafayette College. She has a Post-Graduate degree in Classical Acting from the London Academy of Music and Dramatic Arts (LAMDA). She has served as a Regional Emmy Awards Judge for the National Academy of Television Arts and Sciences. She serves as the Jury Coordinator at the DOC NYC film festival.

Awards: For her work with the Angels for Children Foundation in 2007 Verizon named her a “Local Hero.”

A winner of the Samsung Gear Indie 2016 "There in 60 Seconds" contest for Cardboard City premiered at the Sundance 2016 Film Festival. Cardboard City is featured on Milk VR. 


FILMOGRAPHY
Directing credits include: Matterspacetime (short), Cardboard City (VR), Double Portrait (hybrid medium in post), Finding The Wave (web series), The Wave Maker (feature documentary in post), and Boxed Out (VR in post production).

Producing credits include: A Butterfly Space (short) and the comedy feature film Other Plans starring Jamie Kennedy and Malik Yoba. She produced and co-starred in the multi-platform series Connection Unavailable about social media addicts seeking connection outside of the Internet. 

Cardboard City Description:

Peek inside the enchanted studio of Brooklyn-based stop motion animator Danielle Ash.

Sarah Stevenson (Co-Founder/Director/Producer)
Sarah Stevenson is the co-founder of REVRIE Immersive, a full-service cinematic VR production company, specializing in 360º monoscopic and stereoscopic VR, binaural sound, stitching and editing. 

Current REVRIE projects include: a music video directed by Skye Von, winner of the 2106 Indiegogo Fellowship, and developed in partnership with NYIT and the NY Media Center; a Red Bull five part science series with GZA of the Wu-Tang Clan as its host; a narrative short by filmmaker and actress Celia Au (Gotham, Demolition), and a music video for David Heartbreak of OWSLA, a record label and creative collective founded by Skrillex, featuring members of the Pennsylvania Ballet.


In addition to REVRIE, Sarah is also part of the founding team of SH//FT, a non-profit organization that partners with industry leaders in emerging technology (such as augmented reality & virtual reality) to sponsor and create opportunities for underrepresented groups (www.shiift.world).
results.name: Women in VR #2

Each class consists of asana, hand mudras, pranayama, chanting mantras, eye focus, deep relaxation, and meditation.
