results.description:
Have you ever tried Salsa? How about CUBAN salsa? Now is your chance to learn this exciting and fun dance! On Wednesday, April 27th, we are offering a Cuban-style Salsa TOTAL BEGINNER introduction class! The class will start its curriculum from scratch, will be in a dance studio, and will be kept comfortably small to facilitate learning, so IT DOESN’T MATTER IF YOU HAVE NEVER DANCED! Also, having a partner is not required as we constantly rotate during the class. This format gives you the opportunity to practice your steps with various partners and prepares you for the social dance scene in a safe and pressure-free environment - also a great opportunity to practice your Spanish!

The teachers, a male and female, teach progressive levels of Cuban Salsa Partner work, also known as Casino and Rueda de Casino - an interactive group dance where there are constant partner exchanges with fun patterns executed in unison!

The new session of Cuban Salsa begins on Wednesday, 4/27!

Wednesdays (April 27th - May 18th):

7:00-8:30pm Beginner Cuban Salsa & Rueda de Casino - Level 1
This class is for absolute beginners with little to no dance experience and will allow you to develop a strong foundation in Cuban Salsa in an extremely fun, stress-free atmosphere. In each 90-minute class of the four week series, students focus on developing dance fundamentals including rhythm, coordination, balance, and the specific technical aspects of Cuban Salsa, including basic steps and turn patterns, partnering technique, and the fundamental motions of Casino and Rueda de Casino. Students will also learn social dancing etiquette, floorcraft, and partner safety in an extremely warm, relaxed, social and fun environment. If you can walk, you can do this, so let your friends with two left feet know!

PRICE
-For First Time members & their guests, 1st Class: ONLY $10, 50% OFF!!!
Normally $20 Drop-In!
-Level 1 full month package of 4 classes: ONLY $60 - That's 4 classes (6 hours total) for the price of 3!!!

Adelante Studios
25 W31st Street between Broadway & 5th Avenue
2nd Floor
Grand Ballroom

Nearby Subways: 34th St Station on B, D, F, M, N, Q, R, & PATH trains.


*Can't find us? Call[masked] and we'll point you in the right direction.

All classes are taught by both a male, Chris, and female, Nayelli, so women can easily follow another woman while men are following a man at the same time! They have over 15-years of training, teaching, performing, and traveling to Cuba to collaborate with the very best in the Salsa world. Feel free to contact them at any time for additional info or if you have any questions.

Chris: [masked] /[masked]

Video links of our group doing Rueda de Casino:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=UK02-HTye7k

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cINgMRwiL7Q

For those with previous experience dancing Casino, we offer a Level 2/Intermediate class on Wednesdays at 8:30pm, immediately following the beginner class.

Intermediate - Level 2

Wednesdays (April 27th - May 18th):

8:30 - 10:00pm Intermediate Cuban Salsa & Rueda de Casino - Level 2

This progressive, 90-min class is geared for those that have danced Cuban Salsa and/or Rueda before and allows you to further solidify, fine-tune, and expand upon the basics covered in Level 1. Here is your opportunity to refresh all of the beginning motions at a pace that is comfortable for you while further building a solid foundation in this exciting, interactive, and fun dance. This high-energy class focuses on combinations, leading and following technique, group moves, styling, body motion, and fun salsa suelta footwork. By the end of the 8-week sequence, you will have all the tools necessary to get out on the dance floor and be fun, fluid, and spontaneous with everything you've learned. *For those that register for Level 2, Level 1 is included as extra practice, free of charge, in your monthly package.*

Sample Video: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cINgMRwiL7Q

***************************************************

We also offer classes at the advanced level on Tuesdays (starting April 26th) at Adelante Studios.  Here's the info -

7:00 - 8:30pm Intermediate-transition-to-Advanced Cuban Salsa & Rueda de Casino - Level 3

This progressive series serves as a bridge class for intermediate dancers who have already completed Level 2 and are ready to step up their game. The focus is on technique, as we will provide you with insights on what advanced dancers are constantly attending to while engaging with their partner. Each 90-minute session is broken down into 3 parts - Suelta (Footwork & Movement), Casino (One-on-One Partnering), and Rueda - all danced to rhythmically dense Timba. By the end of this 8-week series, you will be equipped with all the necessary tools to make a seamless transition into the advanced level. *For those that register for Level 3, Levels 1 & 2 are included as extra practice, free of charge, in your monthly package.*

Sample Video: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rSHUoyjfxlA

Location:


Adelante Studios
25 W31st Street between Broadway & 5th Avenue
2nd Floor
Grand Ballroom
*Can't find our room? Call[masked] and we'll point you in the right direction.

results.description:
In this dual talk, Libby Horacek and Daniel Patterson start out with a beginner friendly introduction to web development with the Fn web framework and then take a deep dive into continuations and how they are used to power the routing at the heart of Fn. Fn is a beginner-and-advanced-friendly routing layer on top of the WAI interface. It's a web framework, but a pretty minimal one. Writing web code with Fn is as similar as possible to writing regular Haskell functions. Instead of having web handlers that are opaque monadic actions, the handler functions take arguments (query parameters, segments of the url, or even post bodies) and return responses. In this part of the talk, we'll learn a little bit about Haskell web development while writing a simple application with Fn.

The second part of the talk will dive into how this url routing works. In particular, the `route` function takes a list of route patterns and functions with different numbers and types of arguments (that match the routes), something that's not obvious how to do in a statically typed language like Haskell. We'll look into how thinking in terms of continuations, a powerful programming technique with applications across disparate domains, can allow us to write this routing and wrap it up in an easy-to-use package. The talk begins this exploration of continuations with the simpler example of a type-safe printf and builds up to the full routing that powers Fn currently.
results.name: Web dev with Fn: typed URL routes using continuations

results.description:
COME CHECK OUT THE FIRST DAY OF THIS FIVE WEEK WORKSHOP FOR ONLY $5 BUCKS!

Meditative Writing with Jessica Hinds

“It took me four years to paint like Raphael, but a lifetime to paint like a child.” – Pablo Picasso

There was a time when creativity was easy—when you were a child, driven by an endless desire to create, and no fear, no judgment, and no internal censor whatsoever.

The goal of meditative writing is to return you to that time, when finding your voice as a writer was as easy as being yourself, and raw creativity flowed as effortlessly as inspiration.

You’ll learn to banish writer’s block forever, find inspiration in an instant, and discover the heart of your story and your characters, by tapping into your own voice as a writer, and your deepest creative instincts.

How Does It Work?

Each session begins with a short guided meditation, followed by a series of carefully crafted meditative writing exercises, designed to transport you out of your everyday life, and connect you to the emotional truth of your story and of your characters.

Over 5 weeks, you’ll build a writing practice that allows you to get your pages flowing at will, recover the joy you’ve always felt with writing, and write from your most connected place every time you sit down with your characters.

Meetup Members can check out the first session for only $5 bucks with no obligation, to decide if the class is right for you!

Who Should Take Meditative Writing?


Whether you are brand new to writing, or a seasoned writer looking to inject energy back into your writing, meditative writing will change your writing life forever.

Designed for writers of all types, including screenwriters, playwrights, poets, novelists, and writers of any other genre, here are just a few of the many benefits of this approach:

Uncovering the Real Emotional Underbelly That Drives Great Films

Discovering Your True Voice

Creating More Provocative Dialogue, Images and Action

Developing an “Inspiration on Command” Writing Schedule

Injecting Joy Into Your Writing Process

Getting in Touch With Your Characters

Finding the Heart of Your Story

Discovering Theme

Natural Subtext

Opening Up Your Creative Side

Learning How To Write Even When You Can’t Find a “Quiet Place”

Connecting Yourself To Your Characters and Story Even If You Are Working On Assignment

Writing Cooler, Bigger, More Intense and Compelling Scenes

Learning To Love Your Weirdness and Understand Its Value

Relaxation

Confidence

Focus

Banishing Writers Block Forever

Fun!

Learn more.

----

NORMAL COST: $350

MEETUP MEMBERS:  Check out the first day of this  5-week workshop for only $5 bucks with no obligation!

Class Size is Strictly Limited To Allow All Students The Opportunity to Workshop And Receive Feedback On Their Writing. You MUST RSVP to attend this event.

PLEASE PLAN TO ARRIVE 5 MINUTES EARLY TO ASSURE THAT YOU DO NOT DISTURB THE MEDITATION.

You'll LOVE this workshop or your money back!
results.how_to_find_us: Take the elevator to the sixth floor and enter the door on your right!
results.name: Meditative Writing with Jessica Hinds

results.description:
Have you ever tried Salsa? How about CUBAN salsa? Now is your chance to learn this exciting and fun dance! On Wednesday, April 27th, we are offering a Cuban-style Salsa TOTAL BEGINNER introduction class! The class will start its curriculum from scratch, will be in a dance studio, and will be kept comfortably small to facilitate learning, so IT DOESN’T MATTER IF YOU HAVE NEVER DANCED! Also, having a partner is not required as we constantly rotate during the class. This format gives you the opportunity to practice your steps with various partners and prepares you for the social dance scene in a safe and pressure-free environment!

The teachers, a male and female, teach progressive levels of Cuban Salsa Partner work, also known as Casino and Rueda de Casino - an interactive group dance where there are constant partner exchanges with fun patterns executed in unison!

The new session of Cuban Salsa:

Wednesdays (April 27th - May 18th):

7:00-8:30pm Beginner Cuban Salsa & Rueda de Casino  - Level 1

This class is for absolute beginners with little to no dance experience and will allow you to develop a strong foundation in Cuban Salsa in an extremely fun, stress-free atmosphere. In each 90-minute class of the four week series, students focus on developing dance fundamentals including rhythm, coordination, balance, and the specific technical aspects of Cuban Salsa, including basic steps and turn patterns, partnering technique, and the fundamental motions of Casino and Rueda de Casino. Students will also learn social dancing etiquette, floorcraft, and partner <a>safety in</a> an extremely warm, relaxed, social and fun environment. If you can walk, you can do this, so let your friends with two left feet know!

PRICE
-For First Time members & their guests, 1st Class: ONLY $10, 50% OFF!!!
Normally $20 Drop-In!
-Level 1 full month package of 4 Classes: ONLY $60
that's 4 classes (6 hours total) for the price of 3!!!

LOCATION
Adelante Studios
25 West 31st Street between Broadway & 5th Avenue
2nd Floor - Grand Ballroom (3,000 sq ft!)

Nearby Subways: 34th St Station on B, D, F, M, N, Q, R, & PATH trains.
*Can't find us? Call[masked] and we'll point you in the right direction.

All classes are taught by both a male, Chris, and female, Nayelli, so women can easily follow another woman while men are following a man at the same time! They have over 16-years of training, teaching, performing, and traveling to Cuba to collaborate with the very best in the Salsa world. Feel free to contact them at any time for additional info or if you have any questions.

Chris: [masked] /[masked]

Video link of our group doing Rueda de Casino
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=UK02-HTye7k
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cINgMRwiL7Q

For those with previous experience dancing Casino, we offer a Level 2/Intermediate class immediately following Level 1 on Wednesdays at 8:30pm.

Intermediate - Level 2

Wednesdays (April 27th - May 18th):

8:30 - 10:00pm Intermediate Cuban Salsa & Rueda de Casino - Level 2

This progressive, 90-min class is geared for those that have danced Cuban Salsa and/or Rueda before and allows you to further solidify, fine-tune, and expand upon the basics covered in Level 1. Here is your opportunity to refresh all of the beginning motions at a pace that is comfortable for you while further building a solid foundation in this exciting, interactive, and fun dance. This high-energy class focuses on combinations, leading and following technique, group moves, styling, body motion, and fun salsa suelta footwork. By the end of the 8-week sequence, you will have all the tools necessary to get out on the dance floor and be fun, fluid, and spontaneous with everything you've learned. *For those that register for Level 2, Level 1 is included as extra practice, free of charge, in your monthly package.*

Sample Video: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cINgMRwiL7Q

***************************************************

We also offer classes at the advanced level on Tuesdays (April 26th - May 17th) at Adelante Studios.  Here's the info -

7:00 - 8:30pm Intermediate-transition-to-Advanced Cuban Salsa & Rueda de Casino - Level 3

This progressive series serves as a bridge class for intermediate dancers who have already completed Level 2 and are ready to step up their game. The focus is on technique, as we will provide you with insights on what advanced dancers are constantly attending to while engaging with their partner. Each 90-minute session is broken down into 3 parts - Suelta (Footwork & Movement), Casino (One-on-One Partnering), and Rueda - all danced to rhythmically dense Timba. By the end of this 8-week series, you will be equipped with all the necessary tools to make a seamless transition into the advanced level. *For those that register for Level 3, Levels 1 & 2 are included as extra practice, free of charge, in your monthly package.*

Sample Video: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rSHUoyjfxlA

Location:

Adelante Studios
25 W 31st Street between Broadway and 5th Avenue
2nd Floor
Grand Ballroom

Nearby Subways: 34th St Station on B, D, F, M, N, Q, R, & PATH trains.

*Can't find our room? Call[masked] and we'll point you in the right direction.
results.how_to_find_us: Take elevators to the 2nd Floor & make a left. We have the entire studio loft space, complete with brand new, clean rooms, hardwood floors, mirrors, 12’ ceiling, A/C, & sound system.

Dear 350NYC Members and Friends,

2016 is already shaping up to be a big year for climate activists so let's keep the momentum going.  Join us and get involved!


Wednesday, April 27th @ 7-9pm

NEW MEMBERS:  If you're new to 350NYC please join us at  6:30pm  for a brief orientation to the group, learn about our working groups and some of the campaigns we are currently involved with.


AGENDA

1. We'll begin by showing Dr. James Hansen's "Ice Melt, Sea Level Rise and Superstorms Video" and discussing the recent science underlining the urgency of the Keep It In the Ground campaign.

2. For the second part we'll be engaging everyone in  planning for BREAK FREE ALBANY and the upcoming global escalation to break free from fossil fuels: May 14, 2016 - Break Free   http://breakfree2016.org/ Join a global wave of resistance to keep coal, oil + gas in the ground!

3. We'll share some exciting opportunities for local action to support activists fighting to stop fossil fuel infrastructure.

Looking forward to seeing you tomorrow.

results.description:
Join other writers for an hour of focused writing!

6-7 pm - Show up early, stake out a spot and either socialize or get a jump on writing.
7:00 - Start. Introductions, and we'll share what we're working on
7:05 - Get down to business. An hour of silence and solid writing!
8:05- Brief follow up. People are encouraged to share experiences & ideas, network or take off as they like. Feel free to keep writing if you've got the momentum going!

If you're spending too much time THINKING about writing, come and join us for a session of focused writing. It may just be "pipe-cleaning" for now, but you'll feel better showing up at the page. No one will see what you've written or give you unsolicited advice.

WHERE: David Rubenstein Atrium, 62nd and Broadway.

SOME TIPS:

Please, come on time! If you come late, we will have already started.
Bring headphones if you don't want outside noise distraction.

Please RSVP only if you can make it, and update as soon as possible if your plans change. We have had far too many no-shows.

You will see progress in your writing project by spending the minimum of a single hour per week on it. This is your practice/focus time, so I hope to see you there.
results.name: NYC Shut Up & Write Meetup! - Columbus Circle

results.description:
Hi all how is your week going so far? Hope you are surviving, lol. HAS proformance group is one of the famous and cutest children modern dance group in Korea and they will perform at KLCEM meet up night. Please come and enjoy K-pop and talented children!

Admission is $5

BYOB, We will serve Korean spicy rice cake and fish cake soup dish, but please bring some food as well to share!

results.description:
New York Times bestseller, “When Breath Becomes Air”, by Paul Kalanithi chronicles the author’s transformation from a naïve medical student “possessed by the question, given that all organisms die, of what makes a virtuous and meaningful life”? Paul, an aspiring neurosurgeon at Stanford working in the brain, that most critical place for human identity, becomes a patient and a new father confronting his own mortality.


We’ll explore what makes life worth living in the face of death. What do we do when the future, no longer a ladder toward our goals in life, flattens out into a present that now sees an ending? Are we allowing the fear of death to rob us of being fully alive?


These are some of the questions that we’ll be addressing over four Wednesday evenings as we discuss how we or our loved ones can “go on”, or in popular parlance “keep on keeping on”, particularly when facing a terminal illness prognosis. We invite you to bring your personal insights, your questions, even your doubts and fears as we take hope from the author as he quotes Samuel Beckett’s famous 7 words: “I can’t go on. I’ll go on.”
results.how_to_find_us: Between Second and Third Avenue. The closest train if the #6 at 33rd and Park Avenue South. Tell the doorman you are going to the Community Room on the Second Floor.
results.name: The last of our four sessions. Join us even is you haven't read the book!

results.description:
You’re a deep thinker, and you probably have a ton of questions about God, the Bible, and faith in general. Excellent — this is just the group for you. Whether you are a committed believer, a seeker, an agnostic or atheist, or you are a part of another faith, this is a fun and safe place to look for answers. We’ll gather for snacks, friendship, and to discuss some of the most intriguing questions out there.

Week 1: Is there evidence for God's existence?
Week 2: Is there evidence for the trustworthiness of Genesis? (Creation, Flood, Genealogies, etc.)
Week 3: Is Bible prophecy proof for the Bible?
Week 4: How do we know that Jesus was really sent from God?

Besides these four major questions, this will be a great context to bring up many of the other questions you’ve had. You'll learn of some excellent sources for finding answers, voice your thoughts, and hear the thoughts of others on these fascinating topics. Hope to see you there, and feel free to invite your friends along.

Wednesdays, 7:00-8:30pm April 13 - May 4th (4 weeks). Latecomers welcome!
Location: Midtown Manhattan, IBM Plaza (590 Madison Ave. @ 57th Street)
Contact: Beau ([masked])

#HopeHillNYC
HopeHill.com

Friends Forever #19

After a successful wedding for which Rarity designed the bride's dress and Mr. and Mrs. Cake provided the catering, Rarity sees the potential of going into business with the Cakes and opening a wedding boutique in Ponyville. When she proposes the idea to the Cakes the following day, the Cakes are hesitant, saying they're already busy running a bakery and raising two foals and that Rarity is known to be insistent in her business ventures. However, Rarity manages to strong-arm the two into agreeing.

Artwork by: Brenda Hickey

results.description:
Mindful Astoria: Wednesday Meditation Gathering

Join us on Wednesday nights for meditation and conversation about mindfulness. Learn how to bring mindfulness into daily life, and how to establish, maintain, and deepen a personal mindfulness practice.

Each class will consist of instruction in different forms of mindfulness meditation, and time for group discussion and connecting with the community. Depending on the week, the teacher may give a talk or share a reading about a related topic.

Check out our group guidelines.

Teachers for this night's gathering: Jessica Rodrigues and Emily Herzlin

Jessica Rodrigues is a public heath specialist and tango aficionado who loves travel, poetry and pistachio ice cream. She is has had a regular meditation practice for the past four years, and is currently a student in the Yearlong Immersion and Meditation Teacher Training program at the Interdependence Project. She is very proud to be a Queens native and returned home after many years living abroad.Jessica is committed to giving back to the place that nurtured her looks forward to meeting people in her hometown who are interested in meditation. 


Emily Herzlin is a writer and teacher with a particular love for memoir and poetry. She received her MFA in Nonfiction from Columbia in 2012. She began practicing meditation in 2003. In college she found her way to the Interdependence Project, where she now teaches meditation courses and retreats. Emily trained in MBSR (Mindfulness-Based Stress Reduction) at the University of Massachusetts Medical School. She has been teaching meditation since 2011 to groups and individuals.

Mindful Astoria

Every Wednesday, 7-8:30pm at the Astoria First Presbyterian Church.

All classes are drop-in, but RSVP. $5-$10 at the door to cover meetup dues and support the teachers and the Astoria Presbyterian Church. *Note that no one will be turned away for lack of funds. If you cannot afford the suggested donation, please give what you are able.

Email any questions to Emily Herzlin at [masked].

Looking forward to deepening practice and strengthening mindful community with you all!
results.how_to_find_us: The church is located at 23-35 Broadway, between Crescent St. and 23rd St. It is on the north side of Broadway, just past Trade Fair and Synergy Fitness. There is an awning over the front door. The church shares the space with Art House Astoria.
results.name: Mindful Astoria: Wednesday Meditation Gathering (with Jessica + Emily)

results.description:
On April 27, the @MACAULAY AUTHOR SERIES welcomes best-selling author Curtis Sittenfeld (Prep, American Wife) to read from and discuss her new novel, Eligible, a clever modern take on Jane Austen’s Pride and Prejudice. This event is Curtis Sittenfeld’s only New York appearance to launch her book. Set in very contemporary New York, Los Angeles, and her native Cincinnati, Eligible brings the reader into the lives of Liz, a restless, 30-something magazine writer, and her yoga instructor older sister, Jane (another style of New York resident), who, when their father suffers a health scare, return together to Cincinnati. As they reenter the different milieus of their mother and three younger sisters, with a mixed bag of suitors popping up throughout, they inevitably make for unforgettable Sittenfeld characters caught up in funny and tender scenarios that honor and update Austen’s classic.


Following her reading, Sittenfeld will be joined for an interview by best-selling author (My Life in Middlemarch) and New Yorker staff writer Rebecca Mead.

A book signing and informal reception will be held after the program. Books will be available for purchase; reservations are advised. The event will take place at Macaulay Honors College at 35 West 67th Street, from 7pm-9pm.

For reservations visit: http://macaulay.cuny.edu/rsvp or call (347) 460-4292.
For more information: http://macaulay.cuny.edu/community/author series/
results.name: @MACAULAY Author Series Presents Curtis Sittenfeld

results.description:
RAVENLOFT RETURNS!

Join us for the launch of a brand new season of D&D Encounters! Ravenloft, the classic D&D setting of gothic horror, rises from the grave as we begin with the exclusive Adventure’s League adventures leading up to Death House. This is a 5th Edition Dungeons & Dragons game for 6 players. Reserving a seat is no charge, but players pay a $10 door fee. Adventurer’s League passes can be purchases for $80, which cover 10 sessions of play.

In order to RSVP, players must go to our registration page and sign up for a specific table. Be sure to read the description to find out if the table matches your experience level! Be warned that signing up on this Meetup page does NOT guarantee a player a spot at a table.

Register here: bstrat.eventsmart.com

Play begins around 7:30pm and ends at 10:30pm. Late arrivals and early exits should try to notify their DM in advance, but are rarely a problem.

We will be creating characters during this first session and then running a three-week introduction to the game, a perfect opportunity for players who are looking to begin a fresh new campaign. Players are welcome to bring ideas for their character, or even build a 1st level character in advance and help the newer members. Character sheets, pencils, paper, dice, miniatures, and battlemaps are all provided by the store; copies of rulebooks are available to borrow, but are limited by supply. Players are welcome to bring their own gaming supplies as well as snacks and beverages.

Encounters welcomes brand-new players every week, so don’t hesitate to jump into one of our Beginner-level tables with no prior RPG experience!
results.name: Brooklyn Strategist Presents: D&D Encounters, Curse of Strahd

results.description:
IDEO is our event host:

Overview:

7:00 pm – Good eats and conversations

7:20 pm – Discussion on the latest in the mobile landscape

7:30 pm – Presentations: InVision / IDEO / touchlab

9:00 pm – NYC Apps after-party

Presenters:

Simon Kirk, Director of Business Development, InVision

Simon Kirk heads up growth for InVision in New York, supporting both large brands like Amazon and Disney and agencies like Ogilvy. Previously, he served on the leadership team at Two Toasters (acquired by Ticketmaster), which designed and developed mobile applications for Google, AirBnB, Birchbox, Regal Cinemas, and many others. Simon has held varied roles, from product management at a startup, to co-founder of the nonprofit RaisedBy.us.

InVision is the leading design collaboration platform used by nearly 2 million people worldwide. We provide an end-to-end design platform that takes an idea from concept to code.

About 70% of Fortune 100 companies are now using InVision including design teams at Disney, IBM, Walmart, Apple, Verizon and General Motors. 

We are creating a feature-length documentary about how designers are changing the landscape of business featuring AirBnB, Twitter, Uber, Dropbox, Etsy, HubSpot, Spotify and many more.

David Boardman, Senior Design Lead, IDEO

Sera Koo, Senior Interaction Designer, IDEO

Marco Righetto, Senior Interaction Designer, IDEO

As Interaction Designers, our role is to set the stage for conversations and design tools that can enable communication between people, objects, environments, and information. SMS is often underestimated, but is a powerful tool for prototyping these conversations. From design research to hacked simulations of products and services, SMS is a simple tool that goes a long way.

David Boardman is a Senior Design Lead at IDEO New York. He leads the Interaction Design discipline, and guides teams that design across multiple touch points to elevate people’s experiences and create innovative new businesses.

Sera Koo is a senior interaction designer and Grumpy Cat ambassador at IDEO. She’s happiest when she's prototyping experiences and making accidental discoveries.

Marco Righetto is senior interaction designer at IDEO with a passion for bringing delight by surfacing information in unexpected and relevant ways. He’s most excited when he can experiment with projects at the intersection of the physical and digital world.

Liam Spradlin, Design Lead, touchlab

Liam Spradlin is a UIUX designer working primarily on Android. He’s the lead designer at touchlab, and a Google Expert in UIUX. Liam has worked with clients including GE Appliance, the National MS Society, and the independent developers of apps like Nova Launcher, AllCast, Today Calendar, and Focus.

At touchlab, Liam helps partners craft Android experiences with great design as a foundational principle, whether the product is Android-first or expanding from other platforms. Whether it’s type design, interface, or illustration, Liam spends a lot of his free time continuing to explore design. Outside of that, you can find him behind a camera or writing blog posts.

Mutative design is a theoretical design methodology that would allow interfaces and experiences to be born, live, and evolve according to a user’s realities. With mutative design, things like physical ability, lighting, and vision are accounted for automatically, allowing interfaces to be engaging and accessible to every user, without compromise.

This month's apps:

InVision Viewer: iOS / InVision Labs: CRAFT

Spark Camera: iOS

1 Second Everyday: Android / touchlab: Selene

Twitter accounts to follow:

@InVisionApp / @IDEO / @touchlabNY

NYC Apps social accounts:

@nycapps / #nycapps

Facebook page: NYC Apps

We look forward to seeing you there.

-NYC Apps

results.description:
Peter Reiner is an avid hiker and leader of the Adirondack Mountain Club, North Jersey Ramapo Chapter. His presentation, “The Joys of Hiking,” features an in-depth discussion about how to get started in hiking and the trails in the lower Hudson valley and northern New Jersey areas. He will describe hiking trails in such parks as Sterling Forest, Harriman State Park, Bear Mountain, Black Rock Forest, Ramapo Preserve, the Eastern Hudson Highlands, and Mohonk Preserve. Peter will bring along his hiking equipment to show and discuss the ins and outs of back packs, hiking boots, hiking poles, ice crampons, snow shoes and appropriate outdoor clothing.


Peter's presentation will cover details about a typical hike, how hikes are rated in terms of length and difficulty, what to bring along and how to use New York-New Jersey Trail Conference hiking maps. He will discuss the use of GPS devices to locate your position and how to relate these coordinates to the trail maps. The discussion will highlight the beauty of the woods and the tranquility that day hiking offers to those of us who lead busy lives.

The presentation will include a photo show of some of the beautiful mountain peaks in the area, the rivers and valleys and views from all four seasons of hiking. Following his presentation, Peter will answer your questions and tell you how to get started as a new hiker or someone with more experience. Overall, this will be a lively, interesting topic to get you thinking about hiking and enjoying the wonderful woods that surround our area.

Starts at 7 pm at the Sloatsburg Library, 1 Liberty Rock Road, Sloatsburg, NY. 

*   *   *   *   *   *

The North Jersey Ramapo Chapter of the Adirondack Mountain Club, an outdoor recreation and conservation group founded in 1922 in New York City, sponsors hikes of different levels and other events on weekends and Thursdays throughout the year. Hike destinations in the scenic and historic Hudson Highlands region of New York and New Jersey include Sterling Forest, Ramapo Reservation, Harriman-Bear Mountain State Park, Jockey Hollow, and the West/East Hudson trails. Special outings may involve trips to other destinations, such as the Catskills and Adirondack Mountains.

Members are a diverse group of men and women of all ages, families and outdoor enthusiasts, those interested in a workout, and people who want to enjoy beautiful vistas in good company.

Our full hike schedule can be viewed on our website at hudsonhikers.org, and some hikes and announcements are also posted here on Meetup and on our Facebook page.
results.name: The Joys of Hiking (Presentation)

results.description:
Entrepreneurship comes with many obstacles. Startup owners and employees usually don’t count on fringe benefits that big corporations can provide. Also, most often their equity in the company is subject to all kinds of restrictions, their time with the company & performance being just a few of them. At the same time should the business grow exponentially, how to make sure the taxes won’t wipe out 50% of the profits as often is a case in the absence of careful preliminary planning. How can you ensure that your time with the company will not be wasted and you or your heirs will enjoy the benefits of your labor? In this presentation Jules Haas, Esq. will help you navigate the potential complications of planning an estate as a small business owner and practical strategies to overcome the said. About Jules

Jules Haas is an attorney with 30+ experience and well versed in Probate, Estate Planning, Real Estate matters, Closings, Trusts and Wills, Guardianship, Estate Settlement, Estate Litigation and other issues on request. His presentations, talks and seminars create an easy environment for open discussion on tough to tackle topics. His presentations are engaging, thorough and presented in an easily digestible language. These particular topics can be difficult to address and he approaches them with understanding, genuine interest and practical sensibility. For examples of past presentations please visit his Jule's You Tube Channel, https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC5KR_-3HNAhLLDZGZfXJt0w and his website <a>www.juleshaasattorney.com.</a>
results.name: Estate Planning for Small Business Owners

results.description: Come to our purely positive séance where we encourage mystics, psychics, mediums and all people to enhance their spiritual awareness in a safe and empowering environment. All of our séance conductors are highly trained and renowned mediums. Whether you are looking to connect with a loved one who has recently passed or to receive messages from spirit, our group offers a warm and friendly environment to all who are interested. Before each séance we begin our group with a 15 minute lesson on psychic development, covering topics from psychic impressions to spirit communication. We then begin our séance with a nondenominational prayer of protection and lead a guided visual mediation. After the meditation each person who attends will receive a message from one of our highly trained séance conductors. All participants are guaranteed to receive a message. Our group meets for approximately 2 hours. The purpose of our séance is to communicate directly with spirit and to form an open and inviting spiritual community in New York City Our meeting times are every other Wednesday Night at 7:00pm and our fee is $20. Please be timely, because we do not open our doors once we begin our meditation (for obvious reasons :). For legal purposes it is understood that our group and the messages given at our séances are for entertainment purposes only.

results.description:
NOTE:  Everyone MUST complete RSVP on Eventbrite and RSVP on Meetup is NOT an OFFICIAL RSVP

Let's face it, the idea of "no need to reinvent the wheel" is not 100% applicable in the age of media.  What once worked as a good publicity tool in the age where magazines, newspaper, and TV dominated the media doesn't necessarily work for more internet and mobile media platforms.  What once worked as a key strategy to dominate Google's search results based on Google's algorithm can become obsolete overnight.  At this event we will address adapting to new media platforms and algorithms.  While also proving that viral content and quality content are as connected as tasty pizza is to cleansing toothpaste.

NOTE:  This event is open for everyone to attend.  It is free exclusively for active content creators and we have application form.  If anyone wants to attend just to learn and get deep and SERIOUS insight on content creation than please purchase a ticket. 

Video-  We will have a presenter talk about new tools people can use to create content that "wows!" people by utilizing live streaming and virtual reality.  How to use new content like 360 video, VR, and live streaming where it is more than just a gimmick and why gimmicky content might "wow!" a visitor but not stick.  We will also talk about video platforms like Masquerade and Snapchat.  While also learning ways you can create online short videos that are engaging and take less than 15 minutes to make and only require a smartphone.

Photos-  We will discuss which photos on Facebook and Instagram are the types that not only generate page views but also encourage comments and discussion, and how to create memes that encourage engagement.

This is also a way to learn about how other content creators are producing content, what content works, and what content doesn't seem to work.

Please make sure to RSVP on Eventbrite http://www.eventbrite.com/e/content-creators-get-together-fireside-chat-with-the-chief-editor-tickets-24185323955
results.name: Content Creators Get Together

Matt Harrigan, Co-founder and MD

Our Speaker

Matt Harrigan is the Co-founder and Managing Director at Grand Central Tech (GCT).

GCT is New York City's premier business accelerator. Matt and team have completely reinvented the accelerator model. They connect you with mentors, investors, customers, and office space for one year without giving up equity or cash. Learn about their program, best practices from their startups, and how to grow your company.

Prior to GCT, Matt was a PM at ESPN focused on mobile applications. Before ESPN, Matt worked at Fahrenheit 212 and Booz Allen Hamilton. He's a proud New York native and graduate of Regis High School (and a Rice Owl)

Matt will share his journey, tips on how to get seed and Series A financing, and more. And he'll do it in rock climbing shoes.

results.description:
We'll meet at the Main Street School parking lot for a loop run to Tarrytown and back. This is a lovely "run in the dark" with Hudson River views. Total distance is just over 4 miles. 

Details about the run

Route: We’ll leave promptly at 7pm from the Main Street School parking lot. We'll head north on the Old Croton Aqueduct Trail, and turn left (west) at the Lyndhurst greenhouses to connect to the Riverwalk. At the Riverwalk we'll continue north to Van Wart Ave, before turning right (east) to return to Broadway for the run back to Irvington. A route map is available here. 

Special equipment: Headlamp or small flashlight (winter months)

Modifications for a shorter/slower-paced run: At various points runners can divert east toward Broadway and head back to Irvington.

Water/Bag Storage: There are no water fountains along the route, so bring a water bottle if you need one while running. If the weather is warm, I’ll bring water and cups for after the run. There’s no bag storage, so leave belongings at home or in your car.


Location: Main Street School parking lot (101 Main St)

Join our Facebook group to post pictures or message other members.

General advice & guidelines for our regular meetup runs

• RSVP if you are going. If your plans change, simply change your RSVP.

• There is no bag storage, so please bring only what you plan to run with.

• All regular runs are rain or shine, unless the weather is actually dangerous.

• If you arrive late, can’t find the start location, miss us for any reason, run anyway!

Feel free to contact me either via my meetup account or at [masked] if you have any questions.
results.name: Irvington to Tarrytown Loop

results.description:
Join us for Summer Tennis.

Check in at Clubhouse for court assignment upon arrival, then play under the lights 'til 10:00pm at this beautiful wooded park*.

Please remember to check in with the clubhouse to reserve a court. Players need to reserve a court with at least one other player present and should be a Hudson County resident with ID.

Mention to the court staff that you are with the Meetup group and ask that they keep us together if possible (3 courts).

Make sure you only use 3-4 of the same numbered balls. Public courts do not allow use of more than 6 balls per court.

Also please try to use the same age balls as it will help you improve your game. And remember to bring plenty of water!

You can find each other in the waiting area and/or looking on the courts. It would help if you make a mental note of the profile picture of those attending. I will provide my cell # for RSVP's so we can find each other. Please also bear in mind that we are usually on more than one court - they are available on a first-come, first-serve basis. You should locate other players and grab a court when you arrive.

Although we won't enforce attendance, please keep your rsvp updated because others are looking to find partners to hit with. Remove your name from the list if you are not planning to attend.

Inclement weather cancels the event.

If you have any questions, feel free to email the organizer.

Thank you all for this great group!

*Free for Hudson County residents. Those outside of Hudson County may play as a guest of the resident players to avoid a possible $10 fee to play.

April 27th, 7pm-9pm

Pratt Institute

Center for Career & Professional Development

200 Willoughby Ave, East Hall 1, across from the Engine Room

free, space is limited, RSVP

***please note this event is cross-posted on other meet ups &  eventbrite, so attendance is higher than indicated


with Special Guests:  

Katayoun Chamany - Associate Professor of Biology, Director Interdisciplinary Science, The New School

Tracy Essoglou - Founder, CultureScaping – social literacy salons & culture seminars; recognized artist, author, indie scholar, practicing philosopher, & activist

Deepu Gowda - Physician, Associate Professor of Medicine & the Director of Clinical Practice in the program in Narrative Medicine at Columbia University Medical Center

Matthew Stanley - Associate Professor History & Philosophy of Science NYU Gallatin

Zishan Ugurlu - Associate Professor of Theater, Program Director, The New School

Science (as) Culture: a three part ‘dinner’ conversation 

Scientists make discoveries, engineers design new technologies, artists create multi-media installations contemplating how the world works, corporations develop and distribute new products, policymakers, researchers, creatives, and grassroots movements alike attempt to create positive impacts, while some people instead either choose to remain a passive observer or feel their voice goes unheard.

Ideally, all of these actors could work together at all stages of scientific and technological development to ensure the best outcomes for society as a whole. However, integrating these often disparate and sometimes competing fields—labs, creative spaces, corporations, universities, funding organizations, movements, governing bodies, and communities—is challenging.

Ligo Project is working to dissolve those boundaries and to tackle this challenge with creativity.

Join us at the table for an intimate yet challenging 3-part multi-disciplinary discussion that gives everyone the opportunity to be heard and aims to change how we as a society think about, learn about, and talk about art, science and technology.

Be part of the conversation by taking a seat at the table.

Part 1 – Integration of Science & Society: the current view?

March 30th, Pratt Institute

Part 2 – Fostering Creativity & Social Responsiveness to Science and within Science

April 27th, Pratt Institute 

Part 3 – Science as Culture: the 1000-year view & how to get there?

May 18th, Pratt Institute

How it works:

Science (as) Culture will use a format inspired by Lois Weaver’s conversation as performance project ‘The Long Table’, which is informal, participatory & nonhierarchical. Special guests are invited to “seed” the conversation but the “audience” is invited to take a seat at the table and join in. At all points in this discussion, it will be important not to take “progress” as self evident, and to ask why a particular idea or research practice makes sense. The rules of engagement will be such that free thought and open exchange are highly encouraged at all times – everyone’s voice is heard.

Event Schedule:  
Doors: 30 min prior 
Discussion: 90 min 
Mingling afterwards: The Emerson, 561 Myrtle Ave.

www.ligoproject.org

results.description:
Come join us for our climbing Meetup!!

As usual, everyone is welcome to join in on the fun as long as you're at least 18 years old, whether you’re a complete beginner just looking to give the sport a try or a seasoned veteran that can show the best of us a few new tricks. Bring your friends too, even if they've never tried climbing before. We'll make sure everybody is set up and having a blast. Age and strength don't even matter, everybody has fun.

1st time climbers at The Rock Club get in for FREE! All you have to do is rent a harness and shoes for $10.25. Returning Meetupers get a discounted daypass rate of $15. And be sure to have a look out at the gym for other special Meetup discounts.

We also host a special Meetup 101 class from 7:30 - 9pm for Meetup members only. When multiple people sign-up for the class you pay only $45 ($15 discount!).

Reserve your spot with the booking button and enter the promo code "Meetup" on the booking page.

IMPORTANT!!  This offer has restrictions. It is only valid for the Weds night Meetup 101 class, you must already be a meetup member and RSVP for the meetup as well (no guests).

</a>

<a href="http://bookeo.com/climbrockclub?type=2126XUFJR1387C98D3A8">

If this is your first time climbing just come on in and join the group. There’s no need to take the class just yet. You’ll be able to join other Meetup members who already have their belay certification. This way you’ll be able to get up and on the wall right away! When you decide that you absolutely love climbing (which you will!), then you can sign up for the class the following week.

As a heads up, when you come into the gym, the front desk staff will get you set up with gear and get you in the system. There will also be name tags for everyone. Wear them with pride so everyone knows who’s a part of Meetup!

DETAILS - Please read carefully!

RSVPing and Questions:
If you're attending the belay course you MUST call TRC to reserve your space.
If you have any questions, please email TRC directly:
[masked]


Time:
The closer to 7:15 pm you arrive, the better. The 101 class starts at 7:30 sharp.

Directions & Transportation:
Please save time and aggravation by getting directions from our website (BEFORE you call or email us for directions :-). If you're coming on Metro North as a group (2 or more people!) we'll pick you up from the train station. Use the message baord to connect with other riders.  Just give us a call to let us know when you'll arrive. Go to the taxi stand in front of the station building!

We're looking forward to seeing you soon!

results.description:
Hello all, sorry for the delay in sending this out - in the depths of dealing with a terrible 2 year old I haven't found the time to get moving on Book Club #2! We had a great meet up this Sat 27th Feb, a good chin wag about AJ Fikry's Storied Life. I hope you enjoyed reading the books.

Our next book has been selected: My Brilliant Friend by Elena Ferrante

'A modern masterpiece from one of Italy s most acclaimed authors, "My Brilliant Friend" is a rich, intense, and generous-hearted story about two friends, Elena and Lila. Ferrante s inimitable style lends itself perfectly to a meticulous portrait of these two women that is also the story of a nation and a touching meditation on the nature of friendship. The story begins in the 1950s, in a poor but vibrant neighborhood on the outskirts of Naples. Growing up on these tough streets the two girls learn to rely on each other ahead of anyone or anything else. As they grow, as their paths repeatedly diverge and converge, Elena and Lila remain best friends whose respective destinies are reflected and refracted in the other. They are likewise the embodiments of a nation undergoing momentous change. Through the lives of these two women, Ferrante tells the story of a neighborhood, a city, and a country as it is transformed in ways that, in turn, also transform the relationship between her protagonists, the unforgettable Elena and Lila. Ferrante is the author of three previous works of critically acclaimed fiction: "The Days of Abandonment, Troubling Love," and "The Lost Daughter." With this novel, the first in a trilogy, she proves herself to be one of Italy s great storytellers. She has given her readers a masterfully plotted page-turner, abundant and generous in its narrative details and characterizations, that is also a stylish work of literary fiction destined to delight her many fans and win new readers to her fiction."

I thought this time our meet could be week night evening meal so more people can make it. I was thinking Thurs 7th April. This gives us all plenty of time to read it and I'll send out a reminder nearer the time.

Look forward to sharing this one with you all!
results.name: British Mums Book Club - April "My Brilliant Friend"

results.description:
By popular demand, we're offering these classes on Wednesday this month. Let me know what you think!


Come join our class with instruction. Every class includes exercises to improve your drawings, and help you see and understand the figure better, as well as a lot of drawing from the nude. We'll include both very basic and advanced topics, based on what the students in class are doing (that's you).

Some of the topics we frequently cover include:
--Proportion
--Foreshortening
--Shading
--Anatomy
--Perspective
--Different ways of seeing the figure
--Materials and their influence on how you draw
And much more!


Because it's a small class, there's a lot of personalized attention, but no pressure. If there's something specific you'd like to work on this is a great place to explore it, and if you're not sure what's blocking you this is probably the place where we'll find it and fix it!

Bring your own art supplies, and lets make some magic!

Note we'll be in Studio F, 11th floor

results.description:
Come and join us for an evening of fun and TurnOn. How often do we get an opportunity to be real with each other in NYC?

We play 3 communication game (you can play at whatever level feels comfortable to you). Imagine meeting new people in an environment where people felt comfortable to be themselves. That's what we have created.

It's a refreshing change from the typical networking or bar conversation.

You get the opportunity to examine yourself. Through other people putting quality attention on you, asking questions with genuine curiosity, and then listening - really listening – to your responses.

What comes up might surprise you!

At the end of the evening we will tell you all about how you can learn the practice of Orgasmic Meditation. What class you can take and what we have to offer so you can have the life that you want.

It's amazing how connected we can end up feeling - even in a room full of strangers - when we are willing to say what's real. In an hour and some you may even forget for a moment you are in New York City.

OneTaste NYC is an organization teaches Orgasmic Meditation, otherwise known as OM. The games we play at TurnON are designed to create the visceral sensation of Orgasm/OM in your body, without having to actually do the practice (or remove any clothing!).

It's a friendly invitation to play and push your edges in a way that feels good. This allows you to stretch yourself and inspires self-discovery!

Come early, doors close at 8:10p.  

COST TO ATTEND IS $10.

For questions contact [masked] |[masked]


Can't make this one?  Visit us at www.turnonny.us

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8OWkv9zms4E

results.description:
Are you just getting started on your real estate investing journey? 

Our group might be just the thing you are looking for then. If you are ready to introduce yourself to the world of real estate, then come check out our group to help you with everything from saving up for your first purchase, finding the right agent, to screening your first tenants. 

We have hundreds of seasoned successful investors to help newer investors launch their investing careers into orbit.

Breaking into real estate investing can be intimidating. This is a welcoming place where new investors can learn and formulate strategy while receiving feedback from seasoned investors and each other.

Our group will introduce you to comprehensive investment training that can show you how to:

• Identify Foreclosure and Pre-Foreclosure Properties in Your Area

• Determine Property Values in Today's Market

• Recognize Potential Exit Strategies

• Master Negotiating Techniques with Both Homeowners and Lenders

• Find the Money to Finance Your Deals

• Negotiate with lenders

• Closing the Deal

If you are new to real estate investing, seasoned investors with decades of experience, are just the thing you need! The bad real estate deal you avoid is JUST as important as the great deal you land. 

There is an abundance of distressed properties in virtually every market across the U.S. That means an abundance of opportunity once you know where to look, what to offer, and what to do with the property once you acquire it.

Discover This Never-Ending Source of Cash Flow Opportunities

Thank yourself later & RSVP NOW!!!
results.name: Learn How to Use Real Estate Investing to Achieve Financial Freedom!!

results.description:
Previously filmed in 1932 as Vampyr, Sheridan LeFanu's classic psychological horror tale was given a second go round in 1961 as Blood & Roses (Et Mourir de Plaisir). While Carl Theodor Dreyerconcentrated on mood and suspense in Vampyr, Blood & Roses director Roger Vadim goes directly to the jugular, so to speak, with generous doses of eerie eroticism. Annette Vadim plays Carmilla, who upon learning that she had a vampire ancestor becomes obsessed with finding out even more. Soon Carmilla has succumbed to the siren song of vampirism, and cannot quench her insatiable thirst for human blood. The lesbian subtext in the LeFanu original is played out con brio by Vadim-though not in the heavily bowderlized version made available to American audiences in 1962. Blood & Roses was subsequently remade as The Vampire Lovers and The Blood-Spattered Bride.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=n3ycIWlSkuE

results.description:
This is a weekly improv class appropriate for all levels (including beginners) taught every Wednesday from 8:30-10:30pm.  The focus will be on scenework, rather than games.

-- Are you a bit shy and looking to get more comfortable with your public speaking? 


-- Are you a working professional hoping to be a bit more spontaneous during your meetings and interactions with co-workers? 

-- Or are you an actor or improv comedian looking to take your craft to the next level or get more reps?

Then this is the class for you! In this class, you will learn the fundamentals of scene work (role playing). You'll be on your feet quite a bit as I'm believer that you learn (and have more fun) through doing rather than hearing an instructor talk. Brief individual notes will be given, if that's what you're looking for, and tailored to your level of experience. At the end of each class, I'm confident you'll feel a sense of accomplishment that will leave you more energized and excited to tackle the challenges of everyday life, whether at your work place or in your personal life. 

Each class is $10, and the fee is used to help cover the cost of the room rental, Meetup fees, and website.  The class will be capped at 14 students to make sure that you have sufficient time to be on your feet.  Guaranteed satisfaction or your money back.  

Hope to see you there,

Steve

www.improvnow.com

www.facebook.com/improvnow

Steve Ling is an alumnus of the improv programs of the Upright Citizens Brigade, Peoples Improv Theater, Magnet Theater, & Annoyance Theater.  He regularly produces and performs improv, musical improv, & hip hop improv across NYC.

results.description:
Mt. Beacon Fire ~Tower Hike ~ SUNRISE.     A fast pace all the way to the tower so we make the sunrise and can get to work after.  Not good for a first time hiker . 

4 miles 

Hiking Poles are helpful


Trail info- We will be taking the steps from the Gateway park to the Red trail. The trail is 6 or 7 switchbacks up to the old casino with a very rewarding look out point where you can see sweeping views of the Hudson river and surrounding area.  From there we continue to the Firetower.  


Distance: 4 miles round trip

The First 0.8 miles of this hike is hard, and very steep with 1000ft. elevation gain.
Mount Beacon is the second highest point in the Hudson Highlands. Depending on the map, it may be called Mount Beacon or Beacon Mountain. The mountain consists of two peaks. The northern peak is 1531ft and has a series of radio antennas on its summit. The higher southern peak is 1610ft and has a lookout tower on its summit.
On a clear morning we will see the NYC skyline lights from the summit as well as views of the town of Beacon and the majority of the Highlands (including Storm King, Breakneck Ridge, and little Sugarloaf).

We leave right at 5:15 AM.  Don't be late we will not wait.

+++

You are responsible to research the event, know the area, and bring the proper gear.

This release extends and applies to, and also covers and includes, all unknown, unforeseen, unanticipated and unsuspected injuries, damages, loss and liability.

Your attendance on a hike signifies that you have read and accept the terms of this liability waiver. By signing up for this group or event you understand that you are attending all events AT YOUR OWN RISK. Organizers and Assistant

Organizers of this group are just that, we organize the events and hike together as friends. There are no leaders on these hikes, you are your own leader - This is YOUR hike

http://ceciliawongskincare.com/


Comes join us and network with 30 professionals looking to grow their businesses. 


See you Thursday morning bright and early.
results.name: BNI Chapter 34

group.name: Serious Networkers Meet in Manhattan Every Thursday morning

results.description:
Business networking and referral group
We start PROMPTLY at 7AM
Complimentary breakfast is provided.
results.name: Doug Zucker - Greenway Mortgage

results.description:
Positive Connections for Success is a more relaxed and personal networking group for business professionals looking to build relationships and grow their business through referrals.

We focus on:

• Networking: Building relationships and earning each others trust to become referral partners

• Education: Understanding your business and helping you articulate your business

• Leadership: Leaders of the round table philosophy, every member is a leader of this group

We follow a structured meeting agenda starting with networking to develop relationships, giving us time to talk and get to know each other while having a warm breakfast, followed by:

• One Minute Elevator Pitch

• Business Presentations with Q&A and feedback (we have a large screen & clicker/pointer available for powerpoint presentations)

• Brainstorming Session, Successes & Referrals to Help Each Others Businesses grow

• Lots of Fun in the Process

"We Refer Business Partners, Not Business Cards!"

This is a group with category/specialty specific members (only one member per category/speciality).
Please view our sponsors page or contact us to verify your industry, category and specialty, before attending a meeting so as to not be in conflict with a group member.

We meet every Thursday morning from 7:00 AM to 8:30 AM and welcome guests to come and experience the group and then apply to join.

Non-members/guests pay a $10 fee to attend, which includes a warm served breakfast of their choosing and we ask to please be prepared with a one minute elevator pitch presenting:

• who you are

• type of business

• who would be a good referral for you


Current positions that we are interviewing, to build relationships with and pass referrals to include:

• Attorney

• Mortgage Broker

• Realtor

• Electrician

• Landscaper

• Limo or car service

• Painter

• Plumber

• And more...

Please contact us for information or if you have any questions.

We look forward to seeing you at our next meetup!

results.description:
What's more fun than exploring algorithms first thing in the morning? Grab a cup of Joe from downstairs and meet us upstairs we'll be digging into a favorite algorithm

using any of our favorite (or not-yet favorite) languages. This is a great way to do two things at once: learn more about an algorithm and get the added bonus of seeing how different languages approach the same problem. So lets: sort and parse, hash and search, match and test, together. some implementations of: Karger's Minimum Cut

results.description:
Hey, Brick Oven Bakers!

Please volunteer to help build the core of the new Old Stone House community oven, fireplace, and hearth from start to finish, and learn the secrets of brick oven construction from professional oven mason Pat Manley.

This Meetup is now FREE. Space is limited because only 8 people can work on the oven efficiently at once. So if you RSVP "yes" and then can't make it, please change your RSVP to "no" so someone else can get a spot.


No prior masonry experience needed.

We're building the core of the oven from Wednesday, April 27, through Monday, May 2.

Please volunteer for as many (or as few) days as you can make it, on any combination of days. The more you help, the more you'll learn!

Every day you'll get to:


- Participate in building the core of the oven and hearth 
- Learn about materials, masonry techniques, and oven engineering
- Ask lots of questions and take photos of the process 
- Learn from Pat's over twenty years of oven-building experience 
- Hang out with Pat over beer in the evenings

Different stages of the process will occur on different days, including: groundwork, the base slab, framing the door and arch, laying the door and arch, oven insulation, and facing. We'll also be laying the fireplace and hearth. You'll get to work on different parts of the process depending on which days you attend.

You should plan to wear closed-toe shoes -- wear boots if possible -- and bring work gloves and a bottle of water. We'll provide snacks! This is an all-day event, so you should plan to bring lunch, or you can get lunch from one of the great local shops and restaurants around the park.

About the Mason

Pat has over twenty years of experience building brick ovens for restaurants, bakeries, vineyards, and backyards all over the country, and has taught dozens of oven-building workshops to beginners and professionals. And every year Pat leads Masons on a Mission to build masonry stoves in Guatemala.


Whether you want to build your own backyard oven, or work in a bakery, or just want to learn a new skill, this is a great learning opportunity!

If you have questions about the project, write to Jace at [masked].


See you soon!
results.name: Volunteer Community Oven Building with Pat the mason - Thursday

results.description:
Half-day Tableau Workshop for only $50! Bring your Windows 7+ laptop or Mac and get ready to dive into Tableau Desktop, the user-friendly BI tool by Tableau. A 14-Day License Trial is available by downloading Tableau Desktop from the Tableau Website. 

Tableau Desktop allows for self-service data discovery by making it easy for users to rapidly create visualizations, analyze data from multiple data warehouses, and distribute these insights. The BI tool comes with both a powerful easy to use back-end and a gorgeous front-end for interacting with data. Just starting out with Tableau? Then this course is just for you! 

In this session we will go over the basics of Tableau Desktop all the way from connecting to your data to producing meaningful data visualizations. A couple of the topics that will be covered include understanding the Desktop Pane, exploring different chart types, and proper formatting techniques of your visualizations. 

No previous experience with Tableau required!
results.name: Tableau Training Workshop by Keyrus

results.description:
LEADER:  Fred Hodde ([masked] or[masked](h)/ 973-[masked](c))

RATING: B 6.5 B

Meet at the Johnsontown Circle at 9:30 AM. The planned route will be on the Blue Disc, Victory and White Bar Trails. Call cell before 9 AM if the weather is questionable. TC Southern Harriman map 118. 

Note that this hike is part of a larger group, the NJR ADK. Most hikers sign up via our printed schedule (see below) and not through Meetup, so though the number of attendees may appear small, we generally have a group of 10-20 on any given hike.


*   *   *   *   *   *


 Our full hike schedule can be viewed on our website at hudsonhikers.org, and some hikes are also posted on our Facebook page.

After attending two hikes/events, please consider joining the North Jersey Ramapo Chapter of the Adirondack Mountain Club to support our outdoor recreation and conservation activities.  Membership comes with a variety of benefits including a 10% discount at Ramsey Outdoor; our annual holiday party and social; special events such as our traditional day-outing to the Mohonk Mountain House; a subscription to ADK’s bi-monthly magazine, Adirondac; and the opportunity to contribute to the preservation and extension of hiking lands and viewsheds in our region.

New hikers are strongly encouraged to select hikes appropriate to their capabilities. North Jersey Ramapo Chapter hikes are rated for pace (A, B or C), mileage, and terrain (A, B or C), with "C" designating easier hikes and "A" more challenging ones. We recommend that new hikers should first try a "C" or short "B" hike before undertaking a more difficult one; otherwise, you may not fully enjoy the hiking experience. If you have any doubts, please contact the hike leader in advance. 

Pace Ratings: 
     A = Fast - 2.5 mph or faster 
     B = Moderate - about 2 mph 
     C = Easy - 1.5 mph or less 

Distance: Noted in miles 

Terrain Ratings:
     A = Strenuous, long/steep climbs and descents, 
             possible rock scrambling
     B = Moderate climbs and descents
     C = Generally flat with little elevation change 

For example, a hike rated “B 7 A” is a moderately paced hike of approximately 7 miles with steep climbs and/or descents and possible rock scrambling. 

If you join us for a hike, please understand that you are responsible for your own preparedness, including ensuring that the hike is appropriate for your level of fitness, that you wear the proper clothing, and bring the proper gear, food and water (see the ADK's recommended Hiking Essentials and guidelines, below).

Leaders have the right, responsibility and sole discretion to refuse any hiker he/she deems to be not properly attired, prepared, or otherwise fit to safely complete the hike. 

HIKERS' GUIDELINES:

  Risks:  As with all physical activities, hiking involves hazards. Persons participate at their own risk and will be asked to sign a statement acknowledging that fact before starting the hike. Prior to the hike please advise the leader of any medical condition or physical impairment that could affect you during the hike.

  Footwear and Clothing:  Wear clothing suited to the weather and carry extra garments for unexpected weather conditions. Dress in thin layers so that you can adjust the number of layers as required to maintain comfort. In winter carry a wool cap and wool or polypropylene gloves or mitts and a windproof shell. Be prepared for rain. Bring a rain jacket and rain pants, preferably of the type that permits venting body moisture. Wear comfortable, sturdy boots/shoes.  Do not wear cotton garments in winter.

  Drink and Food:  Adequate hydration is important year round. Drink frequently during the hike. Carry food to enjoy during the midday lunch stop.

  Other responsibilities:  Hikers with children under 16 and new hikers are required to contact the hike leader in advance to determine if the hike is suitable for them.  Minors under 16 are welcome on day hikes when accompanied by a parent or guardian.  No person under 18 shall participate in overnight outings unless accompanied by a parent or adult sponsor over 21.  The hike leader may refuse to allow a person to hike who is judged to be poorly equipped or unable to do the published hike.  Participants should get to the hike at least 10 minutes prior to the starting time.

  Maps:  The TC number indicates a NY-NJ Trail Conference map for the area of the hike. For example: TC-118 refers to the Southern Harriman Park map.

  Abbreviations:  NCA-No Calls After . . . , Pref.- Leader’s contact preference.

  Expense Sharing:  When car-pooling, passengers are expected to offer the driver funds sufficient to cover the cost of fuel, tolls and parking fees. A $3.00 minimum per person is recommended. Most hike trailhead meeting locations can be found on NY-NJ Trail Conference maps.

  Dog-Friendly Hikes:  Pets are not permitted on hikes unless the hike description clearly states that it is "dog friendly."  If it is, all hikers with dogs must abide by park leash regulations.
results.name: Johnsontown Circular

results.description:
If you crave more energy and vitality in your daily life, this program is for you. A simple, effective, straightforward group strategy session to help women who want to feel happier, healthier, lighter, and full of energy.

In this interactive session, participants will identify symptoms of hormone imbalance, learn strategies to start making sustainable changes and feel better than they have in years.

What You’ll Get Out of the Session

An assessment that will help you determine your primary imbalances and how to treat them
A step-by-step protocol you can share with your physician and plan for implementing it on your own
Information about the 3 most powerful hormones and how to get them working together

A map to help you stay on track when change feels difficult
Techniques and strategies to help you double your energy
Steps to handle life and stressors better
Suggestions on how to sleep restoratively…and wake up rested and nourished
How to amplify your happy brain chemicals and get your happy hormones playing on your team again
What to do (and what to avoid) when you’re trying to lose weight

Get on the fast track to soaring energy, better mental focus, healthier metabolism and an upbeat mood!

results.description:
With pleasure I invite you all~

to a remarkable gathering offered at an excellent price. 

The 4th Annual Tarot & Psychology Conference is coming up this spring, and you may register now. If you are a professional or a practitioner seeking stronger, deeper, more practical landscapes of effectiveness, this quick one-day conference is for you.

WHAT AWAITS YOU?

• Three great presentations from four great speakers, plus 

• Cocktail reception 

• Merchant Faire  

JOIN US~ where the ancient personal problem-solving tool of Tarot meets the modern practice of personal inquiry through psychology. 

WORLD CLASS PRESENTERS~

Rev. Jenne Perlstein MBBS (Medical Degree), BSW (Social Work) AASW (Accred) , Cert IV TAE, Prof Member Tarot Guild Australia, Cert Appl Astrology, CMC (Celebrant), Grad OSIS

Ellen Goldberg is both a psychotherapist and a mystic.

Elinor Greenberg, PhD, CGP, CPTR is a licensed psychologist and Gestalt therapist in private practice in New York City.

Ruth Ann & Wald Amberstone are co-founders of The Tarot School, which they began in 1995.

Tarot & Psychology Conference is the gateway to the big international convention for Tarot, which draws attendance for both the northern and southern hemisphere, far east and far west, and has more 1st-time attendees every year, than perhaps any other Tarot conference in the world.  This is the annual international bash~ those attending TP4 may wish to attend the whole grand slam, including the Wednesday Manhattan Bus Trip.

THAT MEANS THAT REGISTRATION FOR THE WHOLE WEEKEND GETS YOU HALFPRICE ON THE TAROT & PSYCHOLOGY CONFERENCE. 

Register for both, and your attendance at TP4 drops to $100.  

Either way, it's a heck of a deal!

Visit <a>www.tarotandpsychology.com,</a> 

or inquiries to tarot@tarotschool dot com.  

See you there!

For our second book, we had an overwhelming request for something modern, possibly a newer bestseller or critically acclaimed book. So let's try Thirteen Ways of Looking by Colum McCann. It's a collection of short stories which may or may not be a good choice for discussion -- We'll find out when we meet! It was published last year and received great reviews. Plus, it's only about 250 pages. Unfortunately it's not available as a movie adaptation but you can purchase it on Kindle or Audible.

It might be nice to mix up the classics and modern fiction/nonfiction, so start thinking of some ideas for our third book and feel free to submit them here: 

http://goo.gl/forms/qwklcsCL5r 

And, as always, if you don't make it through the book in time for our meetup, don't let that stop you from attending!

Finding the right co-founder is crucial for your success in all business, especially startups. One of the most common reasons startups fail has to do with bad chemistry between founders or a lack of sound decision making when entering into a partnership agreement.

Our online webinar will focus on best practices when searching for and engaging with potential co-founders. It is based on the experiences Startupblink co-founder Eli went through while building his startups. 

This event is a Free Online Webinar, happening via Blab, an application and webpage allowing video live conversations. The link to register and participate in the Blab session is:  

http://unbouncepages.com/blab-webinar-startupblink/

After you leave your details on the above link, you will get redirected to the blab event page, and after the event we will send you an email with a link to the recording and the slides.

This lecture is brought to you by our sister company, Lingolearn, an online language school where you can learn any language you wish with our private tutors from around the world. We have a special offer of 1 hour lesson in more than 20 languages with a private tutor for $15, only for StartupBlink meetup members. The lesson is money back guaranteed (no questions asked), so in case you are not happy with the lesson, we will  get your money back immediately. results.description:
Let celebrate Donald's 100 HVH Event! 

Do you know Mt. Beacon was Donald's 1st event! 

Trail info- We will be taking the steps from the Gateway park to the Red trail. The trail is 6 or 7 switchbacks up to the old casino with a very rewarding lookout point where you have sweeping views of the Hudson river and surrounding area. From there, we will head one more mile to the fire tower for even better views!!. We'll probably return by same route but there are also other trails we could take. 


Distance:: 4 miles round trip

Elevation gain:  1,300 feet

Gear: Headlamp/light, water, snack/dinner.

The First 0.8 miles of this hike is hard, and very steep with 1000ft. elevation gain.
Mount Beacon is the second highest point in the Hudson Highlands. Depending on the map, it may be called Mount Beacon or Beacon Mountain. The mountain consists of two peaks. The northern peak is 1531ft and has a series of radio antennas on its summit. The higher southern peak is 1610ft and has a lookout tower on its summit.
On a clear morning we will see the NYC skyline lights from the summit as well as views of the town of Beacon and the majority of the Highlands (including Storm King, Breakneck Ridge, and little Sugarloaf).

                                                     *************

This release extends and applies to, and also covers and includes, all unknown, unforeseen, unanticipated and unsuspected injuries, damages, loss and liability.

Your attendance on a hike signifies that you have read and accept the terms of this liability waiver. By signing up for this group or event you understand that you are attending all events AT YOUR OWN RISK. Organizers and Assistant

Organizers of this group are just that, we organize the events and hike together as friends. There are no leaders on these hikes, you are your own leader - This is YOUR hike
