results.description:
Updated March 7th, 2016

Given the warmth that has descended upon NYC, I am making Tuesdays/Thursdays active again, but at 5pm.

This is one of three sites/listserves that promotes weekly games that have been going on for many many years. Stall counts are used on occasion, cleats are optional, boundaries are flexible, and all skill levels are welcome!

There are two ways to stay in touch outside of Meetup.com:

- Follow us on Twitter: http://www.twitter.com/nycultimate
- Like us on Facebook: http://www.facebook.com/nycultimate

SPRING/SUMMER (Mar - Aug)

As the city warms up we play four times a week. Our main location is Riverside Park, with Morningside and Booker T Washington as backups.

There are four days that we play:

- Saturdays at 10am, Riverside Park (103rd and West End)
- Sundays at 12pm, Riverside Park (103rd and West End)
- Tuesdays at 5pm, Riverside Park (103rd and West End - Where we can!)
- Thursdays at 5pm, Riverside Park (103rd and West End - Where we can!)

Damien
[masked]

RIVERSIDE DETAILS

The Riverside location is all the way West just off the water between 102nd and 108th Streets. You can only enter the park at 103rd and 108th. The best way to get there is to take the 1 local to 103rd Street. Walk West until you see an entrance that takes you down to the fields through the park. After walking down the steps from the street, you will see a path that goes left and another that goes right. Walk down the left path until you see a stone wall and stairs that go down to the fields. From South to North there will be one small soccer field surrounded by a track (red 'A' on map), another field with two softball fields (closer to 103rd/104th st) and another that is a giant soccer field (closer to 106th st). After walking down the steps, you will see the small Soccer field on your left. Start from this Southern-most field and walk North on the path to find our game. If you see no one, the meeting spot is the South side of the large soccer field. This spot is identified on the map below, a small square with little dots around it. On days when we can't find space at Riverside, we will move the game to Morningside Park (West 110th St and Manhattan Ave).

MORNINGSIDE DETAILS

The Morningside location is at the corner of 110th Street and Manhattan Avenue. The best way to get there is to take the B or C local to 110th Street. You can also take the 1 train to 110th street at Broadway and then walk East. We will play at the South end of the baseball field parallel to 110th street so that we're not in the way of the baseball games. Riverside will be our backup if for some reason we need to change locations.

BOOKER T. WASHINGTON DETAILS

This location is between 107th & 108th Streets just West of Columbus Avenue. It's on the backside of the high school. The best way to get there is to take the B or C local to 110th Street. 

+++

OTHER SEASONS...

WINTER (Nov - Feb)

During the colder months we generally play two times a week depending on weather. Our main location is Riverside Park with Morningside as a backup.

There are two days that we play:

- Saturdays at 10am, Riverside Park (108th and West End - Big Soccer Field)
- Sundays at 1pm, Riverside Park (108th and West End - Big Soccer Field)
*Tuesdays/Thursdays at 6pm games don't last long due to decreasing sunlight.

FALL (Sep - Oct)

There are four days that we play:

- Saturdays at 10am, Morningside Park (110th and Manhattan Ave)
- Sundays at 4pm, Riverside Park (103rd and West End)
- Tuesdays at 5:30pm, Riverside Park (103rd and West End)
- Thursdays at 5:30pm, Riverside Park (103rd and West End)

results.description:
The adventure continues.

Welcome to Lice (or is that Lyce?... Not that anyone is literate enough to care in this floating cesspit), a city where an innocent young paladin can catch the eye of a bartending wench and end up married less than a day later. A land where multiple pirate lords vie to rule over the myriad stenches that wash over the reeking hulls of the ship carcasses that make up this hellhole. A land where an evil shadow sorcerer and his minions can whisk an entire party away to another dimension, yet he can't manage to mug a single old man without the help of a bunch of semi-competent adventurers. A land where incompetence abounds and madcap mayhem wait around every flea-infested corner.

Who is this Timmy, you might ask. Well, he is the aforementioned paladin of Aurora, mightiest goddess in the Auroran pantheon. His just and benevolent wisdom far exceed his thirteen years and make him an outstanding leader for a misfit band of moral reprobates who sometimes refer to themselves, for some reason, as the Lords of the Underdark, a title that has neither been earned nor recognized by anyone.
results.name: Timmy and the Lords of the Underdark

results.description:
**There are 100 people signed up for the league who are there every night REGARDLESS of who is signed up from Meetup - so don't worry about how many people have RSVP'ed just here on Meetup.  We just leave up the Meetup for any new people (that's you!) who would want to come join us.  There are ALWAYS a ton of people.** 

Who: Exactly 1 buttload of good people
What: FREE Dodgeball!...then bar party with everyone!
Where: Manhattan, Upper East Side, St Joseph School, 420 E 87th St
Why: Fun n stuff
How: read below...

Oh hi there person reading this.  My name's Ari.  You should come play dodgeball with us.  That's a fun game.  Remember that from grade school?  Yeah, apparently when you're an adult you're still allowed to do that.  Who knew?  Oh, and now we get to go to a bar afterward instead of back to math class.  So there's that.  Adulthood has its perks.

See, here's some photos of shenanigans:

Doesn't that look like those people are having good times?  That could be you having good times!  You're a people!  And good times are the best kinds of times.

---

FAQ

SO WHO ARE YOU?
So the deal is that we're the group in NYC that gets together to play dodgeball every week...because we are overgrown children.  Sometimes old school rubber playground balls, sometimes little soft jello ones, sometimes some foam ones.  We're not here to F you.  That's why it's FREE for new folk.    But we're more a community than anything (but how legit does our website look?!) and just a good group of people running around with a childhood sport...and then, you know, a bar after if that's your thing.  

I WANT IN!  BUT WHAT IF I'M BAD/SCARED?
We don't just throw you to wolves - we'll introduce you around, explain everything, and no experience or athleticism necessary!  No one's gonna bully you or not want to play/hang out with you for being "bad" - no one cares about that...that's what a dick would do.  And we're not dicks.


WHAT IF I'M LATE?
It's just dodgeball, relax.  Come and go as you please.  The earlier you get there, the more you play of course, but no worries.

WHAT ABOUT MY STUFF? WHAT DO I WEAR?
There are bathrooms to change in if you need to.  Everyone leaves their stuff by the side of the court.  Plenty come straight from work.  Whatever you'd want to run around in is cool for clothes.  You wanna come in your work suit?  Rock on.

THIS IS AWESOME.  IS THERE A LEAGUE?!  I WANT MORE!

There is a full league that goes on too, if you're interested.  Same deal - good or bad all welcome!  More formal with teams and schedules and trophies and costume themes and karaoke and drink deals and all... More info here: www.sandlotsportsnyc.com/register , but any questions just lemme know!

Any questions, don't hesitate!  We'll get back to you! 

facebook.com/groups/NYCDodgeball
www.sandlotsportsnyc.com


A firm embrace,
Ari

<a href="http://www.sandlotsportsnyc.com"></a>
results.how_to_find_us: www.sandlotsportsnyc.com
results.name: FREE Coed Dodgeball & Bar Party! Upper East Side - Soft safe jello balls

results.description:
Speaker's meeting at the Friars Club.

Stavroula Toska was born and raised in Sindos, a small town in Northern Greece. After receiving her degree in Marketing & PR she moved to 
Athens to pursue acting.  She went on to co-star in two of the most 
successful soap operas in Greek TV history. Soon after she moved to New 
York to study at the American Academy of Dramatic Arts.

Ms. Toska refers to her meeting with Academy Award winner Olympia Dukakis 
as "life changing". The two collaborated on Toska’s multi-award winning 
directorial debut, Beneath the Olive Tree, for which Dukakis served as 
Narrator and Executive Producer. The film is based on journals found 
buried on Trikeri; the Greek island that served as a concentration camp 
for thousands of women political exiles during the Greek civil war.

In 2015 Ms. Toska produced Livin’ The Dream, a comedic web series created 
by the Spurlock Sisters. The series takes a shot at the life of Kit 
Scanlon; a woman in her 30s who quits her job to pursue her dream of 
becoming an indie director goddess. Livin’ The Dream went on to win 
multiple awards in the festival circuit. The team is now developing 
seasons 2 & 3.

Ms. Toska is currently producing A Photographic Memory; a deeply personal 
documentary film about a daughter’s search for the mother she never 
knew through their shared love of photography, directed by Rachel 
Elizabeth Seed. She is also writing her first feature titled HOME, and 
developing a one-hour drama series, both based on true events.

6 PM Reception, networking with open bar and appetizers


7 PM Speaker

This meeting is included with Executive Forum membership.

Non members $95, guests invited by members $85.

To RSVP:

To pay by credit card follow this link: http://www.execforumnyu.org/#!membership/cfvg

To pay by check or cash: email <a>[masked]</a>, providing your name and contact information, and bring a check or cash to the event.

results.description:
Let's go check out the launch event for The Last Boy and Girl in the World by Siobhan Vivian! Here's a book description:

What if your town was sliding underwater and everyone was ordered to pack up and leave? How would you and your friends spend your last days together?


While the adults plan for the future, box up their possessions, and find new places to live, Keeley Hewitt and her friends decide to go out with a bang. There are parties in abandoned houses. Canoe races down Main Street. The goal is to make the most of every minute they still have together.


And for Keeley, that means taking one last shot at the boy she’s loved forever.


There’s a weird sort of bravery that comes from knowing there’s nothing left to lose. You might do things you normally wouldn’t. Or say things you shouldn’t. The reward almost always outweighs the risk.


Almost.


It’s the end of Aberdeen, but the beginning of Keeley’s first love story. It just might not turn out the way she thought. Because it’s not always clear what’s worth fighting for and what you should let become a memory.
results.name: The Last Boy and Girl in the World by Siobhan Vivian event

results.description:
How to build, manage and scale an effective engineering organization

Think hiring the best engineers is tough? What about keeping engineers engaged once they are a part of your organization?


Join us on April 28 for a conversation with Joel Spolsky, founder and CEO of Stack Overflow and Igor Shindel, CIO of AppNexus as they discuss what it takes to build and manage a world-class engineering organization.

Joel is a globally recognized expert on software development and is known by developers around the world for his blog Joel On Software. He is also known for founding Fog Creek Software, Trello, and Stack Overflow.

The event will also feature food, drink and interactive tech demos.
results.name: Tech Talks @ AppNexus ft. Stack Overflow Founder & CEO Joel Spolsky

results.description:
This month we have an amazing developer that will be focusing on his work for VR mobile applications.  Below is his information.

As always, if you are a developer or content creator, please feel free to bring any of your work so that you can share with the group.  

Also, if you RSVP'd yes and are not able to come, please update your RSVP by tomorrow afternoon so that people on the waitlist may attend.  

See you there,


dj

HIGH PERFORMANCE MOBILE VR USING CUSTOM SHADERS & VERTEX DISPLACEMENT

Perhaps the single most important technical aspect of VR development is maintaining a consistently high framerate.  VR developers know that can be challenging on high-end PC's, but what about mobile devices?  How can we reach the most users with a good experience?   Can we develop a Cardboard experience that will run at 60fps on the Galaxy S4? iPhone 5?  How about 60fps on the Galaxy S3 - a 4 year old smartphone?

Game developer and graphics programmer Brian Kehrer will discuss the high performance techniques developed while working with ustwo New York on Google's Cardboard Design Lab, and revisited 6 months later on Google's Arctic Journey - and how the team at ustwo eventually reached the goal of high performance VR on a wide range of current and last generation mobile devices
results.name: April (NYVR Meetup)

results.description:
Political opponents in this 2016 election season are each making their own assertions about what's wrong with this country, and what they'd do to remedy the problems. From our own ethical Humanist perspectives...what do we propose? What say YOU?

Bring your ideas to a Roundtable Workshop Session! Take your favorite color marking pen in hand,and pour out your visionary heart. We'll see the resultant HANDWRITING ON THE WALL! At a previous Humanist Meeting, our speaker had us on-our-feet and involved, instead of sitting and listening: this was a good move!

We need your experience, your ideas, and your participation, to help create this creative Workshop. Please suggest the categories that are uppermost on your agenda? Here are a few:

How can we Humanize this economic system? How can we earn a decent living in this country? What's wrong with our election laws? Is US foreign policy providing ethical leadership on the world stage? How do we respond to terrorism? Are US corporations doing their share to counter global warming? How can we promote alternative energies? What can we do to address police brutality and to change the school-to-prison pipeline? And what can we do to promote more equitable education in this country? How are these issues for a starters?

Please come when you can...after work or after school? We welcome your attendance and your participation.

We hope to see you at the meeting. Admission is free, but annual HSMNY chapter membership ($25.00 singles / $35.00 couples) is encouraged.

Call Beth at[masked] for more information.

Sincerely,

Steve James

HSMNY Executive Director

[masked]

results.description:
This talk is an open discussion surrounding the pragmatic philosophical nature of the future of Analytics. During the talk we will dive into the impact that the human-centric view the world has on the future of data creation, dissemination and consumption.

As part of the talk we will explore several of the paths big data analytics is taking, and especially those following recent advancements in Artificial Intelligence, Deep Learning, Augmented Reality and IoT.

At the heart of one of these paths resides the process of deconstruction and atomization of the dashboard. By breaking it down into its basic building blocks or objects (e.g., indicators, widgets, filters) and leveraging these data consumption atoms in new form factors and presentation layers, the enterprise data hero is about to be enhanced into a true omnipotent Data God. Minting Data Gods and Goddesses is at the heart of our pursuit and this discussion.
results.how_to_find_us: 330 W 34th St. 18th Floor , New York, NY
results.name: The Future of Analytics – Deconstruction and Atomization of the Dashboard

results.description:
Join other writers for an hour of focused writing!

6:00 - Start. Stake out a spot and either socialize or get a jump on writing.
6:30 - Get down to business. An hour of silence and solid writing!
7:30 - Brief follow up. People are encouraged to share experiences & ideas, network or take off as they like.

If you're spending too much time THINKING about writing, come and join us for a session of focused writing. No one will see what you've written or give you unsolicited advice.

WHERE: Milk and Honey Cafe located at 1119 Newkirk Ave. The closest train station is Newkirk Plaza on the Q line. Walk 3 block down Newkirk Avenue until you reach Westminster Road.


SOME TIPS:

Laptops are welcome. Remember to charge your laptop ahead of time!

Please buy something to support this organic cafe. It would make the owner smile.

Come on time. If you come late, we will have already started.
Bring headphones if you don't want outside noise distraction.

RSVP only if you can make it, and update as soon as possible if your plans change.

You will see progress in your writing project by spending the minimum of a single hour per week on it. This is your practice/focus time, so I hope to see you there.

Our first meetup (under new management) will be at the Duplex in the West Village, located next door to the famous Stonewall Inn. If you haven't gotten to go there yet, it's a really fun, popular space with two floors and a cabaret room, and an outdoor area as well. You can check them out here.

Their usual happy hour will be from 6pm-8pm, but members of New Gay Friends in New York City will be able to enjoy happy hour pricing all night long! Make sure that you tell the bartenders when you arrive that you are here for the meetup so that you can get a wristband, which will get you the happy hour prices all night, as well as let other members know that you are there for the meetup!

The best part is the happy hour itself- they have one of the best happy hours in the city: $4 beer, $4 wine, and $5 premium wells- such as Skyy Vodka, Bacardi Rum, Seagram's 7 Whisky, Jim Beam Bourbon, and Sauza Tequila!

Also, if you stay later, they have a fun drag show at 11.

Come hang out with your friends, and make some new ones! I look forward to seeing you all there!

David

Announcing Monthly Training Meetings And More!

AIP (in collaboration with Unique Photo) is pleased to announce it's newest program; monthly meetings around the themes of training, socializing and equipment swaps and cleaning. Join Rick Gerrity and see how he puts 350,000+ miles on his 2007 Xterra while photographing people and places from Small Town, USA. You’ll learn how to use your camera as a conversation piece to approach and talk to people anywhere to get that once-in-a-lifetime image. No boring Power Points, just a display of images and how they were made.  Be inspired to get out of your comfort zone!

The following images are a sampling of Rick's work:



About Your Host:

Rick Gerrity has been a published, professional photographer based in the NY/NJ metro area for over 30 years. "I specialize in people, product, location and street photography throughout the US and Canada and I have a passion for transforming seemingly ordinary, everyday moments into extraordinary images." His images of people include Paul Newman, Sylvester Stallone and Oliver Stone, as well as real-life reflections of street life in America's cities and towns, which he calls, "Hybrid photography at its best. Video and stills combined for the ultimate storytelling experience." Rick's commercial images include work for BMW, Panasonic, IBM, Sony and Oleg Cassini. His is the owner of Gerrity Photographic Inc/Rick Gerrity Photography.
results.name: Monthly Meetings-Rick Gerrity: Street Photography Techniques From Small Town USA

results.description:
The FLUX Art Fair (www.fluxfair.nyc) will be in it's 2nd year, showcasing some of the work of Harlem's best artists with public installations around the neighborhood. The event runs from May 3 - 31, but members of the group interested in volunteering for the Fair will be able to have a sneak peak with a pre-tour walk though of some of the installations locations in preparation of the fair. The tour will give you an overview of the Fair and an exciting first view so you can share the excitement with visitors.

Our Meetup

We'll initially meet at 124th street and 5th avenue, inside the park near the entrance (photo below), at 6pm. Leanne Stella - a member of the group and founder/organizer of the FLUX Art Fair - will be our guide to some of the installation locations for the Fair.

If you are into art, the volunteering for the Fair will be a good opportunity to interact with the artists and give you a great way to participate in the growing art landscape in Harlem on various weekend day(s) in May of your choosing (May 7, 8, 14, 15, 21, 22, 28, or 29th from 12:30 - 3:30pm).


At the end of the tour, we'll end up at Barawine (www.barawine.com) for their Happy Hour to socialize. We should arrive at Barawine between 7-7:30pm and all are welcome to join. Selected wines and beers are $6, selected sparkling wines and sangria is $7, & the Barawine Happy Hour ends at 8pm.


If you are running late, looking to catch up with the group on the tour, or have any questions, give Daniel a call at[masked]

Directions to Marcus Garvey Park

We'll meet at the entrance of Marcus Garvey Park at 124th Street and 5th Avenue. The closest subway stops are the #4. #5, or #6 trains to 125h Street and Lexington Avenue or the #2 or #3 trains to 125th Street and Lenox Avenue.

results.description:
Since 2011, our group has expanded to several hundred real estate investors who are constantly learning & earning together in NYC. Come and meet our EPIC Community of Local Real Estate Investors, build your network, and learn why real estate is IDEAL and why you should be involved with our community of real estate investors. 

Within our real estate investing community, we help train people with no experience to professionals who have been working in the real estate field for many years. So No license or experience is necessary, and if you are a professional, you are more than welcome to join us and learn how we create successful network of educated real estate investors.

Real Estate can be a very risky business which is why you need to network with other local educated investors, get educated yourself so you can invest in real estate, learn to save money on taxes, and build wealth. The bigger our community is, the more we can network and work together!

At this meeting we talk about the biggest money making opportunities (Wholesaling, Fix and Flips, Buy & Holds, Seller Financed Notes + Tax Liens/Deeds, Multi-Family/Commercial and Money Lending) for a Real Estate Investor in today’s market. You will get to learn about members that are investing in real estate and making $10,000-$100,000+ per real estate transaction, and we will also talk about how you can make  upto $10k per referral helping our community grow. 


To attend, simply RSVP & answer the registration questions for location!If you would like to bring a friend or business partner with you to the meeting, please email us their name, email address and phone number so that we can make sure they are registered for the meeting.
results.name: Learn About Our E.P.I.C. Real Estate Investing Community

group.name: The NYC Real Estate Investors Success Meetup Group

results.description:
Talent show with a twist. 
You don't need to put on a "show" for us. 
We want to experience the real & raw & unique.


Come and share your expressions, passions, stories... the things that make you... YOU. 

Things like: improv melodic gibberish, vulnerable poetry written from amidst a hurricane, free-style rap in Chinese, avant-garde Ukulele songs, or spontaneous stories bringing us to tears.

From the audience or on the stage, it's about inspiration, connection, and discovering a new kind of brave. 

A place with a warm, welcoming vibe, where you are free to be fully alive and we all want to see each other thrive.

We hope this experience is a fun release, and perhaps to find a sense of peace.

Give it a whirl, and see what could be!

https://youtu.be/Kv_V5fiDiBg

All are welcome to participate in the way that feels best to you! Supporting others is also super duper important, so feel free to just soak in the atmosphere from the audience.

If you'd like to share on stage, the sign-up is open mic style. Before the show, just put your name down and then you'll have up to 4 minutes to share.

6:15 - 6:30pm :: pre-stage mingle
6:30 - 7:45pm :: ON stage
8pm and beyond :: post-stage mingle, at the bar or back garden area depending on the weather.

The show is free with an optional $5 suggested donation. The venue, Pete's Candy Store, is not actually a candy store, haha. The bar will be open with drinks and some sandwiches too - please plan to support the venue when joining us, so they let us keep coming back! 

Yay!! See you soon!


Cheers,
Christina + Stef with an F
results.how_to_find_us: Walk in, past the bar, and you'll see there's a room with a stage. We're in there!

results.description:
THERE WILL BE A BRIEF Q&A: WHY YOU SHOULD ATTEND THE 2016 REASON RALLY - JUNE 4TH (SATURDAY) - THE MALL / WASHINGTON D.C.

-------------------------------------------------

The Evolution of New York City (HOW NEW YORK  CITY WAS MADE From 450 Million Years Ago):

APRIL 28, 2016 (THURSDAY) 6:30PM

NYC ATHEISTS MONTHLY MEETING

WE WILL WATCH AND THEN DISCUSS: HISTORY CHANNEL VIDEO: The Evolution of New York City (HOW NEW YORK  CITY WAS MADE From 450 Million Years Ago):


Evolution is not limited to birds, animals and humans.  Rocks evolve, mountains evolve, whole continents evolve--changing their shapes and breaking off from other continents.

You probably didn’t realize it, but New York City sits on the remains of mountains that 450 million years ago were as tall as the Himalayas. Although New York is one of the most man-made spaces on the planet--from the height of its skyscrapers to the position of its harbor--it is governed by the amazing forces of the Ice Age that shaped it.

Come on Thursday, April 28, and learn how our Manhattan Island evolved into the City That Never Sleeps that now holds more than 8 million people, the tallest buildings imaginable and harbors an artistic culture that the whole world looks up to. And it’s all because the Ice Age glaciers carved out a snug island between two rivers. 

Come, bask in learning the evolutionary geological progress of your city and discuss what the future might bring. Need we fear what ongoing evolution may bring?

-----------------------


LOCATION: SLC Conference Center, 15 West 39th St. (3rd Floor)

COST: $10 Voluntary Donation covers room rental.

=====================================

results.description:
DESCRIPTION: This monthly meetup covers algorithms. We'll split attendees into two main groups:

Whiteboarding skills : You'll solve algorithms in small groups, breaking off into your preferred programming language and working together to find a solution. Problems are provided and vary in difficulty, check out the Github for examples of past problems: https://github.com/WomenWhoCodeNYC/Algorithms

For Beginners : You'll pair with other members and practice answering easier algo questions. This group will be led by a more experienced developer who will help you out when you get stuck.

Schedule: 
6:30 Arrive/Network/Food 
7:00 Welcome from Women Who Code and Organizers 
7:05 Welcome from Betterment Engineering 
7:15 Meetup starts 
9:00 Event ends after solution presentation from volunteers

Resources: The WWCNYC Github contains questions (and solutions) from past events, as well as upcoming problems! Submit solutions, contribute interview questions and more: https://github.com/WomenWhoCodeNYC/Algorithms

Other resources: 

http://www.ocf.berkeley.edu/~kelu/interviews/questions.html 
http://katemats.com/interview-questions/ 
http://meetupresources.herokuapp.com/index.html 
http://codingforinterviews.com/practice

Resources for beginners or anyone who needs to review:

http://code.tutsplus.com/tutorials/algorithms-and-data-structures--cms-20437 
http://www.nczonline.net/blog/tag/algorithms/

For our beginners, we recommend creating accounts on either http://jsbin.com/ or http://codepen.io/, to give you an place to practice your algorithms problem-solving skills.

HOST: Betterment is the fastest-growing automated investing service, helping people to better manage, protect, and grow their wealth through smarter technology. The service offers a globally diversified portfolio of ETFs, designed to help provide you with the best possible expected returns for retirement planning, building wealth, and other savings goals. Betterment is a CNBC Disruptor 50 and Webby award winner and has been featured in the New York Times, Forbes, and the Wall Street Journal. Betterment helps people to achieve a smarter financial future with minimal effort and for a fraction of the cost of traditional financial services.

WWCode events are intended for all women (trans and cis), trans men, and genderqueer folks who are interested in attending. We are emphatically queer and trans friendly and committed to matters of social justice as an organization. Select events may be open to the general public, which will be clearly noted in event descriptions. Our Code of Conduct is in effect at all of our events. If you have any questions, please message the Directors of this chapter.
results.name: Algorithms @ Betterment

results.description:
About the talk:

Microservices are great - but if you are not careful you have just created a new set of silos. And response time is through the floor because a new service you have never heard of is hammering your app. The right tooling helps, but communication is even more important. 

In this talk, Lisa Van Gelder will discuss her personal experience with how the Guardian Newspaper made microservices work for them.

About the speaker:

Lisa has over 16 years experience in software engineering, including leading and managing software development teams. Her career has taken her between London and New York at companies ranging from small startups to large media organizations, including the Guardian newspaper and the BBC. She is currently VP of Engineering at Stride.
results.name: Agile in a World of Microservices

results.description:
Contact:   GEORGE[masked]

Trail info- We will be taking the steps from the Gateway park to the Red trail. The trail is 6 or 7 switchbacks up to the old casino with a very rewarding lookout point where you have sweeping views of the Hudson river and surrounding area. From there, we will head one more mile to the fire tower for even better views!!. We'll probably return by same route but there are also other trails we could take. 


Distance:: 4 miles round trip

Elevation gain:  1,300 feet

Gear: Headlamp/light, water, snack/dinner.

The First 0.8 miles of this hike is hard, and very steep with 1000ft. elevation gain.
Mount Beacon is the second highest point in the Hudson Highlands. Depending on the map, it may be called Mount Beacon or Beacon Mountain. The mountain consists of two peaks. The northern peak is 1531ft and has a series of radio antennas on its summit. The higher southern peak is 1610ft and has a lookout tower on its summit.
On a clear morning we will see the NYC skyline lights from the summit as well as views of the town of Beacon and the majority of the Highlands (including Storm King, Breakneck Ridge, and little Sugarloaf).

This release extends and applies to, and also covers and includes, all unknown, unforeseen, unanticipated and unsuspected injuries, damages, loss and liability.

Your attendance on a hike signifies that you have read and accept the terms of this liability waiver. By signing up for this group or event you understand that you are attending all events AT YOUR OWN RISK. Organizers and Assistant

Organizers of this group are just that, we organize the events and hike together as friends. There are no leaders on these hikes, you are your own leader - This is YOUR hike

results.description:
One of the most entertaining live acts in all of Celtic music is back in town on this night so we'll head down to the Gramercy Theater to see Gaelic Storm play New York once again.

If you've never been to a Gaelic Storm show before, then take advantage of this opportunity to go see them. There are few bands that engage the audience, make you laugh, and get your feet tapping quite like Gaelic Storm. They truly enjoy their craft as they play a mix of drinking songs, sea shanties, furiously strummed instrumentals and singalong melodies.

Led by founding members Patrick Murphy on vocals, accordion, piano, harmonica and spoons and Steve Twigger on guitar, mandolin and bouzouki, Gaelic Storm, which first found fame as the Irish band in the famous steerage scene of the movie Titanic, has played more than 3,000 live shows in nearly the last two decades. Here's a clip from their New Year's Eve show at the Gramercy Theater a few years ago:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=hAxKr1qAd2Q

Ryan Lacey (drums, percussion), Pete Purvis (uilleann, deger and highland pipes, tin whistle) and newest member Kiana Weber on fiddle round out the band's current lineup, which is truly an international effort with members hailing from Ireland, England, the US and Canada.

Since starting out as a pub band in Santa Monica, California in the mid-1990s, Gaelic Storm has topped the Billboard World Music charts five times. On this tour, the band will be supporting its latest release, last summer's "Matching Sweaters".

Meet around the corner at the Abbey Tavern, 3rd Avenue at 26th, starting at 6:30, showtime is at 8, we'll let you know set times as we get closer.

Tickets are $25, a bargain for a band this good. Click HERE to buy tickets online
results.name: Gaelic Storm at the Gramercy Theater; pregame at Abbey Tavern

results.description:
Prioritizing product development is one of the most complicated and important business decisions a technology company can make. If we prioritize the wrong experiences, our customers and products not only suffer from that choice, but also from the opportunity costs of not building the right things. Because prioritization can feel more like art than science, the marketing, sales, customer success, and product teams at your company may not always be aligned. This can result in mistrust and second guessing, which can lead to downstream mistakes. 

At NewsCred, we've built a process we call the Product Council that strives to relieve this pain across the organization. Our process engages the entire company in an auction that encourages collaboration and communication on tradeoffs. The Product Council meets once every quarter to "buy" customer challenges that they'd like to prioritize. This transparency encourages greater trust, transparency, and, we believe, better decision making on all of our product decisions. We will dive deeper into this during the Meetup and discuss many of the topics outlined in this blog post.

 Presenter from NewsCred:

Benjy Boxer, Director of Product Strategy at NewsCred

Benjy Boxer is the Director of Product Strategy at NewsCred, which is the leading enterprise SaaS Content Marketing software company, having raised $90 million from venture capital firms. NewsCred is disrupting the digital marketing technology space with software that helps Fortune 500 brands like Bank of America, Fidelity, Pepsi, Dell, and Visa. In his role as the Director of Product Strategy, Benjy is responsible for setting the long-term plan and strategic direction of the products NewsCred offers. In addition to his responsibilities at NewsCred, Benjy teaches product management at General Assembly and writes about media and technology for Forbes.com.
results.name: Gamifying Product Decisions: How to Align Your Team

results.description:
Come meet Khoi Vinh, Director of Mobile Product Design at Adobe and one of the most influential product designers working today. At Adobe he's been putting the attention back onto designers and the needs of the design community, working directly to create tools that move interaction design forward at a global scale.

Khoi is internationally recognized for bringing the tried-and-true principles of the typographic grid to the World Wide Web. He writes and lectures widely on design, technology, and culture, and has published the popular blog Subtraction.com for over a decade.

His career is global but started in New York. He was a founder at Behavior Design - a studio he helped manage and run for four successful years before leaving to become the design director for NYTimes.com. During his five-year tenure, he remade the way design is practiced at Times. He is also the author of a book, "How They Got There: Interviews with Digital Designers About Their Careers", the definitive look at how creative careers in digital media are built.


In 2011 he co-founded Mixel, which released a deeply influential iPad app combining the power of social networks and multi-touch tablets to let people from all walks of life make art. Khoi continues to work with, advise, and support startups and designers in New York City and around the world, and, with Adobe, he is helping to build the next generation of software for creative professionals.
results.name: Come meet Khoi Vinh, Director of Mobile Product Design at Adobe

results.description:
Hi Creative Apps Community!


Join us this month in celebration of the start of Creative Tech Week as we talk with folks who code as part of their creative process! We'll also have plenty of time for networking while having a beer and enjoying some pizza.

Featured guests:

China Blue

China Blue is an art pioneer who is a nominated two year Artist-in-Residence with the Norman Prince Neurosciences Institute at the Rhode Island Hospital. She has received two NASA/RI Space Grants. One was for her research of the sounds of meteorite impacts created by NASA’s Vertical Gun and she is the first person to record Paris' Eiffel Tower. She investigates and explores bioacoustics, ultra and infrasonic sampling devices, brain wave monitoring and robotic sensory avatars to enhance our perceptual world.

www.chinablueart.com


Eric Corriel

Currently living in Brooklyn, Eric takes the urban landscape as a medium in which to create site-specific video installations in the public realm. He teaches interaction design at the School of Visual Arts in New York City, where he is also Lead Web Designer and Developer.

www.ericcorriel.com

Daniel Temkin

Daniel Temkin makes images, programming languages, and interactive pieces that explore systems of logic and language. His esoteric.codes blog, an exploration of programming languages as art, was awarded the Creative Capital / Warhol Foundation Arts Writers Grant. He has presented at conferences such as SXSW, SIGGRAPH, CAA, and Media Art Histories, and his work has been a critic's pick for Art News, the New York Times, and the Boston Globe.

danieltemkin.com


Jesse Lee

Jesse is a developer and engineer who's passionate about technology's role in solving modern problems. His creations are broadly based, but music is a theme that keeps coming back to him. You might find him at random hackathons in the city, or building a desalinator on a rooftop in midtown.

mienaikoe.github.io

Schedule:

• Doors open at 6:30pm.

• We start at 7:00pm.

• Entry is possible until 8:00pm.

See you on the 28th!


- The Adobe Creative SDK team
results.name: CAC NYC: Developing for your art

results.description:
This is a free group for anyone who enjoys playing board games and would like to make new friends while doing so. No previous knowledge of board games is necessary. We're happy to help newcomers along with how to play, as well as how to plan strategies to win the games.  

Our event is every Thursday night at Dave & Buster's in Westbury Long Island from 6:30pm to 10:30pm.  You can leave prior to 10:30pm if you want, also please note that Dave & Buster's closes at Midnight for those who want to stay later. 

Most people arrive at 6:30pm.  We use the first 30 minutes to talk, order food/drinks, and pick out games while we wait for any people that are a little late.  Promptly at 7pm we split into groups and play our games that typically take 2 hours to play.  So, if you arrive after 7pm there is a good chance that you will not be able to get into a game and can watch us play if you'd like.  At the end of the night we play a couple of additional shorter games that you can get into.

This group meets in the Large Dining Room at the table directly in front of the wall with 9 Big Screen TV's (We are located 1 room over from the pool tables).  There is no cover charge to enter Dave & Buster's and plenty of parking is available. Also, there is no fee to join this meetup group. All that management at Dave & Buster's asks is that each person purchase $5 off their menu (it can be 1 appetizer, or 1 dessert, or a few sodas, basically whatever you choose).  

Plenty of board games will be present at this event, but feel free to bring some of your favorites. Some of the games that we play are Kingsburg, Stone Age, Lords of Waterdeep, Istanbul, Ticket to Ride, Carcassonne, Castles of Mad King Ludwig, Love Letter Batman, Splendor, Pirate's Cove, Five Tribes, Castles of Burgundy, and more.  

Here is a list of the board games I own on the BGG website: 

https://boardgamegeek.com/collection/user/MarkNY8?own=1&subtype=boardgame&ff=1

Here is a list of Co-Host Kenny's games on BGG: 

https://boardgamegeek.com/collection/user/kenk1982?own=1&subtype=boardgame&ff=1

Looking forward to meeting you. 

Mark

About IMC Club: IMC Club, through its nationwide chapters, provides organized “hangar flying” focused on building proficiency in instrument flying. IMC Club believes that safety and proficiency are developed through education and experience. Monthly meetings use real-world scenarios to engage our members and allow them to share and build their experience. Open to everyone. You do not have to be instrument rated to attend. Please bring your iPad or other device so you can look at charts as we discuss a real-world instrument flying scenario.


If you cannot attend this event and have registered online, please remove your registration so others may attend.

results.description:
TICKETS ON OUR SITE

---------------------------------------

Please note that you must have a ticket from Eventbrite (purchased through our site) to attend.

RSVP'ing on Meetup alone will not get you in.

3 Rules Every Mobile Product Needs to Be Successful

Presented by SC Moatti, Author of Mobilized

Price: $15 for early birds, $20 for regular

How do you go about creating mobile products used by billions of people? What are the new rules shaping the future of connected technology? Drawing from her work experience as an executive at places like Facebook, Nokia, and Opera Software, as well as extensive interviews with executives at mobile pioneers such as Airbnb, Pandora, and Uber, SC Moatti lays out the three rules that every mobile product needs to be successful.


SC Moatti is the author of "Mobilized: An Insider's Guide to the Business and Future of Connected Technology". While serving as an executive at mobile pioneers like Facebook, Trulia and Nokia, Moatti launched and monetized mobile products that are now used by billions of people and have received prestigious awards, including an International Digital Emmy Award nomination. Moatti currently runs Products That Count, an organization based in San Francisco that advises businesses on how to leverage mobile technology. She also serves on the board of directors of Opera Software, a global mobile technology company with over 350 million users. She speaks frequently at conferences, has been featured in Forbes and has written several articles on mobile technology for the Harvard Business Review and the Huffington Post. She is a lecturer at Stanford University, where she earned her MBA and has a Master of Science in electrical engineering.


Connect

We post discounts & freebies here:

Our Newsletter • Designers + Geeks Facebook • @DesignersGeeks


Satisfaction Guarantee

We organize this group to promote innovation, creativity, and the benefits of new technology. If you purchase a ticket and aren't happy with the experience, can't make it, or decide that you don't want to support the community for any reason, we're happy to refund your money.

Please note that if you do need to cancel your reservation, we request that you do so at least 24 hours before the event so that the tickets can be shared with others who may be waiting.
results.name: 3 Rules Every Mobile Product Needs to Be Successful

results.description:
CHECK IT OUT FOR ONLY $5 BUCKS! 


Welcome To The Writer’s Room 
 This is the only class of its kind—run like a real writer’s room on a 30 minute TV comedy series, taught by a professional showrunner with over 25 years of industry experience—and featuring the work of 12 talented student writers. You’ll not only learn how to write a half hour spec episode or pilot that can open the door to a job in Hollywood, you’ll actually write one for the show of your choice, and collaborate on the development of a script for a different show each week, just like they do in the big leagues.

What You’ll Learn
You’ll learn the elements of a successful half-hour comedy series, and how to write a pilot or spec episode that shows off your ability to create what every network, studio, and series producer is looking for: a professional grade script plays within the structure of the series for which you want to write, while showing off your unique talent as a writer. You’ll not only have real world experience of working in a TV writer’s room, you’ll also connect with a community of writers you can depend on, and the knowledge you need to write a professional grade pilot you can use to pursue a career in Hollywood. A Teacher You Can Trust With more than 25 years of Hollywood experience, Jerome has been a showrunner, writer, and producer on some of the most successful half-hour series in history, including “The Jeffersons,” “The Golden Girls,” “Frasier,” “The Nanny,” and “Married…with Children.” Now, he brings a lifetime of experience directly to you as your teacher, showrunner, mentor and coach.

Learn more.

NORMAL COST: $899

MEETUP MEMBERS: Check out the first day of this  10-week workshop for only $5 bucks with no obligation!

Class Size is Strictly Limited To 12 Students To Allow All Students The Opportunity to Workshop And Receive Feedback On Their Writing. 

You MUST RSVP to attend this event.

You'll LOVE this workshop or your money back!

results.description:
Join NYC Python for a night of talks about loosely and dynamically typed languages with no discernible syntax rules!

Talks:

Slicing Up Words with Python - Steven Butler

Morphological segmentation is the process of splitting words up in their component morphemes (smallest grammatical units in a language*) in order to improve a variety of downstream NLP tasks, like machine translation and keyword search. For well-resourced languages with well-understood morphological patterns (like English), this is no longer very much of an issue, but for low-resource languages (those that don't have a lot of NLP research done on them), this problem is a lot harder. I'll demonstrate a Python library called Morfessor (an interface to a family of unsupervised segmentation algorithms developed by a research team in Finland) that has been used for working on low-resource language segmentation, and talk a little bit about my work, which is trying to improve segmentation accuracy when morphological patterns get exotic**.

* e.g., 'words' -> ['word', 's']
** infixation, partial reduplication, etc.

Jargon-term Extraction by Chunking - Angus Grieve-Smith, Adam Meyers

One major subfield of NLP, Information Extraction (IE), deals with finding needles in haystacks - taking a huge corpus of text and pulling out the most important parts, like frequently used entities (people, places or things) and the relations between them.  At NYU we developed methods for extracting jargon terms - terms that are used more frequently in particular fields than in general writing.  These methods involved a combination of close annotation of the documents, algorithms to find particular patterns, and machine learning to extend the annotation.

N-grams: What they are and what you can do with them - Max Schwartz

I will touch on text classification, text generation, and how N-grams can fit in to solutions to problems like word segmentation and part-of-speech tagging.

The Ministry of Silly Talks


About our Sponsor:

Based in New York City, Vettery is a trusted hiring marketplace built to help tech candidates find their dream job. They take the best from the recruiting and technology worlds by connecting employers and talent through a curated marketplace of vetted candidates. Vettery currently works with over 1,000 companies including Uber, Jet, Etsy, Flatiron Health, Digital Ocean, SeatGeek, and Casper. For more information on being featured, please apply on vettery.com.

results.description:
The East River Park track is east of the FDR at East 6th Street. It is a little over a mile from the closest subway stops (6 to Astor Place or L to First Ave).

Thursday workouts change from week to week and will be announced in advance.

Important Information about East River Park Track: The Whippets have been running here for many years and have experienced thefts of our belongings. We will take extra precautions to keep our bags safe, but please avoid bringing valuables -- and it would be safest to run with your wallet on you.

Please be aware that there are limited overhead lights, so it gets a little dark, and during winter months the bathrooms are locked and the water fountains are off. If you have a bike, make sure you have a lock because you'll have to keep your bike outside the track area.

We recommend not bringing valuables to the track. You can drop stuff off at Ace Bar (531 East 5th Street between A and B) -- ask for Justin or Charlo and tell them you run with the team. 


See you there -- and please contact a Whippet captain if you have any questions!

results.description:
Join us at Genspace for another lecture presented as part of the Know Science series. Know Science is an international education and advocacy organization working to promote knowledge of science and scientific research to a non-specialized audience.

Dr. Barry E. Levin, MD of the Department of Neurology at Rutgers New Jersey Medical School will tackle the hard questions relating to obesity.

Is obesity due to food addiction?

Why is it so hard for me to lose and keep off weight once I become obese?

The good and the bad- what treatments are there for obesity?

What is obesity and how widespread is it?

Why is obesity important- what medical conditions that are a serious threats to your health are associated with obesity?

Is obesity inherited and how do early life events alter any inherited tendency to become obese?

What is the relationship among food intake, expenditure of calories and storage of excess calories as fat?

How does the brain and body communicate to regulate your food intake, body weight and adiposity?

During his early training as a resident in Internal Medicine at Cornell Affiliated Hospitals, Dr. Levin worked at Rockefeller University with Dr. Jules Hirsh, one of the founding fathers of obesity research, to assess various metabolic, physiological and psychological aspects of extreme caloric restriction as a treatment for morbidly obese individuals. He then went on to train in Neurology at Cornell and NIH and then to pursue a career in academic neurology at Dartmouth Medical School and New Jersey Medical School. His initial research interest in neural plasticity was supplanted by a long research career in the basic mechanisms underlying the ways in which the brain monitors and regulates the physiological and metabolic status of the body in animal models of obesity and type 2 diabetes mellitus.
results.name: The Obesity Epidemic: Why Some of Us Are Fat and What We Can Do About It

results.description:
You're invited to join us for this weekly opportunity to sharpen your drawing skills! This session is open to sketchers of all levels.

What makes our sessions different? 

• We start on time in a large, clean, well-lit space. 

• Sketchers can concentrate because our room is quiet while the model is posing.

• We have coffee and cookies at the long break. 

• We finish on time so you can be headed home at 9:00 p.m sharp! 

• (Latecomers can be seated at a break.)


• This is a two hour drawing session to work from a live (nude) model.  

• We start with short 2 minute poses and work up to a 20 minute pose by the end of the session. We take a 5 minute break every 20 minutes. 


• There are seats for everyone tables and several light weight easels. 


• Access to a sink is available for watercolor artist.

• Bring your own materials (no oil or acrylic paint and no sprays please.)

As always if you have any questions please feel free to email me. I look forward to seeing you there. 

Simon

results.description:
Algorithms are everywhere. From taking an elevator to your office to making music, we use algorithms every day to solve problems. Developers routinely use algorithms to solve programming issues such as:

How will I keep this credit card information secure when I send it?

How can I store this data so I can retrieve it quickly?

How do I make this file smaller so it is easier to share?

In this workshop, we will discuss what an algorithm is, introduce the idea of algorithmic complexity (big O notation), demonstrate sort and search algorithms (with a hands-on demonstrations), and finish with an overview of the many types of algorithms out there.

As a prerequisite, you should have basic familiarity with a programming language (like by having attended our intro to JavaScript workshop or know a back-end language). Not sure if you qualify? <a>Email us.</a>

About your instructors: 

Steph Zhang is a developer at BuzzFeed. 

 Nicolle Quintero is a back-end developer at CB Insights.


All attendees are expected to abide by the Girl Develop It Code of Conduct.
results.name: Intro to Algorithms

results.description:
3D Thursday 4/28: Getting Started with OpenSCAD presented by Laura Taalman (mathgrrl)

Learn how to create parametric and customizable 3D models with OpenSCAD, even if you've never written code before. Bring a laptop or a friend with a laptop.

---

3D Thursdays!

So... there has been a lot of fuss about this desktop 3D printing revolution thing for a while now. Still very exciting!

We have a new-old idea that leaps beyond the news hype and celebrates the wonder of the activity itself. Let's get together every Thursday evening to explore this broad field, in all of its many facets and manifestations. And get to know each other better -- from bold pioneers, to new adopters, from teachers to students, manufacturing experts, to code and electronics hackers. This is your space to grow and share.

Topics we might explore on a typical Thursday evening include:

- 3D design software and techniques. From getting started, to pushing boundaries.

- Explore more of the 3D ecosystem, from making use of 3D printing service bureaus to starting and managing your 3D Hub.

- How to prototype and develop your own physical products, tools, and artwork.

- 3D printing materials: strategies for fabricating in more than just 1-2 plastics.

- Casting and mold-making: from precious metals to candy bars.

- Finishing techniques. Sanding, painting, sealing, melting, deforming, decorating, hydro-printing.... Why just make things that look like plastic?

Let's spend time together sorting out better ways to use these tools, and better ways to design.

results.description:
This event is proudly brought to you by Soccer Beyond!

Learn more on SoccerBeyond.com or Facebook.com/SoccerBeyond.

Details - Fun, interactive, effective.

60min. This is a Coed Soccer Lesson covering soccer techniques for passing, receiving, dribbling, turning, and much more. 

Please bring your own ball. Sneakers, running and turf shoes are fine. Bring some water or sports drink and maybe sun blocker. Please note our Waiver of Liability and 24hr Cancellation Policy below. More details follow.


Rain or Shine - If you don't hear from us, the session is on!

Our sessions will be held as scheduled if weather allows. Thunder or snow and ice are among the reasons for sessions to be canceled/ moved. BUT: Don't make assumptions - you will always get notified if a class is canceled/ moved. As the weather changes quickly in NYC, occasionally we may make the final decision about 90min prior to session start. If you don't hear from us, the session is on!

Cancelled/ Moved Sessions - You will always get notified!

Every time we have to cancel a session, if possible, we move it to the same day and time of the following week. In this case, all players keep their spots. Please email us prior to the rescheduled event, if you can't make and wish a refund or credit. The 24 hours cancellation policy applies. You will always get notified if a class is canceled/ moved.

Requesting a Refund

To request a refund 1) change your status to "not going" and 2) send us a note with the Paypal transaction number related to the payment for the respective session. Refunds are processed once a week - please be patient.


24 Hours Cancellation Policy

A full refund/ credit will be given if cancellation is received at least 24 hours prior to lesson start. Full payment is required thereafter. Our cancellation policy also applies to package holders.


Waiver of Liability and Hold Harmless Agreement

By RSVP'ing for this event you certify that you are physically fit such as you are able to participate in this program. You therewith voluntarily release CoachFrankNYC/ Soccer Beyond, LLC from any and all liability resulting from or arising out of your participation and/ or receipt of instruction. You read and agree to the WAIVER OF LIABILITY AND HOLD HARMLESS AGREEMENT to be found on SoccerBeyond.com/pages/waiver.

Please let us know if you have any questions or suggestions.

Coach Frank  
M. [masked]

SoccerBeyond.com
[masked]


Feel free to like us on http://www.facebook.com/SoccerBeyond.

NYEdtech and EdSurge are teaming up again to host an edtech jobs fair on Thursday, April 28th from 7 - 10:00pm at Workville. 

So whether you're looking to share and apply your teaching experience with dedicated developers, or hunting for some coding and biz dev talent, or just want to see what is out there, make sure to sign up!

For edtech companies: We've got a limited number of company tables available for a small fee! There are also a couple sponsorships available. To reserve a table, inquire about sponsorships, and get additional information, shoot a note to [masked]

For job seekers: Please fill out a brief form about what positions you are most interested in. If you would like to share your resume with the companies in attendance, please attach your resume to the form above or send it to [masked] by April 26th!

The structure of the night: The jobs fair will kick off at 7:00pm with a brief introduction. This will be followed by an informal night of networking in the large meeting room that will be lined with company tables ( including New Visions for Public Schools, 2U, LittleBits, New Classrooms, Classroom Inc, etc). In an adjacent meeting room, there will be a series of short Q&A breakout sessions. The breakout sessions will give you a chance to hear more from select group of companies on what they have in the pipeline and what types of candidates they are looking for.

Confirmed Companies

• 2U

• Classroom inc

• CodeSpeak Labs

• Codesters

• C/I Interactive

• DigiExam

• EdSurge

• General Assembly

• LittleBits

• Manhattan Prep

• New Classrooms

• New Visions for Public Schools

• Oneder

• PlayMada Games

• Saint Joseph's College

Lastly, we want to say a big thank you to our jobs fair sponsor New Visions for Public Schools! New Visions for Public Schools is a team of highly dedicated individuals working together to make a difference for NYC's highest need students.  We are looking to hire top talent for several full time positions in our NY Office: Data Analysts, Application Developer, and Information Security Officer. In addition, New Visions is embarking on a new initiative, RISE Network, in Connecticut, which aims to advance data systems and college and career readiness in CT schools.  For a full listing of our career opportunities, visit:  http://www.newvisions.org/careers

results.description:
NON-Mainstream “FAMOUS NATHAN” movie screening.

On Thursday, April 28th  7:00 PM, the very laudable cultural preservation organization CITY LORE <http://citylore.org> will be screening the new film, “FAMOUS NATHAN” about the history of Nathan Handwerker and his world-famous Coney Island hot dogs. The screening will include a Question and Answer session with the Director, Lloyd Handwerker.
There is a trailer: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Oq7RTICOitI


Famous Nathan Film Screening and Q & A with the Director, Lloyd Handwerker
creatively interweaves decades-spanning archival film and video, family home movies, a Coney Island-inspired score, never-before-heard audio from Nathan recounting his immigrant experience and intimate, sometimes hilarious interviews with family and workers reflecting on hard work, fighting and food.
A Q&A session with the director, Lloyd Handwerker, will follow the screening. <https://www.eventbrite.com/e/famous-nathan-screening-and-qa-tickets-24330346722>

Thursday, April 28th  7:00 PM
City Lore Gallery (56 East 1st Street, New York, NY, 10003)

results.description:
We're excited to announce the launching of new staff-run RPG events at the Brooklyn Strategist! Check out the details for each event below, and be sure to RSVP for your table by following this link: bstrat.eventsmart.com

D&D 5E, "Lost in the Sands": Dungeons & Dragons is a game take on heroic roles and interact with each other and the Dungeon Master to experience fantasy, fights, and epic storytelling. Run by the Strategist’s professional Dungeon Master Ben Williams, this program will offer guidance to beginner players new to the rules of Dungeons & Dragons (5th Edition), while still providing a veteran level experience. The campaign will be set in the Dungeon Master’s custom world, Unisum, allowing players a greater degree of character customization and incorporation into the world’s story, while still using 5th edition basic rules and content as a base. Play will consist of a mixture of roleplaying and combat with a focus on long-term story. Character creation, background-building, group play style and other game elements will be covered in the first session. Please contact Ben at [masked] with questions. This campaign will be supported by an Obsidian Portal webpage. Campaign details and background lore can be found at https://lostinthesands.obsidianportal.com/.

Call of Cthulhu 7E, "Masks of Nyarlathotep": Call of Cthulhu is a game of surreal horror in which players strive to uncover a vast and mysterious cosmic conspiracy before losing their lives or their sanity. Run by the Strategist’s professional Keeper of Secret Timm Woods, this program will offer instruction to players new to the rules of Call of Cthulhu (7th Edition), while accommodating advanced play for veteran gamers. Players will begin with the classic introductory Call of Cthulhu scenario “The Haunting” before transitioning into the award-winning “Masks of Nyarlathotep”. Character creation, background-building, and other elements of campaign play will be covered in the first session. Please contact Timm at [masked] with questions.

Remember that signing up for the Meetup event does NOT guarantee you a spot. Follow the link to our registration page and reserve your seat for free immediately!
results.name: Thursday Night RPGs @ the BStrat (Cthulhu & D&D Homebrew)

results.description:
Get ready to get happier simply by talking about happiness! We'll be in the cafe. Look for our red Meetup sign. Please feel free to arrive late or leave early. It's great if you can RSVP in advance, but in case you can't, come anyway.

As a reminder, this group has two goals. The first is to explore the relationship between happiness and goodness. The second, much more fun, goal is for us to become much happier just by getting together and talking about happiness. The theory behind this second goal comes from a classic psychology study showing that by simply talking regularly about happiness we can become much happier.

While we'll often have set topics, like gratitude, acts of kindness, meditation and other happiness techniques, the following list of 14 topics will serve as a backdrop for our discussions.

1. Keep busy and be more active
2. Spend more time socializing
3. Be productive at meaningful work
4. Get better organized and plan things out
5. Stop worrying
6. Lower your expectations and aspirations
7. Develop positive, optimistic thinking
8. Become present oriented
9. Develop an outgoing, social personality
10. Work on a healthy personality
11. Be yourself
12. Eliminate negative feelings and problems
13. Close relationships are the number one source of happiness
14. Put happiness as your most important priority.

Here's some background on the research our group is based on.

In 1980 three New Zealand researchers found that after eight 2-hour conversation sessions about happiness over four weeks, their subjects reported a 22 percent increase in their happiness. Continuing their twice-weekly sessions, by the sixteenth week they reported being 42 percent happier.

Our list of topics comes from Fort Myers, Florida psychologist Michael Fordyce's "14 Fundamentals of Happiness." In 1977, Fordyce pioneered the science of happiness-increase with the world's first experiment designed to boost individual happiness.

That's the group, and those are our goals. It's also very, very important that we have fun. With that in mind, let's get ready to get good and happy!

Resources:

For those interested in learning about the major findings from social science research about happiness, and becoming happier, here are links to several excellent peer-reviewed articles that can be downloaded as pdf files for free. (Note: Although these classic articles are somewhat dated, decades of research on happiness reveal that findings on happiness tend to be extremely stable over time.)

Pursuing Happiness: The Architecture of Sustainable Change
By S Lyubomirsky, KM Sheldon and D Schkade, 2005.  21 pages

In Pursuit of Happiness: Empirical Answers to Philosophical Questions
By P Kesebir and E Diener, 2008. 9 pages.

Subjective Well-Being: Three Decades of Progress
By E Diener, EM Suh, RE Lucas and HL Smith, 1999. 27 pages

results.description:
Thank you to those who came to our past events.  From your comments I could see that you all had a great time and wanted to continue with this great experience to enjoy Peruvian food.

Here is one more opportunity to taste Peruvian food during April.  Continuing with the eat@Lima series promoted by the Trade Commission of Peru in New York, on April 28 at Surfish Bistro 2 in Brooklyn.

 I also would like to announce another great event for those who like spirit. On Friday April 29 we will have a great party to enjoy Pisco and taste different Peruvian dishes:  7 Piscos: 14 Cocktails at Midtown Loft and Terrace on 267 5th Ave. Manhattan. Find the tickets in the announcement please.

Remember that we will raffle two tickets to fly to Peru by the end of the month of April, where all the attendees from the first meetup to the last date in April will be included. The date of raffle will be April 29. (You do not need to attend all to the meetups or even be present at the moment of the raffle, if you participated at any of the meetups you will automatically enter in the raffle).

Surfish Bistro @ Park Slope Brooklyn

Meet celebrity chef Miguel Aguilar from “Knife Fight” as he creates the perfect 16-course tasting menu that blends explosive Peruvian flavors with great drinks! Space is limited, so make sure you buy your tickets in advanced and enjoy a wonderful meal at his self-owned restaurant, Surfish, in Brooklyn.

Date:   April 28. Sign up for any of the dates or all.

Restaurant: SURFISH BISTRO 2

www.surfishbistro.com

Address: 550 3rd Ave, Brooklyn, NY 11215

Price: US$ 70.00 (If you like the food, please leave a tip to the waitresses)

Purchase your tickets at:</a>  <a href="https://www.eventbrite.com/e/eatlima-new-york-event-series-tickets-24272177737">https://www.eventbrite.com/e/eatlima-new-york-event-series-tickets-24272177737

What’s on the Menu?
results.name: Peruvian taste Night with Chef Miguel Aguilar from "Knife fight"

group.name: New York to Peru - Culinary Travel  Meetup

results.description:
The Place: Bouley features the exciting culinary talents of famed four- star Chef, David Bouley. Bouley offers French cuisine with modern Asian influences served in an elegant and intimate setting.

http://www.davidbouley.com/

Note: I will not attend this event. The reservation is under my name, Fay Kambos.


RSVPs: Please do not RSVP No. You only need to RSVP if you want to come to the event.

Please don't RSVP unless you are sure you can go. I notice the people who RSVP and then cancel, which is not fair to everyone else. I reserve the right to give priority to people who don't do this in the future. I'm not trying to be mean but it makes it much harder for me when people take spots and then cancel either quickly or last minute. Obviously more notice is better, but please try to only sign up (for waitlist as well) if you know you can come. 

Even if the meetup is full, please put your name on the waitlist. I will let you know if a spot becomes available. Also, if there are a lot of people on the waitlist, it lets me know which kind of restaurants are popular so that I may schedule more of those in the future.

Please note that meetup events are strictly for members. No +1s are allowed as reservations are made in advance and spots are assigned. First time members must confirm in writing that they will attend. Individuals that are no shows are immediately banned from the group. Thanks.
results.name: Bouley - One Michelin Star

results.description:
Hello all,

Fellow Raven fan and group member Steve Walker has hooked us up with an open bar deal for the first round of the NFL Draft at Mockingbird! It's $40 for unlimited well drinks and all beers from 7pm - 10pm and they will have the draft on with full audio the whole time. Info on food specials coming later. 

Come on out and see who we will be selecting in the first round, say "Hi" to the Ravens friends you haven't seen in a while and chat with me about details of the upcoming trip to see the O's play at Yankee stadium that I'm planning for the group! 

Please RSVP, so we know how many people to expect!

Go Ravens!

Lily

results.description:
Its open board game night! Grab some friends and your favorite board game and head on over to the Highlander location in Boonton to have some fun.  Don't have a game, or interested in playing a new one?  We've got an extensive demo library open to everyone so feel free to pick whichever game strikes your fancy, grab a group, and play. 


Additionally there will be a featured demo of a different game each week, I'll be updating this meetup each week so you guys know what we've got. 


Other than that feel free to use this meetup as a way to organize your own games for Thursday nights, we've got space for everyone and plenty of people already show up so picking up a group should be no problem at all.  Hope to see you there!
results.name: Open Board Game Night

results.description:
ALL THURSDAYS at Neolyth will focus on Tarot cards, playing cards aka Destiny Cards, divination with Runes and different oracle cards...


This is a great opportunity to practice your intuitive skills, learn the ancient archetypes of the Major Arcana - 'great secrets' of Tarot as well as the Minor Arcana, which stem from the 'good old' playing cards, which were used by the Egyptian scholars to read one's destiny.

This gathering is suited for all levels of knowledge about divination and channeling. The renown 'psychic' sense is simply the ability to hone one's regular perception into a more refined and ethereal level of seeing, hearing, and imaging.
results.name: Tarot Thursdays @ Neolyth

• Share your talent!

• Come to enjoy the show!

Hosted by Howdy Stranger, Hackensack's own Comedy Improv Troupe


This is our monthly Open Mic Night at the Johnson Public Library in Hackensack, NJ. This month's featured artist is Toney Jackson, Poet.


Toney Jackson has been recognized by the Academy of American Poets, won several poetry slams, and been a featured reader, performer, and workshop leader, at schools, theatres, and other venues across the country.

Performers are invited to share any form of entertainment, while other are encouraged to come and support local artists and enjoy the show!

(This program is intended for adults. Some content may not be suitable for children.)

results.description:
Don't be intimidated by the title. This is still a go-at-your-own pace run, with stops and looping back for people. We just kindly suggest that you take it at your not-so-casual pace, whatever that may mean to you.

We will meet just inside the 52nd Street entrance to Windmuller Park at 7:15pm and head out for a 6ish mile loop through Woodside, Sunnyside, LIC, and Greenpoint, before returning to the start.

For our evening runs, we will wait up to 10 minutes to allow for late-arrivals. This can mean we will wait for 2 minutes or 10. Please be prompt. 

If there is interest after we complete our run, we may venture to a pub for snacks and/or beverages.


- - - - - - 
 Please see our full calendar of events
http://www.woodsidesunnysiderunners.com/events/calendar/
connect with us on Google+
http://www.google.com/+WoodsideSunnysideRunners
like us on Facebook
https://www.facebook.com/WoodsideSunnysideRunners
and follow us on Instagram
https://instagram.com/woodsidesunnysiderunners/
- - - - - -
results.how_to_find_us: We meet just inside the 52nd Street entrance to the park, by the track.

results.description:
Join us for our weekly gathering. As your busy week almost comes to an end, unwind with other similar-minded progressives over liberal libations.  

You can find us in the covered upper deck of the backyard -- look for a large banner on the wall, like the one shown above.  The NYC Chapter of Drinking Liberally has been gathering at Rudy's Bar & Grill since our in inception in 2003.
results.name: Weekly Thursday Meetup

results.description:
The Champions is an inspirational story about the pit bulls rescued from the brutal fighting ring of former Atlanta Falcon’s star quarterback Michael Vick, and the organizations who risked everything to save them, despite pressure from PETA and The Humane Society of the United States to euthanize the dogs.  It is a story of second-chances, redemption and hope. This uplifting documentary takes us on a journey about much more than just dogs—about prejudice, being misunderstood, the power of resilience, and the significance of the relationship we as humans have with animals.  Featuring the lifesaving work of Best Friends Animal Society.

Go to: https://www.tugg.com/events/95390 to reserve your ticket
results.name: "The Champions", promoted by Pets Alive Sanctuary, Middletown NY

results.description:
Futsal Pick up games (intermediate to advanced level)

Fee: $12 dollars per player per game; pay through Paypal.

One game is 55-60 minutes. Be early. Every player rotates at the goal for 6 minutes, timed with an electronic scoreboard. NO breaks. Regulation size goals with nets. professional  futsal ball. Please make sure to bring a white and a red t-shirt, indoor shoes, games are competitive, but friendly. Sorry, no beginners. 

Zero tolerance to fouls . “Futsal is a technical game, not physical”. Minimum physical contact means fewer injuries and no violence. No charging, no displacing with your arms or body to gain position on the ball. No running into the opponent. Play the ball, not the player. 

Refunds: only for 24 hour cancelation. must send a meetup message with the paypal Transaction ID: 17 numbers. 

The Name of the school Beacon HS 

For questions: Use the MEETUP message and notifications tools. 

Post pictures and videos at:

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/Futsalacrossamerica?ref=hl

Twitter: https://twitter.com/FutsalAcrossA

Thank you for being part of Futsal Across America.

Enjoy the game!
results.how_to_find_us: soccer, indoor soccer, futsal, new york futsal, futsal across america, futbol, futbolito, fifa
results.name: Midtown FUTSAL Thurs 7:30pm @ 44th & 10th ave; BEACON school

results.description:
In the past it was common to think that happiness lies in and depends on food, sex, family, money, respect and education. 

Today we are able to understand that real happiness depends on higher desires. Sometimes it seems to us that if we were to get all kinds of material things it would bring us bliss, and so we devote time and energy to pursue them.

Nevertheless, we can already sense that this does not fulfill us in a lasting way. After our development over thousands of years, and evolution of our needs and desires, humanity today is finally coming to understand what it is truly missing for true and lasting happiness.

"Love, The Path To Happiness":

  • Gain knowledge about the sensation of happiness

   • Become familiar with the concept Love Your Neighbor As Yourself

   • Leave with an understanding of how happiness is created 
     and the method that can help to attain happiness in life

   • Experience the power of connection through discussion circles

Join us and other like-minded seekers!

Kab Nights is a great way to get acquainted with authentic Kabbalah in a casual setting, guided by experienced instructors. Through original Kabbalistic texts, lively discussion, rare videos and all the coffee/tea and cookies you can have.

We promise you a unique evening. 
Please come on by and tell your friends!

Register FREE here: http://kabnights.kabbalah.info

We can't wait to see you!

-- 
BNEI BARUCH is a non-profit educational organization dedicated to sharing the authentic wisdom of Kabbalah with all people regardless of nationality, gender or cultural background, according to the method of Baal HaSulam.
